review.title: Hot spot to be
review.reviewText: The SFMM had it all right there for you.  Whatever you had in mind to enjoy, this is the place to be.

review.title: Always a safe bet in SF
review.reviewText: You can count on Marriott to deliver in the City.
review.negativeRemarks: $70 valet fee kinda steep!

review.title: Close to town
review.reviewText: Very expensive parking need to pay for internet in room

review.title: Great Great Place
review.reviewText: I loved it. the roof top bar was so fun and the view was spectacular. Our room was great too everything pristine!! I will stay again. My cousin recommended it to me I'm glad I listened to him.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. The Rooftop bar, seating area nd view were our favorite.
review.negativeRemarks: Cant think of anything at the moment
review.locationRemarks: We went to a Baseball game but were able to stay in and relax on the roof top and not have to go anywhere to us that was perfect.

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great service and restively close to the popular tourist attractions without being in the middle of the confusion.

review.title: Dan the concierge was very helpful.
review.reviewText:
The cleanest place in SF other than the airport. After touring, it felt
wonderful to return to clean and comfortable room.
review.positiveRemarks: Refrigerator,bath tub, and place to print boarding pass.
review.negativeRemarks: Microwave in rooms or floor for guests to use.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to Target and Walgreens

review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Very nice amenities in the lobby. Nice food options. Fitness center is amazing. Great location. Front desk staff very friendly.

review.title: Perfect location in Union Square
review.reviewText: Able to walk everywhere you need to go.  Utilized valet parking at $70 per day, but worth it, if you plan on walking most of the time.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent view of city at rooftop bar. Customer service was great and fast. Easy check out. Plus they let us check in early coming from LA that meant alot. There are stores just a cross the street and shopping certain around the corner. Located in a good area. The only down side of the hotel is the parking fee is 70 bucks a day I think hotels should have free parking so we went to find parking somewhere else.

review.title: SFMOMA trip!
review.reviewText: My check in experience was with a wonderful man named Bill and he was helpful and kind, Bill made me feel right at home from my first step into the Marriott. My stay was everything I had hoped it would be and more. Great location, comfy night of rest and easy in and out of the city! I only wish my stay had been longer!!

review.title: Hotel Downtown
review.reviewText: Convenience is all you get. Everything else was a rip off. You would think for the price that wifi would be included. Nope neither is parking. Parking is 70 Usd and wifi is 15 Usd. Did I mention they dont have room service!!! When asked they told me its a new type of concept. To me that isnt new, that is a motel type of concept with Hotel prices. Will never stay again.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText:
This is a very large hotel, and actually there was a Comic con event going on during the time I stayed there, it was actually fun to see the crowd around. 

I enjoyed my stay at the Marriot. In terms of the hotel itself, the room was nice and clean. The hotel's staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel has a pantry that stays open late, which is convienent. Also, has a good resturant/bar. 

The location is one of the hotel's best features; close to many public transportation options (Cablecart, taxies, metro stations), Westfield mall is also nearby, and many resturtants to pick from and chose from. 

It would recommend it!

managementResponses.response:
Greetings Nicky,
We appreciate you taking the time to share your review of your recent stay at the Marquis. It was a pleasure to learn you enjoyed our location and your dining experience. However, we regret not all of your expectations were met during your time with us. We do hope to have the opportunity to host you the next time your travels bring you back to San Francisco.
Kind regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Typical large chain hotel with good location
review.reviewText: Very busy and expensive,  This hotel has a great location for business travel or people attending events at AT & T stadium.  Parking is difficult and expensive, leave the car at home and take cabs.  We were shocked at the price of the breakfast buffet, but the food was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was small.  Parking and breakfast were very expensive
review.locationRemarks: Close to China Town, AT& T Stadium and Pier 39

review.title: Friendly staff, good area, comfortable room
review.reviewText: Good place to stay en SF, staff was very friendly, room had good space. Hotels can be very noisy, but we got a corner room with big windows, quite a view and very quiet. Curtains were able to block all the sunlight, very comfortable. Nice room to relax. Convenient area, close to shops, restaurants, museums.

review.title: Nice Room
review.reviewText: Room was spacious and clean. No room service after 11. Could not find a place anywhere nearby to eat after a very late check in. Only option was ordering pizza. Yuck. Could not park car with valet before going to an event due to a conference at the hotel. Line was several blocks out. Forced to pay top dollar to park elsewhere then move car to hotel for another $70. They were ill prepared for the number of people in and out that weekend. Wanted to have a bloody mary at their famed bar up top before departing but it doesn't open until 4pm.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: good location for exploring the city. all OK, Marriot standard. Change towels, they are very old and the bathroom has smell of moisture.

review.title: Good location next to Target and Starbucks!
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to Union Square next to Target, Starbucks, a little park, you can walk to several places to eat. Would def stay here again!

review.title: Would book again
review.reviewText: Great experience, no surprises everything you would expect from a modern chain hotel.  Nice rooms, nothing over the top, but nice.  Great lobby and fun restaurants close by.  Also public parking garage right around the block which is $30 a day vs the hotels $70 a day.

managementResponses.response:
Dear bpnissan,
Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to San Francisco. It was disappointing to learn our food and beverage offerings did not meet your expectations. However, it was a pleasure to hear you were able to experience some  fine restaurants just steps from our door. We hope to serve you again soon.
Warm regards,
San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: no meal room service, breakfast prices too high
review.reviewText: Main lobby restaurant very expensive, guest have to leave the hotel for affordable breakfast/dinner

review.title: Nice hotel for more relaxed/quiet stay
review.reviewText: Staff and hotel itself were great and clean. This is the type of hotel to be at with family or loved one. If younger look to stay by the wharf. This hotel was central to many restaurants and scenic things.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights.  This was a nice hotel well located, convenient and within walking distance to everything in Union Square.  The room was very clean and well maintained by staff.  All the staff were very friendly and helpful.  If you are into working out it has an amazing 2 level gym.  We had snacks at the restaurant that were well priced and very good.  The only downside is that the hotel is so large it was a bit of walk to the elevator each day.  Would definitely stay here again.

Cheers
review.negativeRemarks: need another elevator

review.title: Nice hotel, conveniently located.
review.reviewText:
I was in San Francisco for my birthday, attending a Giants game.  We've stayed at this property before and enjoyed the hotel.  
Most importantly m when I got home, about 80 miles away, I couldn't find my iPad. I remembered using it in the lobby while waiting for my daughter to pick us up.  I thought I'd put it in my bag but somehow it didn't make it home. I called the hotel and they had it at the heir lost and found.  So, having been home for 10 minutes, I turned around and drove back to San Francisco.  When I first talked to Housekeeping, they told me I had to be there by 10 PM.  When I go stuck in traffic I called Mariott back and the gentleman said someone would wait for me.  I got there by 10:00 and the folks gave me a bottle of water while I waited for the tablet.  I'll stay there again without thinking twice...
review.locationRemarks: Close to financial district and AT&T park.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to share your impressions. The uncharacteristic challenges you encountered during your visit concern us and we will be sure to discuss your experience with the appropriate management.
Best regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Most terrible place I have ever stayed.
review.reviewText: People are rude and absolutely ignorant.  Couldn't even get directions to anywhere!  Prices were outraged, and people couldn't even tell you where the best places where to eat.  They didn't even offer to tell you where any of the attractions were.
Beautiful hotel, helpful staff, and great location. Really enjoyed my stay!
Great stay! Nice room! Great staff! Good location....................................................

review.title: Very nice hotel, not the greatest neighborhood
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel.  We found a great price for it on expedia.  The hotel staff was very helpful and the room was very clean.  It was also very quiet, which was a nice surprise for a San Francisco hotel.  The beds are comfortable but quite small.  The valet parking is expensive, but there are public parking garages located very close by for half the cost.  The only drawback to this hotel was the neighborhood.  It didn't feel the safest.  We witnessed a few fights and had a few people say things to us as we were walking to public transportation that made us uncomfortable.  Other than these few instances, we really liked the hotel itself.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were clean and the hotel staff was very helpful.
review.locationRemarks: The location is right next to a huge shopping mall and a few blocks away from Chinatown.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Alejandro,
We appreciate the time you have taken to share your review. We sincerely apologize for the lapse of service and hospitality you encountered. Thank you bringing your experience to our attention. we hope that you will give us another opportunity to host you whenever you return to the area as we are confident that we can provide a better experience.
Warm regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Nice location, in need of  guest oriented managen
review.reviewText: I have felt unwelcome in one star hotels, but to feel this unwelcome and  the rudeness of the personnel  in a 5 star hotel with a 5 star price is a first for me.

review.title: Well located
review.reviewText: Well located, friendly staff, usual Marriott service and amenities. Great roof top lounge with excellent views

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: Hotel was centrally located in city, close to transit and the Bart if you don't want to drive in city. Hotel was comfortable with nice bar on first floor, and another bar with a great view on the 39th floor. no sit down restaurant in hotel if you come with kids. Only problem with location was the amount of homeless along sidewalks in area. But that seems to be same issue in most large cities.

review.title: Incredible Staff
review.reviewText: From the front desk to the lounge to the concierge, we had nothing but great service! You know, the kind of people that ENJOY what they do and make you feel well taken care of. The rooms were decent Marriott quality and the location was wonderful for accessing public transportation.

review.title: Phenomenal location and a homely feel
review.reviewText: Great location - mels drive / westfield / Bloomingdale's/ cheesecake factory ... great shopping, loads of choices in eateries, hotel is swarming with business travellers, families with kids as well as tourists..an excellent mix. The staff were very courteous and even though very busy - were very accomodating with our needs

review.title: Marriott is always good.
review.reviewText: We stayed at this Marriott downtown and it lived up to the Marriott reputation. Service was excellent and room was comfortable. It is downtown so always very busy in the lobby and very pricey. Everything extra such as parking, in-room wifi, breakfast, etc. was an expensive additional cost. Location was very convenient to public transportation, shopping, and restaurants. Some of the sightseeing spots would require more than walking.
review.negativeRemarks: Free in room wifi! This was an expensive hotel just for the room. I get that parking downtown is at a premium, but wifi is not an additional cost.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping, restaurants, Union Square, and walking distance to China Town, Cable Car stop is nearby as well as public transportation.

review.reviewText: Great staff.  Perfectly located for just about anything.  Waked to and from the baseball game at AT&T park.  Room was great as well as the staff.

review.title: Great location, amazing staff, great rooms.
review.reviewText: Staff are amazing - all of my requests and expectations were met. Great location - central to everything.

review.title: Good hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel has over a 1000 rooms and is mainly used as a convention hotel. The week that we stayed there the hotel was sold out. The facilities are great. There is a sky lounge on the 39th floor that had amazing views. It was packed every night with people who wanted to witness the sunset. The wine and food selection was unparalleled. The rooms while spacious were very clean and comfortable, but need updating.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for choosing to stay at San Francisco Marriott Marquis. Please accept our apologies for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay. We appreciate your feedback, as it is integral to our ability to continue to improve. We hope to have the pleasure of serving you in the future.
Kind regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.reviewText: Horrible from the start, gave us the wrong room and room was not clean took 2 days to clean the room

review.title: Close to shopping.
review.reviewText: Very cold room at the end of the hallway. Cold air blowing in from the stairwell penetrated into the room. Had to run the heater on high all night. Great view. Lovely room. Nice staff.

review.title: Centrally located to entertainment
review.reviewText: Our stay had a rocky start, but ended beautifully. The driveway to check in and drop off bags was extremely crowded for a Sunday afternoon. It took quite a while to pull up to the door to unload our bags while my better half checked in since we were planning to self-park. Despite requesting early check in, our rooms were not ready until almost 5pm. Then everything became better. Our room was beautiful with views of the bay, and feather free as requested due to our allergies. After a fantastic dinner at Coi, we returned to our room to enjoy the city lights. The next morning, we had a nice breakfast that was included with our stay. The area surrounding the hotel was fun to walk around, especially with the beautiful weather.
review.negativeRemarks: Early bird check in
review.locationRemarks: Yerba Buena gardens, MOMA, Metreon, Westfield Mall

review.title: Great location - extremely busy hotel
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 3 nights for vacation. Mom/daughter/granddaughter 

This hotel was huge- but in a great location. no matter what time of day or night- that lobby was completely packed.  we walked everywhere. Even used Bart to/from airport and the station was only 1 block over. 

Super clean, super comfortable- and really roomy for 3 ladies. We had 2 queen beds- big closet and bathroom.

The guy that checked us in was super friendly and went over a few locations with map. we left our maid a tip and she came by to thank us, so nice. 

Only disappointment in the whole place was that the bar at the top was so wildly crowded Friday night that there was just no way to get a drink and enjoy the gorgeous view from there.

review.title: Great staff in a great staff in great condition
review.reviewText: Flew in from Columbus, OH and arrived several hours before check-in. They were able to find an upgraded room that was available right away. The lobby was very, very nice. The staff was incredibly pleasant. The room was very clean and updated. The hotel bar (The View) on the top floor had a spectacular view of the city. I even visited the hotel gym which was nicer than almost any gym I've ever been to. Incredibly clean and updated! Taxi/Uber/Lyft drivers right outside for easy convenience. Great hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: The location is nearby to Tenderloin which is probably the worst part of San Fran. Be smart and just avoid that area and you'll be perfectly fine.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with beautiful top views.
review.reviewText: The front desk was extremely helpful in checking my fiancée and I 2 hours early. I thank Drew for that he made it a pleasant experience in directing us around and also giving us directions in town and what sights to see!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location for access to the city, the staff are really great and very helpful. You have to check out the roof lounge with 360 views of the city. The rooms are great and the beds are sooooooooo comfortable, all in all I was really happy with my stay.

Walking distance to Chinatown, Little Italy, public transportation  and shopping. 
At check in, clerk drew a line on map and told us not to walk in those areas. Very helpful as we were first time visitors to San Francisco. Hotel is on border of not so desirable areas of town.

Staff is great best experience , great breakfast , room clean ,
location the best

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The San Francisco Marriott Marquis is a wonderful, convenient hotel near Union Square.  The staff were competent and friendly, and the concierge very helpful. Accommodations were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing -- the only negative thing about the hotel was how close it was to the Tenderloin district .... not very safe for kids and teens.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from great shopping in Union Square and Chinatown; Close to cable car to Fisherman's Warf;  Walking distance from the Ferry Building.

review.title: Great location for San Francisco.
review.reviewText: We were able to go everywhere on San Francisco we wanted to by foot.  Cable car and all other transportation was close and BART was able to get us to the Airport.  Baseball stadium and wharf were in walking distance for us, so long as you wanted to challenge the hills.  Market in hotel kept options available.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of items in the market store, but that should be expected.
review.locationRemarks: Mall across the street and all of San Francisco.

review.reviewText: Walking distance to BART station.  Appreciated that room was available in the morning for check-in.  A bit disappointed for overpriced breakfast buffet.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel but we had s strange corner room with no view
Rooms are not as big. But nice location. Need better meal options.

review.title: Excellent place to stay in SFO
review.reviewText: Excellent ubication, clean and comfortable, very family oriented. Would recommend it to anyone

review.title: Great hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Comfortable  beds, great location.  Perfect for a few days stay. There's a parking lot down the street to park your car that is much cheaper than using the hotels. Use the 4th and mission location.
It was great. Location was not that good ut hotel was great.

marriot hotels Have been my go to hotel, but Im specifically very anal and I make my reservations based on bed comfort. This hotel's mattress and pillow made me a happy man. It's very comfortable and I was satisfied! the valet service was excellent, however; at $70 overnight parking is outrageously expensive.

review.title: Perfect location to access Bart, muni, cable car.
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable rooms.
Very friendly staff.
Great location.
Easy access to local shopping and local transportation.
We would stay here again.
Only negative, no free wi-fi.
Beautiful high end look inside.
Only steps from BART.

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: Parking was big issue. Usually other hotels don't charge for parking but this hotel charges $71

review.title: Nice fancy hotel
review.reviewText: Spacious lobby, comfortable beds, nice view, great and convenient location.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location and comfortable beds. Also very clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Need a microwave in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Near a target and multiple restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel- convenient location
review.reviewText: Came here for a night with some friends just to tour San Francisco and this hotel was perfect! Snacks a little pricey but thats expected from the Marriott Marquis

review.title: Great bed and location
review.reviewText: It was a 4 star stay, extremely comfortable bed. Great location and friendly staff

review.title: Nice, roomy hotel
review.reviewText: Courteous staff, but one of the desk staff was misinformed --- he informed me that the shuttle to the airport shoud be arranged with the shuttle company by the guest, and that the hotel does not provide the service.  Woman staffer the previous day and the hotel door man were consisyent in the correct info : hotel shuttle stops at the 4th Ave entrance every hour from 8-3 and reservatins are not necessary.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location, huge lobby, nice view on the 39th? FLR.
review.locationRemarks: SFMOMA; church next door; beard papa and pizza restaurant, diners, mall and the Metreon.

review.title: Nice hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: Overall it was a great experience. We arrived prior to our check in time and the staff was great about  accommodating us. The room was spacious and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Must have beard papas and Indian food from Amber. Both are right behind the hotel.

review.title: Excellent Hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Stayed there for a weekend, great hotel, friendly staff, close to everything, restaurant, shops, museum and not to mention the incredible view of the 39th. Floor bar.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to shops, restaurants, museum and public transporation

review.title: Walk to so many hot spots
review.reviewText:
Loved to walk to the wonderful, redone SFMOMA, Union Square, Apple Store (a wow!!), etc. Staff sent us to great steak house after our favorite turned out to have closed.

I'm only 5'3". I did not like having to climb up onto the bed.

review.title: Very nice hotel.  Clean, comfortable.
review.reviewText: We enjoyed stay at hotel.  Staff friendly, helpful.   One entrance, close to shopping, another close to convention center.  Room clean, comfortable, quiet.   We had chance to visit "The View" (believe it is open evenings only).  Great place to stop for a drink and enjoy view of city.   Hotel is very close to a BART stop.  We will stay here again.  Thank you.

review.title: Great location--restaurants & shopping close-by
review.reviewText: Our family of 4 had a great experience at the hotel!  Great location made it easy to get to Union Square or to the cable cars.  Felt safe & the room was nice (small, but that was expected).
review.locationRemarks: Would stay here again w/ my family or as a couple.  Neat roof-top lounge/bar!

review.title: Nice hotel convenient to Union Square, trolley, et
review.reviewText:
Only recommendation is that the Hotel rethink their in room coffee it's horrible and the condiments are equally as bad

The bed and pillows were very comfy
Awesome. Had a great stay very comfortable and would definitely go back to this hotel when in San Francisco

review.title: Ticked all boxes for 1 night stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my one night stay, on Saturday, for recovery from a long flight. Deluxe room was nice, quiet and comfortable on upper floors, with excellent views. Check-in staff were friendly. Room had proper refrigerator, rather than mini-bar. Short wait time for elevators. Convenient location for shopping. Good busy atmosphere in lobby area. Free wifi availability in lobby, if needed, worked for me. This is a nice hotel. Nothing to complain about !
review.positiveRemarks: I usually stay in 3 or 4 star hotels, and this was the nicer of the them, especially for the Expedia deal at the time . Comfortable, quiet deluxe room
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing to complain about
review.locationRemarks: Nice location near center of busy shopping district

review.reviewText: It was located in the middle of everything you need in SF, I would definitely stay here again!!!!

review.title: Regulations are not consistent
review.reviewText:
When I checked in, I was told that the wi-fi would be free if I'm a Marriott member. It's 14.95 per day and what hotel charges this much nowadays...??! When I checked out, I received a bill for $30 for the use of Wi-Fi,
I told the staff indicating that I showed the member's card and was told that Wi-Fi would be free. She then said "Oh, you have to be a gold card member." I showed the member card when I checked in and the staff knew that it was not a gold member card. They need to train the staff members more thoroughly regarding the regulations. I was quite unhappy about it.
review.negativeRemarks: Train them!

review.title: Nice,clean hotel
review.reviewText: The staff,we're very respectable, and professional.

coming off a long weekend in the wine country from a wedding, my husband specified that we needed the quietest room, so we could get a good night's sleep.  When they told us 4th floor, he knew right away that we would hear the street noise, then once we got to our room, and saw we were right next to the engineering room, he was not too happy.  It was as if his request was not even heard.  Then, the bellman told us to call from a courtesy phone, while he stayed with us, so we wouldn't have to go back to the front desk, and we were re-directed to a lovely room on the 17th floor.  Why they couldn't just listen and provide that room in the first place, we don't know.  The room was large, and quiet and lovely.  It just took time, energy and frustration to get there.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Market St., Mission St., and Union Square, so great shopping and close to the Financial district, and movie theaters.as well as museums.

review.title: Nice hotel and close to everything
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Everyone is very friendly and helpful.
Was well worth the price.  Location was great.  Had a good experience.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Staff was extremly friendly and helpful, great location hotel was very clean and upkeep was great many stores and resturants within walking distance, would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Did not deliver on promise.
review.reviewText: We extended our stay for one night for a much higher price and we were promised a better room with a king bed and then went to enjoy the day, on our re turn not only did we not get an up grade we were locked out of our room an told that they could only but us in a higher floor room with 2 double beds. The staff is all talk. I ask to speak to a manager and they transferred me to a another talking head who I found out was not a manager at all. I think it's just a tactic of the hotel to wear you down and it did, we had no luck. There are many more beautiful hotels In this city with staff that aims to please, I know because I've stayed in them and will next time also. This is the first review I have written, I don't like to complain but I want what I pay for and what was promised. so for that and the attitude of the staff I felt I should warn people.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Loved the stay at the Marriot. Great location close to all the activities, shops, restaurants.

review.title: Many little things add up to a comfortable stay
review.reviewText:
It is very nice that they have storage service to hold our luggage (and bicycles) before check-in. That way we were able to go to the museum and lunch for the day without worrying about our luggage. And I appreciate the text message when our room was ready (about 2:30pm).

The bed was amazing. The room was clean and very comfortable. We appreciate the refrigerator to store our left over dinner (since it is so expensive to dine in the city).

It was very quiet and our room was away from the street so we didn't have any traffic noise. Nice black-out curtains kept the sun from waking us too early. And the noon check out was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed, shower-head, spacious room, no noise, late check out.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are so pleased you enjoyed our "great location" and comfy bed. We will definitely bring your comments to the attention of our housekeeping team. We do hope you come back soon for another visit.
Best regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great bed. Very comfortable.  Moved the furniture and found garbage.  Need to talk to housekeeping.

review.title: Nice Hotel , View Lounge Breathtaking
review.reviewText:
Very Nice Hotel
Close to AT+T park ,1.5-2 miles, Union Square, 3-4 blocks  , Westfield Mall 1bloclk and Convention Ctr
Friendly , Helpful and Knowledgable staff 
And the View Lounge on the 39th floor , Breathtaking !

We Will be Back , Thank You

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is very vibrant, full of people night and day.  Very convenient as it is very close to public transport, union square and other major tourist spots. Will definitely recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower the parking rate.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dining, walking around union squeare

review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the greatest center of San Francisco and the room is very large and clean. The streets around it are very safe.

review.title: Great hotel.  Easy walk to Giants Stadium.
review.reviewText: Right in the center of everything.  Close to transit and tour bus operators.  Very helpful folks at the concierge desk.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice atmosphere.  Lots of space in the lobby.  Room was quiet.
review.locationRemarks: The 2 day hop on/off bus tour was excellent!

review.title: Nice hotel and close for everything
review.reviewText:
Nice city 
The best hotel 
Charges 50 dollars per night no good but it's ok

review.title: Nice hotel close to subway
review.reviewText: The subway power street station is close. It brings you all the way to the airport. The room is spacious. The king size bad is good. Room temperature is comfy.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful when asked questions the hotel was close enough to things you could walk to such as China town and little Italy

review.title: Good staff, weak amenities
review.reviewText: Great staff in the lounge.  Excellent bed (very comfortable), but no room service and no minibar/snacks in an executive suite.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Though the hotel is old, it's well maintained. decently clean.
The lobby gets busy at night due to the lounge on the top floor and elevators get even busier.
review.locationRemarks: union square, bart, lots of restaurants & shopping

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and in a great location. Staff/concierge was incredibly helpful, friendly and truly made the stay what it was. I had a great trip, and ate at and visited some great places thanks to their recommendations. I would highly recommend staying here, and I know I'll be back there soon!
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, clean rooms, great location
review.locationRemarks: Right by a ton if shopping, great places to eat (go to the grove for breakfast!), close to fisher and wharf, go,den gate bridge, ect.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay in San Francisco. The Marriott was convenient, comfortable and we had a great experience. Would definitely come back again.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

review.reviewText: Nice ambiance and great staff! Sir, Mr, Ma'am, etc

review.title: Nice hotel, HORRRRRRRRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
review.reviewText: The front desk girl  seem like she hated her job. Her attitude was very dry.  I understand some people just aren't as  friendly or a people person so I let that go... We get to the hotel restaurant and waited an hour for a cheeseburger.  A cold cheeseburger uncooked bacon cheeseburger... The next day waited an hour for clean wash cloth to be delivered to our room. Nice hotel but the service is horrible.  The bellhop gentleman and the concierge are the only employees in this hotel that made this experience somewhat delightful.  If you have time to waste and wait for people who seem to not be doing their job and you do not care for great customer service then this hotel is for you otherwise you won't like it!
Staff was amazing! Hosting skills were awesome. Even the security offers were friendly and showed us a great time

review.title: Simply Amazing!!
review.reviewText: From the moment we walked in we were simply amazed. The hotel was very, very clean, the customer service was amazing and the best part, the pillows and the bed. Had such a good nights sleep. Thank you for such an amazing weekend. Will definitely come back.
review.negativeRemarks: the lady at the front desk at the gym just ignored me when i needed to talk to her. Just kept on talking and laughing in a another language. rude!
review.locationRemarks: The mall was a block away. Mels Diner, Target, movie theater and Starbuck were all across the street.

review.reviewText: Overall great location, room came with a great view. Also The View lounge was a great place to end the night with the city in the back drop. Room was nice and clean and staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Right in the heart of downtown San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel right in the heart of downtown SF. We were able to walk to AT&T park for the game, and walked to the various nightlife spots. The View bar has a great view of the city. We will use this hotel again!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Gina,
Happy Anniversary! We are so pleased your anniversary weekend was all you had hoped it to be and more. Thank you so much for your lovely review and recommendation. We look forward to serving you on your next escape to the city by the bay.
Kind regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Anniversary weekend getaway!
review.reviewText: Weekend anniversary getaway close enough to walk everywhere we wanted to go. We went to see the musical Wicked it was only .9 miles from the hotel. It was well worth walking because the traffic was bad and a taxi would have probably been a lot. There are tons of restaurants and shopping all around the hotel. We got so much good information from the hotel staff. Our Bellman who helped us on two different occasions gave us lots of good information. The rooms were nice. But, the beds were one of the most comfortable my husband & I have slept in away from home. We felt very cozy in our room & loved relaxing on a rainy Sunday morning before going out for brunch this morning. BTW- The Target is right  across the street (you can buy your bottled water or snacks for your room there). And they have so many food court choices & even a movie theater if you just want to chill out. I know most people want to do all the tourist attractions & you can also do all of that too. S.F. is great. As long as you don't try to drive too much once you get there. I think that is just the opposite of relaxing!

managementResponses.response:
Der BB,
Thank you for choosing the San Francisco Marriott Marquis for your recent travels to San Francisco. In response to the changing needs of our guests, we transitioned last April from room service to the grab and go Mission Street Pantry. It was such a delight to learn your clean room and comfortable bed; as well as our friendly hosts and prime location made for an overall enjoyable stay in the City by the bay. Hope to see you again soon.
Kind regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Central location, very comfy beds, clean rooms
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, the beds were very comfy, the room was clean & the hotel was centrally located. The hotel did lack room service & all the in-hotel shops closed really early for a Sat night. The price seemed high for the size of the rooms & the amenities.

review.title: Nice hotel and room just really over priced.
review.reviewText: The Super 8 i stayed in the next night was just as nice for 1/2 the price.

review.title: Fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: Convenient location, comfortable accommodations and friendly employees

review.title: Not far from all the fun
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and clean. Interesting characters outside the hotel. The hotel itself was well kept. The bar at the top was perfect and had the best views of the city. No room service. Hotel staff was the most friendly and provided all the right recommendations for a girls weekend. I would definitely stay there again.
This was a short vacation for us & I love how centrally located the hotel was. Staff was very friendly & helpful! Room was comfortable & clean! Beautiful views also!

review.title: Great hotel close to Parks and shopping
review.reviewText: Had a great time at this hotel really nice and clean great experience the hotel staff was amazing the only thing that I wasn't pleased with was just parking there's not a lot of parking and there's no free parking but I guess  thats a big city for you, but everything was great I would definitely go back and stay there again!
Everyone was very professinal. The room was clean and close to the Theater we had tickets to.

review.title: Dirty room that I had to ask them to clean for me
review.reviewText: I know when you book for Expedia Marriotts will give you the rooms close to the ground so it was very noisy as this Hotel is in the middle of the city Hotel.

review.title: Room a little warm. Hotel lobby is always crowded
review.reviewText: It was good, convenient location. Housekeeper very honest . Lobby staff helpful and friendly. It's very good location to go around the tourist spots.
Very clean and comfortable. Friendly and helpful staff. I enjoyed my stay very much

review.title: Nice Hotel but no pool or hot tub.
review.reviewText: When we first arrived we were hit with an unexpected parking fee of $70/day.  We rented a car from the airport to save money on cab or bus fares.  We didn't plan on going anywhere during our hotel stay because we were in medical meetings all day every day and had not time to get out and visit anything except at night walking distance.  In the long run it cost us far more to have the rental car then had we taking a cab;  It basically sat in a parking garage the entire time.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and conference rooms were nice
review.negativeRemarks: Let people know ahead of time including on Expedia and other sites of the additional parking charges as I have not had to pay this in any other Hotel
review.locationRemarks: Didn't get out to see much but what was close by was nice.

review.title: Large hotel near shopping and business district
review.reviewText: We had a most pleasant stay at this hotel. Although they usually charge for wifi in the room, they offered to give it to us free of charge if we dispensed with housekeeping for the 3 nights of our stay in order to save water for drought-stricken San Francisco, an offer we were very happy to take up. Had we needed more towels etc a call to Housekeeping and they would have appeared. 3 days was our limit though!!
review.positiveRemarks: It was very convenient to the large shops, to the business district and to Market Street. Also appreciated having a Grab-and-Go on the premises.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.reviewText: Had a great  time everyone  was nice staff was great. But room could of had a better view.

review.title: Incompetent front desk
review.reviewText: Incompetent front desk. Just another big corporate faceless hotel. Next time go with a slightly smaller property that can do what they say. I had made arrangements with the manager at the front desk for a special occasion and none of what was arranged was carried out, they had no record of and the special stay was a disaster. Will not make this same mistake staying at a big faceless hotel again.

review.title: Excellent lodging but WiFi is extra?
review.reviewText: There's no excuse for that. Everything else was fine but I felt cheated that I was being asked to pay $15 extra on top of everything else,  just for WiFi in my room.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Business trip, turned personal trip.
review.reviewText: Was in town for a food show, hotel was great. Must visit the 39th floor - The View Lounge

review.title: Deluxe and Trendy
review.reviewText: Nicely decorated hotel in a convenient location in the booming South of Market district.  There are many many small eating places around the corner where you can hop out for a quick breakfast or snack.  If you want to go shopping,  Bloomingdale is just a few steps away.  I find the location more convenient than my previous stay in Union Square Grand Hyatt.   I have a super size room overlooking their court yard.  Though my room does not have the city view, the sheer size and trendy room decoration makes my stay very special.  Totally love it.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, trendy and chic decoration, deluxe amenities, great snack shop and restaurants in the hotel, convenient location
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient location.  Bloomingdale, Metreon, Yueba Buena Garden, Movie Theatre, many small eating places are just steps away.

review.title: Wonderfull hotel!
review.reviewText:
Amazing hotel, everything was great except the ammount that they charge for the parking at the hotel $68.00 day. Parking for yourself was $35.00. 
Overall was a great hotel
You get what you pay, good location, nice rooms, good restaurants and a lot of amenities around
The bathrooms need some updating. The beds were very comfortable! Great views and staff

review.title: Avoid this hotel for weekend getaways
review.reviewText:
This hotel has 1,300+ rooms and is geared to the convention crowd. I booked it as a getaway and it was a huge mistake. Here is why:
1) Arriving at the hotel by car takes you 30 minutes to travel the final half a block. Several people get so frustrated they move around all the cars and try to cut in at the entrance. When you finally make it, the hotel staff will come to your car and tell you to wait (another 10 minutes), and that the parking fee is $65 - parking in San Francisco is expensive, but $65 is higher than any other hotel (except the Four Seasons). You would think for that much they would hire more people to move things quickly.
2) The lobby of this hotel is like a Las Vegas Casino without the Casino of course. You fee part of a cattle heard as soon as you get in.
3) This hotel has great views at the higher levels, but if you booked your hotel through a travel portal, enjoy the low rise tower and no views.
4) The Sky view lounge looks awesome in pictures. Good luck enjoying it. The closed it down for a private event on a Saturday at 9:00 pm, and they started kicking everyone out at 8:20 pm. The lobby bar is the only other bar in this hotel.
5) Drunk people woke me up three time in the middle of the night, and the church bells rang early next Sunday morning.
6) The few bars in the vicinity of this hotel cannot accommodate all the guests in it. 
7) Want a San Francisco getaway, there are many other hotels that are as central, where you won't feel cattle herded through
review.positiveRemarks: The room was clean, renovated and what you would expect of a Marriott
review.negativeRemarks:
1) If you are going to charge $65 for parking, do something about it. 
2) Cater to hotel guests instead of closing things down for private parties
review.locationRemarks: Central location (convention center, shopping and close to the business district), but the hotel has too many guests that congest all the bars around

review.title: Love it!
review.reviewText: We stay at the Marriott every year for my birthday weekend. Always the best!

review.title: Family Friendly Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: We've stayed at this Marriott many times. We love the amenities and proximity to Union Square and shopping. Check in is very fast, valet parking is really great. All staff members are friendly, unruffled, and extremely helpful. The bar at the rooftop level is wonderful. The one downside this year is that the beautiful indoor swimming pool has been taken out. We were very disappointed.
My granddaughter says stay was Awesome! I agree!

review.title: Excellent location for AGU conference venue in SF
review.reviewText: Hotel is good- location excellent- use the hotel when I go to conference.

review.title: Dated décor and unremarkable
review.reviewText: The room and hotel were well-maintained, but the overall look of the room decor is of a 1970s motel.  I was also woken throughout the night by street noise (mostly dumpsters doors being slammed shut and similar maintenance noises).
review.negativeRemarks: furnishings and outside noise level

review.reviewText: Great location, close by shopping and lots of restaurant choices nearby
hotel is with in walking distance of everything in the center of town very nice hotel.
Staff was friendly, even on a night when they probably wanted to be with their families. They helped deal with a rewards card that wasn't cooperating without missing a beat.

review.title: Great hotel and so close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel is wonderful and so close to everything!  Request to be close to the elevator was not delivered though.  With a bad knee that would've helped quite a bit.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: Hotel was convenient and clean. Great service and very friendly

review.title: Car Show At The Moscone
review.reviewText:
I chose the hotel so that my wife and I would have a close place to stay after going to the car show at the Moscone Center right after Thanksgiving. The Marriott Marquis was perfect for this and more. The hotel is located basically on 4th and Market, just a few minute walk to Moscone and is also right around the corner to the big indoor mall for Black Friday (or any other day) shopping. It's also close to Union Square, Macy's, Apple Store, Crate & Barrel, Cheese Cake Kitchen, etc.

The hotel is extremely secure, clean, modern and most of all the staff was very professional. A young man (Emilio) met us right after we walked into the front door with a "hello" and a big smile, asked us if he could help in any way. He was super fast and had before I could blink had us checked-in (early) and on our way to the car show. When we came back from the car show we wanted to go to the Tadish Grill for dinner and the Doorman hailed a cab for us.

I would, and will definetly stay here again. I'm looking forward to having a drink and ordurves at the View (restaurant at the top of the hotel, 39th floor) next time my wife and I stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: #1 was the staff and quick, courteous service. The location was perfect for may different types of adventures. We felt safe, had a good nights sleep.
review.negativeRemarks:
Wi-Fi should be free.
$65 for parking is ridiculous.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Moscone Center, Union Square, Macy's, Apple Store, Crate & Barrel, Cheese Cake Kitchen, Westfield Mall, Matron, BART, etc.

managementResponses.response:

We are very sorry to hear that we did not exceed your expectations in every way. Please know that your comments will be shared with our team in order to continue to improve our products and services moving forward. We do hope that you try us again in the future.

review.title: Marriott Marquis not my favorite
review.reviewText: Room not very appealing. Way over priced. Bathroom too small. No counter space, inadequate lighting in room. No light in or near closet. TV sideways to the bed. Sat too low too view. No room service at this hotel. We had been traveling cross country and were exhausted and just wanted to stay in room. What hotel doesn't offer room service???? Towels smelled burnt. Just did not care for this hotel other than a great location.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the great review Chris!
We are delighted we could be a part of your "Black Friday" fun! Come back soon.
Kind regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Location was great
review.reviewText: We enjoyed Black Friday with some friends and had a chance to enjoy the hotel it was very nice and in a great location.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to share. We understand value is very important to our guests, and we are constantly conducting price comparisons to ensure we are competitively priced within our category and market.  There is self-parking available nearby. However, there are no in/out privileges and you do have to pay each time you use your vehicle.  We have a Hertz Rental Desk on property if you just need to rent a car for the day.  We appreciate your review and hope you choose to stay with us whenever your travel needs bring you back to San Francisco.

review.title: Very Expensive parking
review.reviewText:
Expedia did not warn me that parkings are very expensive, those guys charge 65++ parking ! 

A little warning next time would be great.

review.title: Great hotel blocks fron Union Square
review.reviewText: We stayed 3 nights and everything was geeat! Service was outstanding. Room on 29th floor was perfect with nice city views.

review.title: Nice hotel, clean and close to everything
review.reviewText:
Close to everything with great location. Hotel was super clean and the staff was very helpful. I was upgraded to 20th floor room and was given free wifi access being the first time customer. That's without even asking for.

Will stay again for sure.

managementResponses.response:

review.reviewText: Nice, clean room in the heart of downtown. BART was conveniently close by, and we could walk to several stores in the area. The staff was helpful when checking in, even when I showed up with very old gift cards.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby bar closes awfully early (around 11PM)

review.title: Nice hotel at walking distance to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Check in was quick, room was nice and clean. Staff service was great when we lost our keys. No fuss.
We walked around town and enjoyed SF night life.
The only thing that was strange was that there is no room service. We wanted to have breakfast in bed, but had to get dressed and go down to one on the coffee shops. You just have to plan on that.
Great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Room comfort, location, service, cleanness, big spaces.
review.negativeRemarks: Add room service?

review.title: A view of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was just awesone.  The rooms were very clean and the staff was great from the doorman to the service desk and the staff in the restaurant.   The location is close to everything.  We had an awesome view of San Francisco from our room.   The rates were very reasonable when you consider the location.   I thought that it would be now expensive butte or want.  Thank you staff at Marriott f I really making my stay wonderful.

review.title: Lots of choices of nearby dining and shops.
review.reviewText: Urban market was an excellent amenity available to pick up a quick snack. Hotel was located across the Moscone Convention Center which made it very convenient for me.

review.title: amazing hotel near moscone center.
review.reviewText: It is an amazing hotel, right next door to moscone center in the middle of downtown. It is right next a number of eating joints and a Jewish museum right next door. You have to go to the 39th floor for drinks but more than that the view, you can see air planes lining up to land and they look like stars at night from the hotel. The staff is extremely courteous and efficient. We loved the hotel and San Fransisco, we're pretty sure we're coming back next year also.
review.positiveRemarks: Good food, awesome staff, view from the 39th floor.
review.negativeRemarks: No it was great.
review.locationRemarks: Bloomingdales, moscone center, a number of good Indian restaurants, great concierge helps with finding tours

review.title: Good facilities and staff
review.reviewText: Everything great inside the hotel, outside is a different story with rampant homelessness.

review.title: basic hotel in good location
review.reviewText: this is a true 3 to 3.5 star hotel. definitely not a 4 star hotel. it is in a very good location. they call it south of market and it's barely south, but next to the mall, next to target, next to 100 restaurants and a 6 min walk at most to union square. it's close to the financial district. I frequent san francisco 6 times a year at least. I'm beginning to like the south of market area more these days, but I will not stay at this hotel ever again as they've stopped their room service and for late night or early mornings, it's such a mandatory convenience. the prices were above most 4 star hotels which are far superior in overall room quality
review.negativeRemarks: the room prices especially if you're competing against other real 4 star hotels and boutique hotels that have nice accommodations
review.locationRemarks: too many to list

review.reviewText:
Everything was perfect 
Valet parking, Front desk 10, 
Room spotless. Bed comfy
Come back anytime

review.title: My now go-to hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Second time I've stayed here, and each time the Staff has been incredibly helpful and accommodating. Each time I've had a great room with a cool view. Nice lobby bar and superb one on 39th floor.

review.title: Good hotel for business
review.reviewText:
Good hotel, decent sized rooms, clean and modern with both a mini-bar and a separate fridge you can use for your  own food and drink. 

Housekeeping starting rounds at 8:00am is never acceptable in my opinion, and led to me leaving the privacy sign on most nights. 

Conference venue is lacking, not a very inspiring space.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy bed, good AC system, clean bathroom & good shower, great location for business district, walkable to tourist areas, great view bar on 39th fl
