review.locationRemarks: On the cusp of SOMA and business district, great for Metreon, Moscone, Yerba Buena etc. More of a business hotel than near tourist areas further north

review.title: work function
review.reviewText: had to get a hotel for whiskeyfest. Marriott was the host. rooms were great and function was run smoothly.

We nice hotel, rom clean, staff very friendly! But for parking over night a little expensive! 
Breakfast was very good and clean! Nearby shopping center! Almost very good!

review.title: Overall pleasant stay.
review.reviewText:
I had a good stay. Staff was friendly and informative. Easily had access to
Staff when needed. Wish I had the chance to see the view which is open to the public from 4pm -1am  (as far as I know). Didn't get the chance to check it out. The bed and pillows are VERY COMFORTABLE. One con for me is that opening the door closes the entrance to the bathroom being in a room on the 15th floor. It was a little tight there. (Deluxe room) the view from the room is lovely. Hope this reviews helps I usually don't write too many reviews but I understand it may be important to some people. Area of the hotel was also very convenient.

review.title: No room service and limited restaurants.
review.reviewText: Busy and mediocre in every way. They lost my laundry. No room service. Low quality bathroom.

review.title: It's a really convenience hotel.
review.reviewText: We just stay one night in SF. The reason we choose this hotel is my roommate strongly recommend as she used to live in nearby. And transportation, restaurants and shops are good. Especially for the sky bar, in the 39th floor. But we found sky bar is really small and crowed with people when arrived there. So we just got around and left.
review.positiveRemarks: There are lots of shops around. Best for shopping.
review.locationRemarks: go to Fisherman's Wharf, Lombard Street, Golden Gate Bridge and The palace of Fine Arts.

review.title: Nice place near Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is great for business or vacation purposes.

review.title: Very conveniently located downtown, near transit
review.reviewText: We stayed for one night, and enjoyed. The location is very centrally located in Downtown. We travelled by BART train to/from airport and this was only a block away from the station (Powell). Cable Cars are only a couple blocks away to Knob Hill and access to Harbour. Lots of dining options near-by.
review.positiveRemarks: Efficient staff for check in and check out. Room was very clean.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to BART train from Airport (only 30 minutes). Cable cars and trolleys steps away. Shopping for sundries within minutes. Great location.

review.title: 4 minute walk to Union Square
review.reviewText: Went for the Nike half marathon. Super comfortable and will stay here in the future

review.title: Nice enough but kind of underwhelming.
review.reviewText: I was surprised on how basic the room seemed. This wouldn't be an issue for me but the hotel bills itself as 4 stars so the room just seemed basic, especially for the price. The room had an unusual layout where the bathroom door stuck into the room as you passed. It was easy to bump into. The room had a mini-fridge stocked with bottles of alcohol. I was afraid to touch it so as not to disturb the bottles. I also faced a church next door and every morning at 7:30 you will hear church bells (not just on Sunday). I was usually up anyway but if you want to sleep in that's not going to happen. They were very accommodating about early checkin, and the hotel is close to Market St. and public transportation. It didn't seem to have many choices on restaurants but there are some within walking distance. Overall the hotel seems geared towards business travelers as I was one of the few guys there not wearing business suits. I would give it three and a half stars if I could but I guess I'll round up. If you can find a great deal on price it's worth checking out. Just make sure you're not facing the church.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to streetcar and trolleys on Market St. Easy to get to from the airport on BART.
review.negativeRemarks: Change the weird bathroom door set up.
review.locationRemarks: Powell Street cable car is a block away. BART and MUNI stops are right around the corner.

review.title: Easy hotel, booking fith rough checkout
review.reviewText: Excellent location near the Bay and Bart . Staff helpful and friendly, room is the usual Marriott white oasis for bedtime, only issue was a mechanical noise during the night even though we shut our fans down. Staff was sympathetic and would have relocated us if we were staying longer, overall a great place to stay!

review.title: nice clean hotel
review.reviewText: Clean hotel comfortable room great location the price is typical of san francisco seems expensive but for the city not really just be prepared to walk a lot  uber is always 2 minutes away no problem
They don't have room service!! Be aware of it if you arriving late in the evening or early morning and you can't go outside the hotel to eat.

convenient location to shopping. Great service.
Staff was great. accommodated us with late check out.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Check in was easy, the bell-staff and front desk staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Great suggestions on local restaurants and nearby options.
review.negativeRemarks: San Francisco has a MASSIVE homeless population since the last time I visited about 10 years ago. No fault of Marriott, but depressing.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Close clean courteous, staff hotel and location for all our needs, highly recommend.

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square area
review.reviewText: The Marriott Marquis in Union Square was a great place to stay in a fabulous location.  It is close to excellent shopping and dining, and for us it was a very doable walk to AT&T park for a 12 inning Dodger-Giant game!
review.positiveRemarks: It was very clean, safe, and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much!

review.title: Great location! Close to everything.
review.reviewText: We came to San Fran for a Giants game and enjoyed how within walking distance everything was from the hotel. The staff was great and were very eager to allow us to check in early so we could explore the city before the game. Rooms were comfortable. Great views. You have to grab a drink and a bite to eat up in The View after 4. Beautiful views of the city from the top floor.

review.title: We loved it!
review.reviewText: From the woman at check-in (from St Petereburg) to the valet desk and the room everything was outstanding.  I brought my son to SF for TwitchCon and the team at the hotel made it a memorable weekend.  Well done!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The service was outstanding.  The clean and comfortable room had a fabulous view of the city.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Moscone, very close.  Nearby Mel's Diner has a great breakfast/lunch.

review.title: perfect hotel for anything at the moscone center
review.reviewText: i checked in as soon as i got to san francisco and they gave me the wrong room at first (had people still in it) but they quickly made up for it the room i stayed in was really nice and had a great view i did have breakfast which was good but $28 for one meal was a bit much the staff was really nice and the stay was overall good espiacially since it was less than a 4 minute walk between the hotel and the moscone center
The hotel missed cleaning our room the first night but otherwise, it was really good.  Excellent location.  Helpful staff.

review.title: Conveniently Located For Bay Area Activities
review.reviewText: Drove in after a long day sightseeing along PCH. Valet parking took over the car and we were in our room in 10 minutes after a very efficient check in. Breakfast was a little pricey but good. Had a tumble returning from dinner. No doctor was available, but bandages and antiseptic cream was sent up. They followed up the next morning.

Nice hotel in an excellent location and the View restaurant on the 39th floor is a must see, just for the view as the name suggests. The food at the View is indeed very tasty for appetizers but overpriced. I was very disappointed with their breakfast, which cost $28 for minimal choices and semi-cold food, but outstanding pastries.

review.title: Great Location and Friendly!
review.reviewText: Beautiful and Friendly - love that is close to most events around the city!
review.negativeRemarks: More parking
review.locationRemarks: Giants, Night Events, City Visits

review.reviewText:
Clean lobby, modern. Helpful staff.
Very comfortable bed & pillows, convenient location.

review.title: Wonderful Surprise!
review.reviewText: Been a long time since we received such friendly and helpful staff at a hotel from the very beginning to the very end. Quiet and clean accommodations along with comfy beds.  We will look forward to our next stay.  Thank you!!!
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Just short ride by taxi to Orpheum Theatre.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for choosing the San Francisco Marriott Marquis.  We are working on several new projects within the hotel including a completely redesigned fitness center and spa. 

We hope to welcome you again to San Francisco!

The San Francisco Marriott Marquis Team.

review.reviewText: It was a generic hotel. Nothing excites me over there.

review.title: Conference trip
review.locationRemarks: Westfield center

review.title: Nice stay at San Francisco Marriott Marquis
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the SFMM downtown and really enjoyed our time there. The room was clean and the bed was really comfortable. We had a nice view of the city and park across the street. The shower pressure was excellent and the bathroom was spacious. we used the valet parking and a quick phone call downstairs had our car ready for us in 10-15 minutes. The valet were willing to give directions if you're in need. There is also a target across the street and a CVS around the corner of you need to pick up anything. Overall we were very pleased and will stay there again.

review.title: Best customer service , clean , best location
review.reviewText: First time visitors in San Fransisco .One of the beautiful city in the world with warm & polite people.Every where is a lo of fun .This city has reall beautiy .The weather was amazing .But do not forget to visit Pier 39. Broad walk was crowdead from every country.The Market street is upscale area with visitors fronaroind country.
Great Marriott hotel. Very easy access to the rest of the city.

review.title: Good location for shopping, parks and schools.
review.reviewText: While daughter attended school, I joined her for a few days.  I spent time reading and working in Yerba Buena Gardens. Nice!

review.title: Terrific location
review.reviewText: Most of the main things to see are within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing

review.reviewText: Location was perfect...within a few blocks of great shopping and theatre. Staff was great...will definitely being staying here again!

review.title: centrally located .
review.reviewText:
Good business hotel , convenient location close to Union square near a lot of dining and shopping . Rooms are clean , small bathroom . 
Negatives - No room service after 11:00 pm 
No in room movies , watch your own Netflix or Hulu on TV and if you don't have either , you are stuck watching regular channels on TV . They have inroom coffee maker but if you drink tea , bring your own Tes bags as they don't provide any for non coffee drinkers .

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Church bells are ringing in our neighborhood.  While we have measures to lessen outside noise disturbances (double paned windows), we are sorry to hear that you were unable to enjoy a restful morning. Though we are unable to control the timing of these beautiful bells, we should've given you a heads up. We appreciate your business and we hope this single experience will not deter you from visiting us again in the future.
Warm regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: church near buy with bells going off at 7:30am
review.reviewText: church near buy with bells ringing early in the morning
review.positiveRemarks: church near buy with bells going off at 7:30am
review.negativeRemarks: church near buy with bells going off at 7:30am
review.locationRemarks: church near buy with bells going off at 7:30am

review.reviewText: Good clean comfortable room. Exactly what you would expect.

review.title: Close to downtown shopping
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Parking expensive but it's downtown SF so expected. Great location to shopping

review.title: Great location, hotel bar offers unique views
review.reviewText: The Marriott staff was welcoming and genuine, the hotel was in a great location, 3 blocks from union square, while the hotel has had some major upgrades, it could use an additional facelift, overall it was a good stay.
review.negativeRemarks: More upgrades

review.title: perfect location for city trip and shopping
review.reviewText: stayed for 2 nights ,party of four adults, room was adequate clean and had two double beds ,bedding was comfortable , view of the 4th street couple of blocks from cable car

review.title: Luxury hotel but at a price
review.reviewText:
Luxury hotel in downtown San Francisco. Perhaps the most comfortable hotel bed i have ever slept in.

Great location 

But

1. $65 a night to park your car is a joke 
2. WiFi is not a luxury - charging is greed
3. $12 for a miniature from the mini bar is just silly

review.title: Pleasant stay in a centrally located Hotel
review.reviewText:
Overall I liked my stay. Had really pleasant encounter with the lady concierge who was extremely helpful ( don't remember the name but she lows sky watching & lives in the country).

Had a minor niggle at check out time. Even after calling from my to keep the receipt for the stay ready, it was not done so and on top the gentleman at the counter kept repeating that since booking was prepaid there was no balance due and perhaps meant to convey his puzzlement/irritation as to why I was insistent on a receipt.

 He did print it after I emphasized that it was needed for expense account claiming. He could have just printed one piece of paper at 5.15 AM & saved some anxiety for a guest heading to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Outside SIGNAGE VERY POOR AT NIGHT. Wonder if it's got something to do with a strange city ordinance but a neon or lighted sign won't hurt visibility
review.locationRemarks: Check out Chinatown which is close by.

review.title: Nice hotel and convenient
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and pleasant stay.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  The sky lounge has a great view and nice cocktails. This hotel is convenient and easy to get too.
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasant accommodations, comfortable, friendly and conveniently located.
review.negativeRemarks: More food options for late check in after 10 PM.  Keep the vagrants and hustlers away from guests while waiting outside for taxis with more security.
review.locationRemarks: Target is near by, a walk to Ferry Building was pleasant, and there are a few good restaurants.

review.title: A Great Time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Just returned from a great trip to San Francisco, with my wife and 2 teenage daughters. The Marriott Marquis Hotel is in a perfect location - located in the "Financial / Business District" its close to walk to the main attractions of Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf.  The hotel although very busy is very quite with no noise heard from either traffic or other guests.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything - Nothing to dislike at all, although the hotel is very busy with guests at all the staff are excellent and efficient at all times.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing !
review.locationRemarks: There's lots to do in this city - go on an open top bus tour around the city to get your bearings then explore Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz.

review.title: Perfect distance from AT&T park.
review.reviewText: The hotel baggage staff were the best ever!  They kept are bags while we went to the Giants game and were ready available to us when we checked back in!  They couldn't have been any nicer!!  In fact, kudos to the one that let us grab something out of the bag that we had forgotten.  He had already put the bags away, but was courteous and didn't complain about getting them back.
review.positiveRemarks: The fact that it is close to everything.
review.negativeRemarks: Later check out - lol!!
review.locationRemarks: We were able to walk to AT&T Park & find a nice restaurant a long the way to eat at before the game.  I didn't want to take a taxi & so it was perfect

review.title: Gracious Staff: walking distance to Union Square
review.reviewText:
The staff impressed me greatly.  They were helpful and seemed genuinely happy to be of assistance.  I was running the marathon and asked for a 1 p.m. check out, fully expecting to be told "no".  Instead, I was told "absolutely", then they offered even more time for me without extra charges.
Their valet was organized and fast.
review.positiveRemarks: Hands down, the best staff I have experienced.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: It is in the heart of Frisco, so it is the perfect location to visit the city.

review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel, great facilities, good location, friendly staff. Expected more for the price of room, even larger room was pretty crowded and nothing special.
For how expensive everything was I could not believe breakfast was not included & the beds were smaller then what was stated it was rough sleeping 2 comfortablely in the bed.

review.title: Great location and amenities.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was great. The only downfall was the parking, $65.00 valet overnight and the self parking was three blocks away.
Beautiful hotel and within walking distance to AT&T park!

review.title: Nice central location
review.reviewText: Centrally located , the rooms could be better .............,,,,

The rooms are good though the living room furniture was dated and very hard.

The conceirge breakfasts were excellent was lots of choices and fine service.

managementResponses.response:
We are honored to be your home away from home when in San Francisco. We could not be more pleased to learn our hosts, comfortable guestrooms and premier location are highlights of your time with us. We look forward to welcoming you back next month if not sooner!
Warm regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis Team

review.title: Love this hotel
review.reviewText: I stay at this Marriott once a month and I love it! Great location. Excellent staff. Nice rooms

managementResponses.response:
We are so pleased you enjoyed many aspects of your time with us and we appreciate you pointing the highlights of your stay. Thank you for bringing to our attention our new in-room tablets are not working as intended; we will have our team look into this straight away. We appreciate you selecting us for your San Francisco visit. Please keep us in mind when planning your next visit to the City by the Bay.
Best regards from The San Francisco Marriott Marquis Team

review.title: Good hotel, with Great staff and Great location.
review.reviewText:
I stayed here 2 nights as part of my business trip and to enjoy San francisco at my free time. Hotel staff was extremely profffesinal and friendly. They were very informative, and I always had an great experience talking/inquiring with them during my stay. Hotel facility is well maintained considering its years of operation, and the room was spacious. I felt room amenity to be little limited(no room cleaning service without request, no room service, no robes, electronic directly service that does not work properly) but maybe they are just environment friendly hotels. 
Locations were great, as shopping mall that includes Target is just accross the street(you can buy things necessary), just blocks away from Union square and surrounding shopping places, and walkable distance from AT&T park(20min) and ferry building(25min). 
Overall, I thought it was good hotel for the price I paid($250/day incl.tax) and will probably repeat within this price.
review.negativeRemarks: Room amenity and a daily room cleaning service
review.locationRemarks:
Target, Blooming dales, food court, restaurant is across the street
Walkable to the Bay Area, UnionSquare, and surrounding shopping places.

review.title: huge facility, too many people
review.reviewText: in the midst of a very busy area,always concious that many people surround you. Area not very pleasing with so many street people around, Construction everywhere making connections difficult. Though San Franciscans very generous when asked for help.
review.positiveRemarks: the pools were a great distraction
review.locationRemarks: easy to get around on buses and trolleys

review.title: Amazing!
review.reviewText: We found this hotel really accessible, everything is close by, the staff is really courteous and the room was clean and nice!
Was good,the only problem for us I can tell was the valet parking tuck more the 45 min waiting. And our car was parking all the time, they never ask for the awner that was very bad expierence.

review.title: SoMa
review.reviewText: Only complaint is that, even from the 10th floor, emergency vehicles and traffic were pretty loud.
Nice hotel in a great location. Stayed for a family vacation and it was very convenient for the activities we had planned.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Nice place with friendly staff.  I was a little disappointed with the pool.  It is inside with no view but the kids didn't seem to care about that. My only real comlaint was the black hair all over the bathroom and none of us has black hair.

review.title: Good hotel well situated
review.reviewText:
Good hotel, we had a concierge  room which includes access to the executive lounge for breakfast and snacks
This was a little overcrowded and hard to find a table
Food quality not brilliant.

review.title: Great hotel in SOMA!
review.reviewText: Good location and within walking distance to a lot of attractions, etc.  We actually walked from this hotel to the Wharf area...~40 minute walk with 2 kids.  Clean rooms, great roof top lounge IF you can get a seat.  Have to be there exactly when it opens at 4:00 to get a seat with a view...which is why it's called The View.  Great staff and we actually had our room upgraded for free when we arrived from a room without a view to a room with a great view of the city/bay.  My only complaint is that when they sent the bill to my room there were 3 different minibar charges that were not correct...never used the minibar.  They immediately removed these charges for me after calling a couple times.  Otherwise, great hotel that I would definitely recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Sending the correct bill would be nice.  Would be nice to have one more option for a restaurant but not really a big deal as you are in the city.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to a lot of attractions:  Market area, Embarcadero, great restaurants, and if ambitious enough the wharf and Ghiradelli Square

review.title: Great place and near IMAX
review.reviewText: Great hotel directly across the street from the largest IMAX theatre in the US.
The vallet parking took 35min. It was chaos for the departure.

review.title: They went the extra mile.
review.reviewText: When we arrived we were given a room about four floors over the main entry/ street side of the hotel.  Being a light sleeper, I asked if we could be moved to a quieter room.  The staff worked hard to find us a new location in the hotel, higher up and away from the street.  We got a great view to boot.  Kudos to the staff for the extra effort!
review.positiveRemarks: Very helpful staff throughout the hotel.  A great customer experience.
review.locationRemarks: Close and convenient to BART, Metro and tourism points

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice, the beds are comfortable though our room was a bit dark.  The location is awesome, right by the cable car station and the main shops.

review.title: Great location with luxury throughout
review.reviewText:
Perfect location. Exceptional service. Can't wait to return with my wife. 

The top floor bar is a real treat.

review.title: Great accommodations and location
review.reviewText: Just stayed for a convention. Perfect location near Moscone Center and near all the great stores for shopping.

review.title: Noisy Lobby but Otherwise Great
review.reviewText: Not too much to complain about here except that it is a huge hotel that hosts a lot of conventions so the lobby was very busy and noisy. everything else about the place was top notch.

review.title: At the Top in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had an opportunity to visit San Francisco with my sister-in-law. She had not been there in years, and I wanted us to stay in a hotel that showed you why San Francisco was such an exciting and beautiful place. The San Francisco Marriott Marquis was that kind of place. The rooms were a little small, but the view took you out of the room and into the City. At the top of the hotel, is a bar with a view that is just stunning. The staff was professional and always friendly. We had a wonderful time at the City by the Bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Bar at the top of the hotel.

review.title: Excellent Hotel, expensive parking
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. The staff was friendly. The only thing that we didn't like was the parking cost. You have to pay additional to your stay $65 dollars per day and they don't have an special rate for you even if you are already a guest.

review.title: Great hotel and position
review.reviewText:
The room was a very good size and being able to have a roll-away in addition to two doubles was very convenient and economical. 
The location was great, it was very near union square and a moderate walk from fisherman's wharf.
review.positiveRemarks:
The staff were all friendly and helpful. 
The top bar had a very good view of the city.

review.title: Weekend in the city
review.reviewText: We traveled to see our favorite city with one of our favorite couples and this is the hotel they always stay at. The hotel and staff was very accommodating and we would definitely stay again. Only regret is that we didn't press for a better view upon check in, we were overlooking the roof and were not above the surrounding buildings as I would have liked. Overall, great hotel and the staff was excellent!
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms were less opulent than I might have expected and the vanity was very small; double vanities and power outlets on both sides!
review.locationRemarks: Great central location, can walk everywhere and options of things to do are endless. Ballpark, Chinatown, Union Square and Embarcadero are very close.

review.reviewText: The hotel is centrally located.  It has nice amenities.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious rooms and a nice bar with a view.  The View bar was closed for a private party, so we were upgraded to a nicer room.  I appreciate service!
review.locationRemarks: Central location and nice neighborhood.

review.title: Nice stay and great location
review.reviewText: Great stay at a very central location with access to many shops, restaurants, and proximity to the piers. Better than expected.
Great hotel.  Fantastic view lounge. Excellent location.

review.title: there was lots of alcohol and soft drink, no tea
review.reviewText: I made a coffee but I love tea in the morning and wasn't able to make a cup.  The bed was fabulous.  All that alcohol and sweet sugary drinks sends a very bad message from the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was wonderful and the room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide a kettle in each room so guests can make hot tea.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great and I enjoyed a walk in the park nearby.  It was so convenient to downtown.  I did plenty of retail shopping.

review.title: Overnight Guest
review.reviewText: Comfortable environment and staff. Relaxed lobby despite the many guests.  The concierge was very helpful.  The lobby bar layout was conducive to meeting new people, and the 39th street bar with its views as really nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy check in, nice wide open lobby, comfortable bar, comfortable room, location.
review.locationRemarks: Near shops, restaurants and cultural venues.

review.title: Excellent customer service!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very knowledgeable and provided the best customer service! It was also very convenient because it was very close to all the retail stores and only 10 mins away from wharf.

managementResponses.response:
We appreciate your feedback on our wine selection in our lounge. Your comments will be shared with our team, so they may review our offerings.
All the best from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Overpriced average hotel
review.reviewText:
Check-in was courteous and professional.
Room was ordinary.
Being asked to pay $8.50 for a glass of junk wine IN THE LOUNGE was an insult.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was a poorly managed mess. Insufficient characters allowed to describe the horror in detail. For $65/night it should be much better.

review.title: Nice hotel, centrally located in SF.
review.reviewText: Stayed one night.  Wanted a nice hotel in the middle of town.  This hotel worked out fine.
review.positiveRemarks: Pleasant check-in.  Helpful concierge staff. Bar on 39th floor with great city views.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing comes to mind.
review.locationRemarks: Most mid-city attractions were within walking distance or short cab ride.

review.reviewText: It was great!  Very nice hotel.  The only thing I didn't like, was that they served Peet's coffee downstairs in the lobby and it was not very good.

review.title: Spacious room in good lication
review.reviewText: Enjoyed everything about the hotel except the 4:00 check-in policy. We were able to check in early because a room was available, but this may make me choose another hotel when I have an earlier flight.

review.title: Pay for over $ 100 for breakfast and no breakfast
review.reviewText: Call operator what time conciere breakfast close she said 10 am and actually they close at 9 , so no breakfast sheets are dirty , pillows had black small bugs , I would not recommend to no body , and front desk offer me muffin for $ 100  it's shame
Very nice hotel. Great location. Friendly staff and a good rate.

review.title: Nice hotel in a good location near Union Square.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location- near Union Square and easily accessible by bus, trolley, etc. Rooms are basic, fitness center and pool are nice. The staff were all very helpful. One negative- parking is expensive-$75/day for SUV.

review.title: Marriott Marquis
review.reviewText: Great location for shopping & cable car.. about 1.4 miles from Fisherman's wharf if you're feeling energetic and enjoy steep climbs..! great views from art deco bar on floor 39 and hotel facilities are first class.. would highly recommend this hotel.. (only negative would be the $74 per night charge for car parking but anywhere in the city is pretty much the same)

review.title: Excelent
review.reviewText: Thanks Ranel for been so nice! Me and my friend we had a blast weekend!

review.title: Baseball weekend
review.reviewText: Great proximity to AT&T park.  The View on the 39th floor is a great place for a drink.  Good hotel. But don't park here!!! $65/day is outrageous.

review.title: Surprising Gem
review.reviewText: Chose for accessibility to AT&T. Surprised by the luxury. Room was perfect. Did not hear any other guests.  Use the valet parking so worth the extra expense.
review.positiveRemarks: The Spa and Pool amenities most enjoyable. The staff always pleasant and accommodating.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Cliff,
What a pleasure to learn you enjoyed your stay and our hosts met all your expectations! We appreciate you choosing to stay with us and we look forward to welcoming you back the next time your travels bring you to San Francisco.
Kind regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.reviewText: As a business traveler, this hotel provides all the best in amenities and comfort. The Staff is very accommodating on special requests and very respectful.

review.title: great hotel great locatin
review.reviewText: Overall everything was great - we were greeted at the door very friendly and helpful staff

review.title: Nice choice for quick visit to SF
review.reviewText: This is an excellent modern hotel in the heart of San Francisco. The Concierge service is staffed full time and has plenty of helpful information for dining and getting around. Would recommend arriving on convenient BART or by Taxi as parking is very expensive. You don't need a car anyway because you are in the middle of SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, facilities, close to Bart, the View bar on 36th floor
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby acoustics make it mighty noisey
review.locationRemarks: China Town, Shopping, Ferries, Bart, Business District

review.reviewText: Well run hotel, friendly staff that help immediately when you walk in.

review.title: Marriott Marquis
review.reviewText: Nice staff, especially the consieres. Comfortable room and good climate control. Very quiet and easy to sleep. Too expensive for breakfast in the 2nd floor grill.
review.positiveRemarks: Room, consieres, bell hop, housekeeping staff
review.negativeRemarks: Price for breakfast buffet is too high. Not worth it!
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to union square. Good shopping around hotel

review.reviewText: Hotel was very nice and upscale. Room was clean and the staff extremely polite. I would recommend to a friend and plan to return soon!
review.positiveRemarks: everything was good and location ideal for me
review.locationRemarks: Giants baseball!

review.reviewText: Great Hotel. Great amenities. Very convenient, central location. Clean room. This is one of the nicer Marriott hotels. I recommend staying here for a quick visit to SF

This location is very nice. You can go union square soon. Also this place is very safe. I came back at 11pm but I don't think it is dangerous.
I wanna use next time!!!!!!!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: This hotel is right next to union square! It s immense which can be a bit stressful but the rooms are good size amd comfortable. Staff was very helpful! The gym in pristine condition!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thanks so much for spending your Mother's Day getaway with us!
Come back soon for another well deserved break.

review.title: Wonderful, a much needed Mother's Day break!
review.reviewText: Had the best massage!  Irena was amazing an so sweet!

Cheers from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis Team

review.title: Always Excellent
review.reviewText: I love this hotel! The staff is always super helpful and the rooms are big and clean and the gym is awesome.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent staff. Excellent rooms. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.

review.title: Great location and views
review.reviewText: Close to shopping, restaurants and BART. Only problem were the guest that were smoking outside the lobby and just being rude.
review.positiveRemarks: The view, spacious rooms, cleanliness and pleasant staff

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
We were in town for a college visit and stayed based on a recommendation. It was a wonderful hotel and would
recommend it and would probably stay here again in the future.
The only negative was that the night we were leaving and waiting for the shuttle to the airport there were many high school students checking in and being very loud and rambunctious. It was their Prom. It was very annoying to those guests who were just trying to relax before leaving the city. 
I am very surprised that the hotel allowed these young people to rent rooms. The lobby bathroom was so overrun with girls trying to fix everything before they took off to the prom venue that I could not even use the bathroom with out waiting a very long time since there are only a few stalls. I had already checked out and gave up my room key so I ended going across the street to use the bathroom in  Target. That is the only negative thing. The rest of our 3 day stay was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: Very class and clean. All of the staff from the front desk to the bell hop station were outstanding in the customer service.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't let large groups of Prom high school students overrun the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: The location is wonderful. Right off Union Square. Lots of shopping and wonderful restaurants within walking distance,

review.title: Hotel Close to Market Street
review.reviewText: This hotel overall was nice.  The lounge overlooks the city and is a must if you can get a seat.  The hotel is located fairly close to Market Street and the Bart but this whole area has a lot of homeless people asking for money constantly and sleeping on the streets.  When we stayed we smelt a lot of marijuana around the streets.  We talked to a local regarding are two concerns and he said marijuana is only supposed to be used for medical and they encourage you to give to organizations rather to the homeless directly as they have been trying to address this problem.  He stated they can obtain meals three times a day and other programs for funds.  We didn't have a problem with any of the homeless people.  The trolly $6 each way is in walking distance or take the bus for $2.25 can get you down to Fisherman's Wharf, there is a bus also that goes to Golden Gate bridge and Park.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location of the hotel, depending what your plans are.  I found it fairly central to what we wanted to do.

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Right in the middle of everything. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Steve,
We are so pleased you enjoyed your time with us as well as your interaction with our hosts. While we do charge a nominal fee for in-room Wi-Fi it is free to join our Marriott Rewards program. Marriott Rewards members who book directly on Marriott.com, Marriott’s mobile app, our 800 number, or through a Marriott hotel enjoy complimentary Wi-Fi throughout the hotel, (public spaces and in room). We thank you for your comments and we hope to welcome you back soon.
Warm regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis Team

review.title: Nice Hotel downtown
review.reviewText: Great staff. Nice hotel. Downtown shopping right around the corner. Don't know why you would have to pay $14.95 a day for internet. Most hotels it's included in the room.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Too busy trafic and noisy at lobby. May be it was Friday afternoon?

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant experience during the three days that we stayed.
review.positiveRemarks: Great for a family with kids
review.negativeRemarks: Better cleaning of the room and readiness.  We requested a crib and it wasn't in the room when we arrived.
review.locationRemarks: There is a great kids park nearby at the Yerba Buena Center that we discovered the last day.

review.title: Great view from the bar at the top
review.reviewText: I stayed here for a conference. Very comfortable. A bit more expensive than I really wanted to pay.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was quiet and comfortable. The cleaner was really nice, too. The location was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Improvements would include free internet access, space in the fridge for food storage, and a thinner blanket for the bed.
review.locationRemarks: If you're a tourist, this is probably the best location to stay in San Francisco. Near Union Square, the cable cars, trams/buses, etc.

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and  Close to everything! Bed was comfortable and the staff was very helpful. It was great having a Starbucks  in the hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is near Market st. if you like shopping. Also near to the Powell station, where you can take a ride on the cable cars.

review.title: Fine hotel,convenient location
review.reviewText: Nice, clean room, prime location in the center of SF

review.title: Great Hotel on our family trip to SF
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location near all the shops.  There are tons of places to eat that are near by.  The staff even supplied us with a refrigerator when I asked if we had one in our room.  They do come with fridges but they are full of drinks that are very pricey.  the only down side is that it costs 65.00 a night to park in their garage.  we were not aware of this.  There is a public garage across the street for half price but its not secure.  It cost 15.00 a day for wifi in your room but on the second floor you can access the public wifi which was perfect for our teens.  we had to leave a day early for a family emergency and since we booked through expedia we were not able to get a refund.  I would suggest booking directly with the hotel.  Overall this is a great hotel in a great location.
review.positiveRemarks: They have a starbucks in the lobby which my teens could not live without!  It's in a great location.  The staff was super friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Let guests know that parking is 65.00 a night
review.locationRemarks: If you like to shop there are tons of stores nearby.  Everything from 2 story Target to 9 story mall with every high end store you can think of!

review.title: Good location, but too many extra charges.
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel over several others because it offered a good location at a reasonable room rate for a downtown hotel. We were however disappointed at the many extra charges for services that mid-priced hotels offer for free. For example wireless connectivity charges (really?). It would also have been nice if they had provided a water bottle or some other thank you for staying with us amenity.
review.negativeRemarks: Fewer charges for services that can be obtained free elsewhere.
review.locationRemarks: It was nice having a Starbucks in the hotel.

review.title: Overnight business stay
review.reviewText:
I selected the Hotel on line and it was more than I expected. I wish I could have stayed longer to take advantage of more of the amenities. A great location that saved me having to use a cab. I would stay there again if given the opportunity. 
The facility and staff were great. The room was outstanding and very quite and comfortable. 
I made and excellent choice and would recommend this hotel to anyone that I know.
review.negativeRemarks: Sure reduce the price a little or give me a free buffet.
review.locationRemarks: The location was critical for my business trip and it was within three blocks. Restaurants and other attractions were easily reached.

review.reviewText: The stuff is great and the location is great too! Except if you drive a car, the valet parking is 65/ night. It is expensive

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, the check-in process was really quick. The front desk attendant was really nice and gave us a lot of tips regarding transportation and also changed our room to a higher floor/better view. The bar at the lobby has great food and several local beers. The bar at the top of the building is awesome with a great view, but always crowded! The only bad thing about the hotel is that the wifi is not free.
review.positiveRemarks: They have a nice bar/lounge on the top of the building with a nice view of the city. Great spot to watch the sunset.
review.negativeRemarks: A hotel of that level should offer free wifi to their guests.
review.locationRemarks: Close to all modes of transportation (bus, cable cars, street cars, taxis). Walking distance from Union Square. Restaurants and all types of store.

review.title: Great location and convenient to most areas
review.reviewText: This hotel is great when touring friends in the city, seeing shows, needing a pool for kids, or having a drink.  Great option when the price is right.   Best to park at the 5th and mission garage though....valet is too high and the garage is 1/2 the price.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I loved the Hotel, really nice and clean. Elegant staff was very helpful and really fast service. Beds were so comfortable to sleep in.
review.positiveRemarks: the view from my room on the 12th floor was awesome.
review.locationRemarks: everything is close by, walking distance PERFECT!

review.reviewText: I stayed for a long weekend.  Everything was great.  The beds were very comfortable and the staff were all very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge was very helpful. All staff were friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Close to many stores and transportation.

review.title: Easy and quick check in
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean.  Beds and pillows very confortable.  Perfect locatio for walks to all around the shops

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is located less than a block from a subway station and just off market street.

review.title: Excellent place to stay, close to so many shops
review.reviewText: Great experience, lovely view. Really pricey, but that's San Francisco

Very good location in the centre of downtown. Everything in walking distance. Well organized hotel despite its size. Lobby restaurant "Bin 55" was too loud. Spectacular view of city in top of the hotel lounge "view lounge".

review.title: Great experience overall
review.reviewText: Great service from all the staff. Very clean and comfortable rooms. The fitness center have just about enough for travelers to keep up with being away from home. Everything is in one building, from restaurant, the view lounge and the nearby stores makes it convenient for travelers. Only downside is the construction nearby.
It was a very nice hotel but our floor and our room had a really bad odor to it!

review.title: Great location, clean room and friendly staff
review.reviewText: This is one of the best hotel I stayed during my vacation in California. I recommend this hotel to anyone who will be visiting San Francisco. Just book it you wont regret. Everything was perfect.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room, comfortable bed, big restroom, huge closet, safe hotel, nicest staff, big lounge area and amazing service.
review.negativeRemarks: Extend the Starbucks hours
review.locationRemarks: Near Union square, target, cable cars, big retailers and all major transit

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for taking the time to comment on your recent stay with us. We are sorry to learn we have fallen short of your expectations; as we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience for all of our guests. While we understand your reluctance, we do hope that you will give us an opportunity to reaffirm your faith in our hotel the next time your travels bring you back to San Francisco.
Best regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis Team

review.title: Marriott made our vacation ugly.
review.reviewText: Where shall we start?  The moment we got there we were shocked by the $62. parking fee, followed by a 45 minute wait for our luggage to arrive in our room.  Our room was right next to this terrible  construction noise that kept us up all night.  The tv didn't work either.  Bottom line - we will not be returning to this Marriott - neither will many of our family & friends!

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Great stay, great staff.  Frond desk folks could be more accommodating, all house cleaning folks we walked by asked "how was our stay so far, do you need anything?"
review.negativeRemarks: None observed

review.reviewText:
+'s  good location, clean room, nice staff, easy check in
-'s   short on amenities - pay for internet in bus center, no coffee maker, expensive and inconvenient parking

review.title: My wife's birthday vacation
review.reviewText: We had a great time! The hotel staff was excellent. We were promptly helped with what we need no questions asked. The room was clean as was the rest of the hotel. We had drinks at the bar of floor 39 and had a great time. The food was also very good with no issues. It was close to shops and restaurants.  We'll back back on our next vacation.

review.title: Nice hotel within walking distance to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great stay in SF. Centrally located to all Union Square activities.
review.negativeRemarks: Too many added costs....
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping and entertainment.  Loved The View bar!

review.title: Nice overnight stay
review.reviewText: Three of us stayed overnight for the Rock n Roll half marathon.  Quick and pleasant check in and we scored with a very quiet 9th floor room that faced a small inner courtyard with view of the MOMA.   Very comfortable bed, but I slept on the sofa bed, which was very springy and too soft (that's why I gave 4 stars vs 5 for room comfort). We paid $80 each, a great deal for a nice hotel in SF.  Very friendly staff.  I would stay here again.

review.title: People at concierge desk extremely helpful
review.reviewText: Check in very slow so I was worried, but was room was excellent, clean, comfortable and quiet, and large enough to do my daily yoga. The staff at Concierge Desk get A+++ for excellent advice given cheerfully.

managementResponses.response:
Dear marvelous,
Thank you for your review; as this assists us in further improving our services and our guest’s experience. Please accept our apology. We'll be sure to review our policies and procedures with our valet team, so this sort of situation does not occur in the future. We do hope to have an opportunity to better experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to San Francisco.
Best regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis Team

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: The valet service is over price. The valet driver left an soda cup in my car.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jim,
Thank you for choosing to stay with us during your recent conference in San Francisco. We appreciate your comments and pleased to learn our central location worked perfectly. However, we regret our decor was not to your liking. We understand that value is very important to our guests, and we have a team constantly conducting price comparisons to ensure we are competitively priced within our category and market. While we understand your reluctance, we do hope that you will give us an opportunity to reaffirm your faith in our hotel the next time your travels bring you back to San Francisco.
Best regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Expensive and dated
review.reviewText: I had 6 rooms for my staff and I for GDC.  We have stayed at better for less.  I wont be housing my staff there in the future.
review.negativeRemarks: It was very dated and needs a face-lift.

review.reviewText: Only drawback is parking as it was very expensive.

review.title: Nice place and great location
review.reviewText: Everything was great except  when we checked in the lady was kind of rude

review.title: Weekend in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good central location for a modern, well appointed CBD Hotel.  Close to transport, stores as well as the business area.  Room a little small, but well appointed.  visit the bar on top of the building for a great view.  Highly recommended.

review.title: Really nice hotel. It is close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. It was friendly, clean, and overall it was amazing.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleaniness, the staff was friendly. It was convenient to the major attractions and landmarks of San Fransisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything was excellent, if anything needed to be improved I probably didn't need it.
review.locationRemarks: China Town was literally a 10-15 minute walk from there, and if you wanted to do more sightseeing towards Fishermans Warf it was close.

review.title: I love this hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Super friendly staff. Super comfortable clean rooms. Great workout room and pool and hot tub.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing. It's perfect!

review.title: This hotel was very convenient to all our needs.
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in the theater district and we had show tickets. Easy to get around. We were able to walk where we needed to go.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the bed very comfortable. The bars were very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing

review.title: Lively Hotel
review.reviewText: beautiful place to stay. Friendly staff and very cool upstairs lounge, "The View."  I would definitely stay here again.

I always stayed at different hotels in Union Square but always loved going to the Mariott's Sky View bar. This trip I decided to stay in the hotel where I always go and grab a drink. The rooms were nice, up to date and clean. The location is perfect for anyone who has business meetings downtown, enjoys shopping, and amazing food. Awesome hotel in an even better location.

review.title: Really nice area of San Francisco, good hotel
review.reviewText: Great spot -- right across the street from shopping, the Yerba Buena Gardens (great greenspace w/MLK memorial), within walking distance to Chinatown and easy to get the bus/subway/trolley if going further. Nice hotel staff. The hotel is a bit of a labyrinth (there for a conference), but I'm sure fine to navigate as a normal guest.
review.negativeRemarks: Signage, wayfinding
review.locationRemarks: Good food all around; shopping (high-end, plus convenience stores), walking distance to a lot of good places, easy to pick up public transportation.

review.title: Very nice hotel and great staff.
review.reviewText: AC was weak in room,  so we had to open windows to stay cool.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff very friendly and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: AC was not cooling very well.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square and everything you want to see.  Really convenient to see the City.

review.title: Stayed there for my 50th bday!!
review.reviewText: Had a great time with friends.  I got to experience THe View lounge.  Definitely amazing.  The room was clean and comfortable.  The only thing is that I wish it had s fridge!

review.title: Superb weekend getaway!
review.reviewText: Long weekend in San Francisco. Nice hotel with very pleasant and helpful staff.

review.title: Felt welcome during my stay !
review.reviewText: Great friendly staff always great you, very enjoyable very clean hotel!! I highly recommend this hotel!
The room was very quiet and the desk staff were very helpful.

review.title: Great!!!
review.reviewText:
Great!!! Great!!! Great!!!
Great!!! Great!!! Great!!!
Great!!! Great!!! Great!!!
review.negativeRemarks: The suttle attendance
review.locationRemarks: really well

review.title: Confirmed isn't always so!
review.reviewText: Confirmed a king non-smoking. Was told they gave my room away. That I should always call the hotel directly to re-confirm. Not the end of the world. Would appreciate arriving to the room I had confirmed next stay.

review.title: Perfect location to everything!
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel to everyone!  The Marriott Marquis has great customer service and walking distance to restaurants, shops, and even church.  It is at the center of everything.  The valet parking staff were very welcoming and registration was very helpful.  My family would have preferred to have queen beds rather than double beds since it was a bit small.  Customers staying at the hotel should be given a discount for parking since it was a bit expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Close to restaurants, stores, and even church.  Convenient to take a cable car, taxi, or bus.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be great if customers were provided queen beds instead of double beds.  Customers staying at hotel should be given a discount for parking.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to restaurants, stores, and even church.  Convenient to take a cable car, taxi, or bus.

review.reviewText: Great hotel. Close to all the stores for shopping and wonderful resturaunts. Bar at the top of hotel was beautiful with a view of the bridge.

review.title: Wonderful Valentine's Day and Night @ the Marriott
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I had a lovely stay at the Marriott in San Francisco.  The staff was very nice and accommodating. The food was amazing.  The room was comfortable and the pillow top bed and pillows were perfect.
Good experience in a city I've not visited very often before.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient for trolley car service to the Wharf, etc.  Plenty of restaurants and bars in the vicinity.  The BART station is also very close by.

review.reviewText: Good - would have appreciate wifi being part of the reservation.
review.negativeRemarks: I believe you should have wifi included in your price.  Once I was able to log in, it was not very good service.  With a ho

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Easy to get around town from this hotel. beautiful hotel, and the price was good too.

review.title: Great location to Moscone Center
review.reviewText: Great experience. Nice location. Clean and quiet.
review.locationRemarks: lots of shopping. Movie theaters. Great restaurant options.

review.title: Volleyball
review.reviewText: Great Location.  Very nice hotel.  Clean, modern decor.  Friendly staff!!!
review.locationRemarks: Taxi to pier 39, super easy and not to expensive... $12.00

review.title: Great centrally located, near restaurants & shops
review.reviewText: Fun birthday weekend, went to the Walker stalker Convention. Had great food. The morning breakfast room service was excellent.

review.title: Rooms need more lightening in them. Especially in
review.reviewText: Rooms need more lightening in them. Especially in the closest. There was none!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need more lightening in them. Especially in the closest. There was none!

review.title: Fabulous hotel downtown
review.reviewText: This is a beautiful hotel close to everything! Great restaurants, Moscone center, shops, etc. Inside the hotel are a couple very good restaurants as well as an awesome lounge on the 38th floor with amazing views of the city. The rooms are very spacious, clean, and comfortable. I will definitely be staying here again. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.
Pleasant experience. Comfy bed. Wish they provided air conditioner. Had to open windows for comfort.

review.title: Perfect hotel.
review.reviewText: Really awesome staff. Great location. Rooms are perfect. Not a lot of noise travels through the walls. I love this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of the city
review.reviewText: Quick, trip in and out of the city, hotel is centrally located to public transportation, convention center and Union Square.  Lobby is nice, amenities decent...no complaints.
Very helpful staff, busy happening lobby. That's it

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Overnight stay
review.reviewText: The check in process was very poor: only two people working and the process took over 30 minutes.  The entrance foyer was incredibly noisy, crowded, such that you could not walk easily with your luggage to the elevators.  Room service (they told me when I ordered) would take 75 minutes to arrive (and it did).
review.negativeRemarks: Check in process; timeliness of room service.

review.reviewText: Everything was fine. Location very convenient. Hotel very clean and comfortable.
The hotel had great location and offered great amenities.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Awesome hotel in the heart of San francisco down town only 2 minutes walking to union square. every thing was just perfect about this hotel. I totally recommend it.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Everything
review.reviewText: We had a very nice time there we wanted that hotel specifically for the view lounge (but it was closed for renovation). That was disappointing, however they then upgraded our room for free which was very nice of them to do! I will go back there to stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked knowing the security staff were visible throughout the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of places to shop and eat and Union Square was very near!

review.title: Old facility plus parking is $64 per day
review.reviewText: Only good thing was that its close to everything but pool and facility seemed very Travel Lodge-esq

review.title: Winter break 2014
review.reviewText: The stay at Marriott Marquis is pleasant and good, the staff are very helpful, our room is clean and comfortable, and the hotel itself is conveniently located to available amenities such as restaurants, transportation and sight seeing experiences. The only con among our experience is the parking at the hotel, specially if your driving with a family, it's very expensive and an inconvenient, you have to wait for 15-20 minutes to park and get your car.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the location and the helpful staffs.
review.negativeRemarks: If anything could be improve, it will be parking and all the constructions going on at the hotel at the time we were in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel is walking distance to a lot of good restaurants, stores, shops and museums.

review.reviewText: We stay five nights but after couples day.  Outside of road was doing construction it was so noise.  Also the valet parking was doing construction there are so dusty and noises.  Location is excellent.
Everything was excellent from the staff to the hotel.

review.title: Nice Spot
review.reviewText: Overall, we were very happy with this hotel.  Great location, close to the BART and all the shopping areas.  We would stay there again.

review.title: Breakfast Confusion
review.reviewText: Great hotel...however very confusing about where to have breakfast. We booked it including breakfast and they told us to go to the second floor but never specified that there we two different places. We went to wrong one, even when there was person checking your room number...confusing time and place...very surprise for such a chain!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast time and place...make it clear for the many of us who paid fro breakfast and your "reward breakfast" for your regular guests...
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Everything very nice. we stayed at concierge level room. The amenities were great!

review.title: Very average convention style hotel.
review.reviewText: Cramped rooms, outdated styling in the room and common areas. Would only recommend because it's a good location, but amenities very average overall. Breakfast in the "exclusive" concierge level is liking fighting cruise ship passengers.

review.title: Good hotel with convenient location
review.reviewText: The staffs were friendly, fast and efficient. The room and linen were very clean and the shower couldn't be better. Would stay there again.

review.title: Third time
review.reviewText:
I've stayed here before and will again. 
Loved the staff from the front end to floor staff. 
Easy access to shopping, dining and sight seeing.

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: Loved how the hotel set us in a corner view! Close to mall and union square

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Accessible to shopping, dining and MOMA; Yerba Buena; St Patrick's church and the Metreon. Great for walking to these spots.
review.negativeRemarks: The use of the room refrigerator.  It would be better left for the use of guests instead of stocking it with products that are not generally consumed.
review.locationRemarks: Great location to all tourist and visitor activities and entertainment.

review.reviewText: Loved the views! I would really recommend this hotel to everyone that wants to stay close to union square in San Francisco.

review.title: +Excellent Hotel Centrally Located
review.reviewText: My wife and I visited San Francisco over Christmas to celebrate her birthday on Christmas Eve. The concierge staff were very helpful in helping us find suitable restaurants and telling us how to get around town. All the hotel staff were very helpful and pleasant. We enjoyed using the hotel Jacuzzi one night.  We also enjoyed use of the concierge lounge which is normally reserved for Marriott Rewards elite members.  At breakfast there were lots of people using it so either lots of elite members were there or they had opened it up to a wider group. Nevertheless, it was a nice perk.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, quiet, and very well located, and the staff were great.
review.negativeRemarks: The concierge lounge which provided a complimentary buffet breakfast was a little overwhelmed by the number of people using it.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square, Chinatown, the Powell St. cable car, and city transit to get anywhere.

review.title: A mini expensive vacation
review.reviewText: I choose this hotel because of its indoor pool, in the city it is unique.. The location is just right... I wish their internet was complimentary so were the late check out... Especially when the hotel is not busy...They charge enough already...  I could understand if the hotel was to full capacity .The parking fee is a bit too much.   Nonetheless it is a hotel with character... That's why I keep coming every year... The staff is very polite and helpful

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very central, made it very easy for us to travel. Definitely use public transportation to get around the city.

review.title: Great hotel- centrally located
review.reviewText: The Marriott was awesome. Comfy beds, clean, great location near Union Square, and staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely return! Only downside is the $62/day parking fee. There's another parking garage down the street that's a bit cheaper, though. The bell staff can tell you how to get there.

review.title: Horrible parking!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location and was nice... HOWEVER... There was an hour and a half line to park that the valet staff did not know how to handle.  While some waited in line, other drivers drove over the curb and cut in line.  The valet staff gave those who cut in a card and took their bags... They did nothing to keep order or direct traffic.  It would have been simple to ask those who cut to pull through and go around to get in line... But no.  Just charge a ton for poor treatment.  A fine hotel that is mismanaged.

review.title: Favorite Hotel
review.reviewText: I love staying here. Everything; room, gym, service, location is awesome.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location!
review.reviewText: We always make a trip to the city just before Christmas. We couldn't ask for a better hotel in a perfect location at this wonderful time of year.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Very clean hotel and love that it is close to Union Square.
Nice location. Would stay again. Easy access to the shops.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel... Not a Fan of Bin 55
review.reviewText:
I stayed with my granddaughter at this hotel the weekend before Christmas so the hotel was exceptionally beautiful with all of the holiday decorations. We enjoyed the gingerbread house contest display and were grateful for the Starbucks in the lobby. The location near Union Square made shopping, dining and cable car access very convenient. 
The one problem we had was trying to get any service at Bin 55. Although there were only five occupied tables we had a ridiculously long wait for service. The bartender and server were both coldly polite and we ended up leaving without ordering anything beyond coffee. I don't know if they were having a bad day or if this is normal for Bin 55, but I will not go back to find out.
review.negativeRemarks: The service at Bin 55

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText: Check-in was fast with a friendly staff person. Elevators ran quickly. Cleaning staff was efficient and friendly. Hotel in fantastic central location.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Firt class all the way, exactly what you expext from Marriott.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything was great. Staff was superb.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Michael,
Thank you for taking the time to write your review about you recent visit in our hotel. It was a pleasure to read you enjoyed our central location, friendly hosts and comfy beds. However, we were sorry to learn that we did not meet your expectations in regards to the décor of our guestrooms. We appreciate you brining the room service trays to our attention. Please know your valued comments have been passed along to the appropriate management teams. We hope to have the opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to San Francisco.
Warm regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Rooms need updating
review.reviewText: Stayed for only one night after a company function. Was put on the 9th floor towards one end  The rooms are adequate but not well-appointed.  The facilities are well-kept but are not striking.  The amenities are mediocre.  There's not a lot of wow-factor to this location.  There was a room service tray and the assorted dishes outside the room across the hall that was there upon my arrival on Friday at 7pm and was still there upon my departure on Saturday at 11 am.  Yuck.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is good, the staff is friendly, comfortable bed, hot water was forthcoming
review.negativeRemarks: The room is a bit dark; the mirror is inconvenient and in a dark pass-through by the closet.  The TV reception was bad, and online checkout was broken
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, parking, Moscone Convention Center, lots of food and drink choices within walking distance.

managementResponses.response:

review.negativeRemarks: I hated that you need to pay 14 for the wifi.

review.title: Stay Anywhere But Here!
review.reviewText: Room was not ready upon arrival, even though I had specifically called ahead of time to inform hotel that we were arriving late. Also, I had noted it at the time of reservation that it would be a late arrival. Room in order was different than room offered -- I had requested two queen beds and was told they would accommodate us. However, room only had one king bed, with very little room for a rollaway bed for the third person in our group. Hotel has atrocious parking valet service -- too expensive and they caused a scratch to my car, which hotel routinely denied the claim.  I had wonderful experience at Marriott Marquis, in Miami; however I will NEVER EVER stay at this hotel!!
review.negativeRemarks: Better customer service; definitely more competent valet service.  The valet manager attitude was atrocious!!
review.locationRemarks: Great location -- very central.

review.positiveRemarks: Great location, near Union Square, Theater, Restaurants and Shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: More dining options during lunch.

Hotel itself is NOTHING to write home about. Cookie Cutter lobby, etc. The View up top is beautiful and everyone is very cordial. Rooms are very comfortable especially in the high rise tower. Other hotels like Fairmont and Palace are VERY GRAND and worth visiting amongst others, however the rate we received on this hotel was very good.
review.locationRemarks: Location Location. Street Cars, Cable Cars right nearby. Good eats, etc.

review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff. Lovely view of the city and Bay Bridge. Great location.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to Union Square. Across the street from Target, Starbucks and a movie theater.

The lighting in the rooms is abysmal. The staff are very good, and the breakfast buffet is good. The shower roses are terrible.
review.negativeRemarks: Room lighting. Warn guests when they are booking that they will not have a room with a window facing outside the building.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Walk to best shops & malls. 15 minute walk to the bay.

review.reviewText: Granted early check-in which was really nice after an early morning and long flight.

review.title: Great view from the window!
review.reviewText: I came here for my office manager's wedding. I enjoyed my stay at their concierge room. I think the only problem I had was with the outlets not working and the condition of the bathroom. However, it was made up very quickly by the housekeeping staff. They are awesome and always willing to help. Thank you for the VIP treatment.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness of the bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Golden gate bridge!!

review.title: Good location but a bit outdated
review.reviewText:
Chose this because it was the location of our seminar.  Meeting facilities were fine; good acoustics, good lunch, etc.
The room was booked as "deluxe" but it turned out to be very small, esp. for 2 queens (a king wasn't available).  No refrigerator or WiFi was included in this room, either.
Building seemed outdated in infrastructure: There was no ventilation in the bathroom, no screens on windows (10th flr) that we could easily open, didn't hear a fire alarm (but saw the hook&ladder outside our window!), and only heard every 4th word of the all clear message over the intercom.  
Staff were all very nice, efficient.  
Location was good, decent area close to restaurants and shopping.  No real parking nearby, so used valet.
In general, seemed a bit over-priced for such a small room.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, good meeting facilities, nice lounge for the Giants game, staff very pleasant.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a good restaurant inside.  Also the malfunctioning fire alarm system was scary to us.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, good restaurants and shopping all walkable.  The Embarcadero, Giants ballpark and convention center were all not too far away.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Great hotel!

review.title: Beautiful Rooms, Including Staff Who Care!
review.reviewText: After having lived in SF for years, I always love returning to the city and have found incredible hotels but The Marriott Marquis  broke the mold. Not only was the room reasonable priced, it was beautiful, with views of the entire city, and most importantly, the room was impeccably clean the entire stay. This does not even take into account the amenities that are offered to their patrons. In addition, the Staff, overall, were so upbeat and incredibly polite/happy. We even had a Staff memberar, Jennifer, who found out it was our 5 year wedding anniversary and sent a very thoughtful gift to our room on behalf of the hotel. Already having recommended this hotel to several of our friends, we will be loyal patrons of this establishment for years to come.

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We had a great time at this hotel.  We are a family of 5 and originally were all going to be in one room but then the front desk was able to find a room that would better accommodate us.  It was a bit more money but well worth it.  We ended up in a junior suite - which had 2 bathrooms - awesome for a family of 5.  The hot water taps were a bit of an issue, I couldn't get cold water in the sinks in the bathroom - but that would be my only complaint.  The bell hop was awesome at guiding us on where to go and where not to go.  Everyone was super duper friendly - I would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Yes, the cost to park at the hotel is insane - go across the street to the parkade.  Much cheaper.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants and shops were all within walking distance.  We even walked to Fisherman's Warf and the over to the crookedest street.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Centrally located hotel
review.reviewText:
Although a full service hotel which means higher cost, the Marriott Marquis is well located in the CBD offering easy access to all that one would want on either a business trip or for pleasure.  The hotel can be busy in the lobby area due to the number of conferences hosted at the hotel or nearby but this is not a problem as the staff of the hotel are well versed in looking after its guests.
For the traveller, the concierge should be the first stop to gain local insight into what is happening in the city, recommendations on what to see and do and for making bookings.
Of course, a visit to the 39th floor is a must to take in magnificent views of the city during both the day and night.  The food, drink and service at this venue is first class.
The rooms are very comfortable and well serviced by very pleasant staff.
The hotel has an indoor pool and spa which is quite rare for a hotel in San Francisco.  Adjacent to these facilities is a well equipped gymnasium.
review.negativeRemarks: This is a luxury hotel which provides all the facilities and services expected of such an establishment.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

managementResponses.response:
Dear DG Australia,
We appreciate you taking the time to share your impressions of your recent stay with us.
It was pleasing to hear you enjoyed your interaction with your friendly hosts and your guestroom was spotless. On the other hand, we are very sorry to hear you are disappointed with our décor as we just completed a rooms “rejuvenation” last year. All full service hotels in San Francisco charge for valet parking and we are continuously monitoring our pricing to make sure we are in line with comparable hotels in our market. We do hope we can welcome you back on your next visit to our City by the Bay!
Warm regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Way overpriced, very dated building and room.
review.reviewText: We paid about $400+US per night and we could have got a better room at half the price. The room was very dated. Customer service staff however were very friendly and the room was clean. Parking was ridiculous at $64 per night also.
