review.title: Confusing Hotel
review.reviewText: The lobby felt huge and impersonal, much like an old fashion train station with everyone running around.  It was very uninviting.  There are three different kinds of elevators, low rise, mid rise, and hi rise.  If you want to go to the bar/restaurant on top, you have to look around for the correct elevator, and they were hard to find. They are in different places, not together.  It's like a maze, or a mystery hunt.  I would not stay there again.  The staff was very, very, nice, and this is no reflection on them.  I'd stay somewhere else with them, anytime.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, and the staff was great.
review.negativeRemarks: The layout.
review.locationRemarks: We walked to AT&T park to see the Giants play.  This was a reason for choosing this hotel.  If you like to walk, there are many areas you can visit.

managementResponses.response:
Dear SallyL.,
We appreciate your 5-star review and selecting our hotel for your San Francisco experience! It was so pleasing to hear our location was the perfect starting point with sights just steps from our door and public transportation nearby for those attractions just beyond. We understand that no one likes to wait in lines and we try our very best to ensure proper staffing based on our occupancy. We are sorry to say that we missed the mark during your stay and apologize for your inconvenience. We strive every day to make sure each guest has a brilliant experience. We look forward to your return for another San Francisco adventure!
Warm regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Great hotel in perfect downtown location
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff, however, the hotel is huge and has a lot of guests. There was a line to everything, from checking in to dropping off our bags for storage and to get into the elevator. It was a bit impersonal.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, union square, easy access to public transportation to embarcadero and fisherman's wharf

review.title: Great Hotel near shopping and convention center
review.reviewText: Clean well appointed room was ready earlier than expected.  Staff was very helpful and friendly and check in was quick and easy.  Nice indoor pool and fitness center were great hotel amenities.  Perfect location was a short walk to Moscone convention center and shopping from high end to budget stores.  This is important with parking being what it is in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean well designed room, nice view from the room and a really nice view from the top floor lounge.  The pool and fitness center were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is really expensive at $62 a night, I think hotel guests should get a break.
review.locationRemarks: Moscone convention center and lots of shopping.

review.title: Lovely location and nice stay
review.reviewText:
The staff were all extremely helpful and kind. Check-in and out were seamless and although the hotel is huge we felt very well looked after. Great location near the Powell BART/MUNI/Street Car sation for public transport. Walking distance to AT&T Park. Target and Starbucks across the street for anything you might have forgotten.

Rooms were standard without anything notable pro or con to say. Satisfied with all aspects of our room and stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The View bar and Valet Parking were both exorbitantly expensive. We paid it because the service was good but it was deffinately overpriced.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Center of the city. Close to Union Square. Convenient for going to any interesting sites for visitors such as  Fisheman's Wharf, China Town, for instance.
review.positiveRemarks: Quite, clean, efficiency services as for checking in/out, providing tourist and transportation guides.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, restaurants, cable car, etc.

review.reviewText: A very nice hotel which is close to a lot of the amenities San Francisco has to offer, perfect location for the BART and downtown shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish Hotels these days would not charge for Wi-Fi it is free in the common areas so why not make it free throughout the entire hotel.

review.title: Super nice hotel with many stores and restaurants
review.reviewText: Nice shops nearby, good restaurants for different tastes, very friendly employees and confortable rooms.

review.title: Beautiful Corner Room with a View
review.reviewText: We had requested a corner room on a high floor calling the hotel before we arrived as were looking to repeat the room we had in 2003 which was wonderful.  We were told it would be upgrade and we agreed.  We arrived and were initialy given a room on the 34th floor which was large but very odd in its layout with smaller windows and a catherdal ceiling, and smelled of mildew--it felt more like a prison tower room even though it was large--the layout felt claustrophobic somehow.  We went down to the front desk and explained the room situation, and the assistant manager kindly moved us to another corner room on the 28th floor which was just beautiful, overlooking the Moscone Center and Yerba Buena Gardens.  The room was perfect, the hotel room was quiet and the staff very courteous.  If you're looking to be near all the shops and Union Square, with easy access to the Powell Street Cable car, this is a very good place to stay.  Also, you can park reasonably (as San Francisco rates go) at the huge 5th & Mission parking garage a kitty corner across from the hotel and very easy to get to.  The lobby itself isn't a place we would want to spend time in as the decor and layout seemed comforable but it doesn't have any ambience, There's also a bar on the top floor with a specular view of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The room, the views and the staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby decor.
review.locationRemarks: Great access to Union Square and shopping as well as parking garage at 5th and Mission.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Our family of four- (2 kids under 5) were very comfortable here for three nights. Beds were excellent. Bath tub was fine, will need redoing at somepoint. Pool was too cold for the kids, but we went at night so maybe day was better. Staff was perfect and very helpful!

managementResponses.response:

Please know your valuable comments will be shared with the appropriate management team members, so we can learn and improve our services. We do hope to welcome you back in the near future.
Kind regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: waking to the bells
review.reviewText: HUGE hotel.  Next door is a church.  Bells ring prior to mass times.  One at 730am.  Woke me up.  Staff were competent but not overly friendly, especially in Bin 55

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: The SF Marriott Marquis has great staff. Everyone, from the checkin attendant and the wait staff at the hotels restaurants to the parking valets and the staff at the checkout desk, made us feel welcome and care for. The rooms were spotless and the beds very comfortable. The View -- a bar/restaurant on the 39th floor of the hotel -- has a beautiful view, delicious drinks and very tasty bar food, substantial enough to be a meal. The hotel is close to tourist attractions and public transportation. Highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet could be free. The downstairs restaurant -- Bin 55 -- is very noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Close to many major attractions -- just a couple of blocks from SFMOMA and the cable car.

review.reviewText:
Very clean and comfortable hotel. Super close to Union Square, which was great for tour Hop On/Off pick-up. Right in the heart of the shopping district. It was also a quick walk to one of the cable car turn around stops.

The staff was very helpful, friendly and attentive. They accommodated our room requests and brought an empty fridge upon request ( if you don't want to use the fridge with the "for purchase" merchandise in it).

review.reviewText: Great experience, very well situated.  Found the Parking very expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was confortable and big but it had a nasty smell

review.title: visiting family
review.reviewText: Because my family was working all day long, I enjoyed the central location of the hotel where I could shop, eat, do errands, and generally feel in control of my day without local help.  I was able to walk everywhere I needed to be.  The hotel was energetic with lots of guests; the staff was very friendly and eager to please, and they went out of their way to be helpful.  I would definitely return and recommend it to others.

review.title: Great hotel but pricey parking
review.reviewText:
Location was great but the parking was really expensive as I assume the entire city of SF is but $75 to park an SUV for one night (oversized vehicle with tax) seems to be excessive since I'm paying $300 per night for the room already. 

However, the bedding and linens were so comfortable. Only thing missing from the room was a "Privacy" tag. They replaced it with a pricey tag on everything else.

review.title: Nice hotel , great location !
review.reviewText: Great experience , it was quiet at night , slept great , comfortable & clean , great service ...was able to store our bags , leave our car and enjoy the city after check out . Will for sure stay at this hotel again and recommend to others .

review.title: Great proximity to center of city
review.reviewText: Experience overall was enjoyable.  Seemed to be an insufficient number of staff to handle large number of arrivals.  Room not equipped with do not disturb sign.  Staff a bit curt when asking them to return later.

review.title: Okay hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, this hotel was good- friendly staff, good location, and clean, however I think (hope) that I just got a bad room.  The room was an executive suite which was very spacious.  Once I tried to actually go to sleep is when I started to notice issues: two leaky sinks and due to the placement of my room, the whoosh of the elevators all night. Ear plugs didn't help.  Make sure you ask to be placed far from those.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel downtown. Excellent facilities and staff
Friendly staff ,, rooms were clean the view was amazing !!!

review.title: Close to AT&T
review.reviewText: We stayed here and walked to and from the game. Next day shopped at the incredible mall right across the street. Perfect location.

We hope that you will consider staying with us in the future and please let us know if you do. We would love to make your next stay perfect.

Sincerely,

The San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.reviewText:
Having arrived late at night , we were told we could not get a king room but if we wanted they could change us the next day . We were not that disappointed about the room so we said that was fine but when in our room we found the drain in the shower was blocked so when you had a shower the bath filed up around your feet and the noise from all the air conditioning ducts outside our window were very loud and cut in and out all night. 
The next morning we asked to get that move and they couldn't give us one then but we could check later in the day....well we were out till 10pm ..the move now was not worth the effort.
By the way they did fix the drain thanks
review.locationRemarks: Close to the cable car...shopping

review.title: SFO WeekJun20-Jul4th with the kiddos.
review.reviewText: SFO Marriott Marquis is the best!  As an Elite Expedia Member we were upgraded to the 38th Fl overlooking Oakland Bay-beautiful.  Check-in and out was a breeze.  Staff was helpful and friendly at all times from the front desk to the parking attendant to the bellboys to the gym.  The room was cleaned everyday by Elena, changed bedsheets and brought us extra towels and extra blankets.  Kids enjoyed the pool everynight as well as the gym. Starbucks and bar at the lobby.  You go out Metreon AMC, mall, restaurants are within walking distance.  Ferry Bldg is about 1.4 miles walking.  Public transportation is just steps outside of the hotel.  Parking unfortunately was a bit pricey so we found a parking garage just outside of the hotel on Stevenson & 3rd @ $25/nt.  I have looked at several hotels and compared prices and amenities and SFO Marriott Marquis has the best bang for your $$.  Most hotels in SFO does not have a pool and if they do you will pay resort fee per night (pool, gym etc.) with kids location, htl amenities, eateries, shopping(for me) accessibilities and FREE WIFI is a must- this hotel has it all.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
We are so excited you and your family enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for sharing your feedback with us and we look forward to welcoming you all back in the near future!
Kind regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.reviewText: A great place to stay with the family.  The kids loved the indoor pool and jacuzzi.  The convenient location made it easy to get to public transportation or to walk the city.

As a convenience to our guests we offer complimentary Wi-Fi in our hotel lobby and public spaces as well as our Wired for Business plan in our guest rooms, which includes high-speed internet access (wired and wireless) and complimentary local and long distance calls for $14.95 per day. We appreciate your comments, as we will use these as a tool to further improve our services. We do hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back the next time your travels bring you to San Francisco.

However, we were surprised that, even though we were told there would be free wifi, we would be charged for it. Also, we were only given one soap and tiny bottle of shampoo for the four of us. We felt like we werr getting nickeled and dimed in an otherwise nice stay.

review.reviewText: The staff is great and very attentive. The property is in a great location near Powell and Market, but it is showing its age. The room design is also a bit out of date when compared to other Marriott properties. The room design is somewhat confining, and the bathroom and fixtures need updating. The views were great. Breakfast at the buffet was just okay. These buffets used to be pretty awesome. The View lounge is great. Loved the view and the service.

review.reviewText: Our stay at the Marriott was excellent.  Right in the center of the City and we could walk everywhere we wanted to see the sites in San Francisco.  Great stores one block away on Market Street. Chinatown just down the street.  Room was very spacious and beds comfortable with comfy covers.  Enjoyed a cocktail at The View Lounge which was wonderful.  I would definitely stay there again and have told all my friends what a great hotel this was.
review.positiveRemarks: The room and beds were comfortable.  Enjoyed the pool and hot tub and a cocktail in The View Lounge.  Concierge were very helpful and friendly.

Kind regards from the San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Nice hotel, great staff,
review.reviewText:
Arrived evening just for one night on business trip and checked-in without waiting. Nice room with sitting area.
But next morning 20 minutes waiting time for breakfast. I decided to have no breakfast then I had to go to my meetings. This is not a good timing at all. There should be other accommodations for guests like opening another large room and serve breakfast there for hotel guests if they attend any convention held in the hotel.
The dining area was loud, sometimes very loud but the food was good. The menu is small.
The valet parking is quiet expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff... .... and then the room
review.negativeRemarks: Having more accommodations for breakfast if the hotel has more guests then the breakfast room can serve.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is near not far from MOMA, near Union Square and down town area.

review.reviewText: My stay was above the Rest. The room was perfect and the 39th floor "The View was great. Thanks for such a great experience. The staff was super helpful.......

review.title: Time to Update?
review.reviewText: Room was clean, however the furnishings were 70's or 80's vintage. Small room with view of the roof-top (which had workers daily walking around with our window at their waist level). This section of the hotel has not been updated in years, however the bedding was comfortable. The "high speed" wireless internet was terrible and definately not worth paying for.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the furnishings and, if you're going to advertise high speed wireless internet and charge $14.95 per day, then please make sure it is highspeed
review.locationRemarks: Near AT&T Park and all things downtown SF

review.title: 2 Day Stay
review.reviewText: Room was nice, nothing special just nice and clean. Was traveling with my brother so we had 2 queen sized beds, not a lot of options there (only one room type with 2 queen+ beds). I was a little bummed that you have to pay extra for slow internet, $15 per night. Staff was nice and helpful. Bar on the top floor was a great view, very limited bar though and very dark. I have stayed in better hotels in San Francisco so I would rather stay at the Union Square Hilton.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms and hotel. Staff was nice. Bar on top had a great view
review.negativeRemarks: Free fast internet, higher quality TV (Chromecast ready would be nice). Liven up the top bar
review.locationRemarks: Everything is near by, great location

I would consider staying here again just because of the location.

review.reviewText:
Nice. - Dan at the desk was very nice & helpful.
Only suggestion is that housekeeping put an extra hand towel in the bath.

review.title: great hotel, close to cable cars and shopping
review.reviewText: Spent 4 days over Easter weekend with my daughter. Our time was spent trying to see and do as much as possible in our short time. Enjoyed Fisherman's Wharf, eating crab, and of course shopping We cruised on one of the many cruises under the Golden Gate bridge and took a double decker hop on/hop off bus which i would recommend to any first time tourist. The only downside was the number of homeless but that is to be expected in any larger town or city. All in all we had a fantastic time
review.positiveRemarks: I liked everything about this hotel, the cleanliness, staff and location are fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Have your Starbucks stay open all day.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect. Cable car turnaround is only about 2-3 blocks away. Union Square is about 5-6 blocks away.

review.title: Perfect Hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the staff really goes above and beyond make you feel at home. Our room was clean and the beds are comfortable. Every morning we woke up well rested. Location was perfect close to Union Square and Cable Cars.

review.title: Great place to stay with children.
review.reviewText: This was a very clean hotel that is within walking distance of many activities. The staff was very helpful, the breakfast was great for families, and the hotel was clean. All you need to have a great family vacation experience! Make sure you select double and list who is in the room. We thought this was what we ordered but were set up in a king room with 4 people the first night. The hotel staff brought us a roll away because they were booked full for the night. But the hotel was very helpful in getting us a double for the next two nights of our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The prices for parking were pricey but cheaper than others in the area. Breakfast had plenty of choices!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Pier 39, Ghiardelli Square, Trolley turn around and so much more.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel for weekend getaway! Location could not be more perfect!

review.title: My home in SF
review.reviewText: Been here once before and loved it so thought I would try it again, and just enjoyed my stay. Perfect location, and a Starbucks in the lobby!! Can't wait to come back!

review.title: This hotel was perfect!
review.reviewText: The entire hotel staff was extremely helpful and courteous. We enjoyed every recommendation they made! I would definitely go back again. The View lounge is awesome!

review.title: Great Hotel in an Excellent position
review.reviewText:
After disembarking from a 28 day cruise, we spent 5 nights at the Marriott Marquis Hotel in Sand Francisco Hotel and we were delighted with the stay.
The room was spacious and the staff were extremely friendly, especially Gerry who was looking after our luggage, Margaret in Concierge and Rosana at Reception. Great people who made us feel like VIP's.

When organising some days trips, nothing was a problem at the Concierge Desk and our bookings were made easily. No payments were required for bookings.

The food at the Restaurants are also of a good quality. Basically, we had a very enjoyable stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Great Central position, secure, prompt and efficient staff. Spacious rooms that are clean and tidy. King size bed was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Couldn't find a fault with this Hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The location is fabulous, central to everything. Westfield Shopping Centre accross the road, cable cars, two blocks away. Restaurants everywhere.

review.title: If the doorman could smile...
review.reviewText:
Great location easy walking distance to plenty. Nice condition.
Plus: Plenty of I room coffee. No need to call for more.
Two blocks from Dottie's True Blue Cafe. Excellent!
Minus: The View on the top floor is only open starting at 4:00 pm so we never got a chance to enjoy it. You can't even step foot up there unless the lounge is open.
The doorman. Never made eye contact. Never smiled. Seemed to resent telling us which way to the BART station.
Parking is $62 on site. you can park in the area for $32 but no in/out.

review.title: Excellent in Town Choice for SF Visit
review.reviewText: This hotel is an excellent choice for travel and sightseeing in downtown SF. Easy to get to trolleys, great taxi service by Marriott staff. Super Shuttle for airport stops at front door and you are in easy walking distance to many local places to see. For the coffee lovers a Starbucks is in lobby. Parking for cars, but pricy as is all in SF and you have rental car available in hotel. Close to a Target for essentials and many nearby eating places of all types. Had a great time and really enjoyed staying at Marriott. BTW Expedia did a great/excellent job with reservations and air travel .... many thanks EXPEDIA!!!!

review.title: Great Hotel At A Great Price
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely nice and perfectly located to take the trolley or the BART to get around. It's pricier than other Marriott's I've stayed at, but a really good price for the location (compared to the nearby hotels). We also traveled with an infant and the hotel staff was very accommodating and understanding.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the trolley station and the BART.

review.title: Nice Hotel...Close to shopping
review.reviewText: This hotel was nice, most of the staff was friendly. The attendant in the funny suit/hat on 4th street entrance was not very friendly, nor helpful...Guess he expected a tip BEFORE offering good places to eat or maybe he is just rude. The pool/spa area very nice...hot tub a little too hot. Food at hotel was a little spendy ($21 for pancakes) so we ate out...lots of places to eat within walking distance. Parking is pretty expensive $73(SUV) $62(car)...within walking distance on Mission is a parking garage 1/2 the price...worth the short walk. Starbucks in lobby...but...the pastries sold there are made by the hotel and they are really lousy...avoid. I would stay here again. But I will probably try another spot the next time we are in SF.

review.negativeRemarks: As is common in SF and other large cities, parking is charged on top of the hotel rate. I just though $72 was a bit steep.

The San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: Nice hotel centrally located

After staying at the Marriot Marquis we came very satisfied. Not only is it right near union scquare and city center but the hotel also had an indoor pool and a great spa/ fitness center. Also, the service was great and the food options were perfect for a late night snack.

review.title: Ok hotel. Room dated . Carpet old.

It would be late morning or after noon and it was near impossible to tell what time of day it was because it was so dark. The upside is if you like quiet, that would be a room for you. The room we moved to was much better. The view was amazing.

Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your impressions regarding your recent stay at the San Francisco Marriott Marquis. We appreciate and welcome all comments. It was delightful to read you enjoyed our wonderful location. However, we are sorry you were let down by the service you received from our front desk staff; we usually get very positive feedback regarding the service they deliver and we are disappointed to read that this was not what you experienced. We will pass on your comments to our front office team to investigate the issue you raised. Thank you once again for your valuable feedback and we hope to have the chance of welcoming you back in the future.

Best regards,

The San Francisco Marriott Marquis

Valet is a bit pricey, basically if you drive your car to this hotel there is no other choice but to use their valet service. They are were very kind and helpful with baggage.

shopping, food, transportation

We can easily get what we want here by simply getting out and walking for only a mile! The facilities inside the hotel are also great! We even got to see the chocolate-made 'houses' in the hall! What a great experience!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, great facilities, and great people!

managementResponses.response:
Dear Rezgirl,

Thank you for taking the time to post your review and sharing your experience with the San Francisco Marriott Marquis. I apologize that your recent stay was not satisfactory and appreciate your feedback.

You’re a valued customer; everything we do is aimed at providing you with an excellent hotel experience.

I completely understand your frustration during your visit last weekend, the parking issue was something that we have never experienced. As you know this was overwhelming to our guests and our staff. While the entire city experienced the parking situation compounded by the Santa-Con Event and holiday shopping there is no excuse for not informing those waiting for parking of the current situation and for that I apologize.

Once again, please accept my apology. We would like to regain your trust and we hope you will allow us an opportunity to provide you with an exceptional guest experience when your travels bring you back to this area

Sincerely ,

The San Francisco Marriott Marquis

review.title: not prepared for the Christmas crowds!!
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was nice, room was clean and view beautiful! We checked in but NOT our car! Anyone and everyone knows that in San Francisco you have to have a hotel with parking!!! We waited in line on the STREET for about 45 minutes not moving an inch, there must have been about 20 cars all waiting with us. I got out of the car to check in since we were NOT moving, got in line to check in inside the lobby, checked in, then went BACK outside to the car so that we could check our car and get our luggage. After an hour and 15 minutes we made it into the driveway ONLY to be told, "there was no more parking available there at the hotel", oh my god!!! We were incensed, why didn't they tell us as soon as they KNEW there was no parking available, there were about 10 cars behind us still waiting and so I am sure they were very upset as well. It totally soured our whole experience there, we will NEVER stay there again, back to the Hyatt Embarcadero for us! We were told by the staff that there "was a parking garage adjacent to the hotel..." and that the "locals took up more of the parking spots due to a Christmas party...." end of our sad tale..
review.negativeRemarks: better parking staff and more parking

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: this was the cleanest hotel I've been in and the staff were friendly and helpful. top floor restaurant was chaos (find your own seat) and a very limited menu but the view was wonderful. we went the weekend between Christmas and new years and the entire city was packed. a beautiful Catholic church next door (literally) and the trolley started a block or so away.
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness staff helpfulness location large room (2 beds)
review.locationRemarks: trolley stop close by beautiful views from top floor restaurant great restaurants close beautiful Catholic church next door

review.title: Just what we needed.
review.reviewText:
We wanted to stay in the city instead of driving back down the peninsula and we wanted to be within walking distance of high-end bars and restaurants. The room was nice, really cool view. It was modern but not over the top, which is fine since in SF you rarely want to stay in the room unless you're sleeping.

The walls were not as sound-proof as I would have preferred. It might have had to do with the fact that it was a tandem-type room in which a door separated our room from the adjacent room.

Overall it was great, worth the price and although it was a crowded night for the hotel, it didn't affect our stay at all. Very pleasant.

(I could only see this from the toilet). Also, I couldn't get the room to cool down at night and it felt really hot and I like it really warm but I couldn't breathe and it was waking me up. I would stay there again though and just hope for a different room.

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: You really can't go wrong with this hotel. The staff goes above and beyond to make the guests feel welcome....from giving giving us bottles of water when we couldn't find a vending machine to making conversation in the halls. The staff is superior and the location is perfect.

The hotel was nice, clean and the view from the bar on the 39th floor was great with also killer sliders and cocktails. The one negative was the valet parking: when they brought it back after overnight parking onsite, my car was was smelling very strong of Indian spices. It's been 2 days now since then and it still has a strong smell even after letting the windows open for hours.

review.reviewText:
For a first timer, we found the hotel to be VERY central to everything. We used BART, and the hotel was a one block walk. Haight / Ashbury, Piers, etc were all one bus ride away. Also could walk most everywhere (some were long walks, but still easily done (1/2 to 3/4 hour).

Hotel was very clean, used 'breakfast' room service that was delivered each time right on time, and had additional fresh fruit FREE. This enabled us to have a quick start to the day, and full.
Will definitely be returning

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: This Marriott is perfectly located. It was mine and my husband's first time to the city. The staff at the concierge counter were incredibly helpful. The hotel was super clean. The only complaint I have is regarding room service. It was just too expensive and the food was okay. However, there is an incredible place to eat around the corner (3 min walk) called The Grove.

review.title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was situated in the most perfect location. Great for walking to/from or catching all types of transportation. If you want shopping, then this is ideal for you. The hotel itself was incredibly clean, tidy and so welcoming. The room was clean, a really good size and very comfortable. The staff were lovely, during my entire stay they were incredibly friendly & attentive. The cost of my stay was worth every single dime!
review.negativeRemarks: Personally, I can't think of anything. I have used this hotel for business & pleasure and am highly impressed by the way they handle both.

review.positiveRemarks: It is beautiful and staff are very helpful.

review.title: Location was great.
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for what we had planned for the day and evening. It was within walking distance to everything from the theaters to restaurants. We also liked that we could park at the Mission Street garage overnight. The only downside was going to The View at the top of the hotel. By 4:30 pm (it opened at 4) the tables were already full by the window. Also we wanted to have a quick bite to eat with our drinks but were warned that the appetizer would take at least 20 - 30 minutes since the restaurant was downstairs. So we opted for drinks which were overpriced. Otherwise, we'd consider staying again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
Staff were incredible. Room was clean and we lucked out with a view of the bay bridge, thanks to the most helpful front desk person. I only regret I didn't write her name down but she is a great addition to that hotel.

My only critique would be the parking cost..gosh it was $62.00 for parking and I gave the attendant a $5.00 tip. I know it's SF and prices are quite high for parking in general but I wish I had noted it when I made my decision. In any event, I would recommend the hotel

review.title: Close to union square
review.reviewText:
Clean room

review.title: Friendly and accomodating staff.

review.title: Good Hotel in SOMA

It is two blocks to some very nice restaurants (Salt House and Lulu), two block from the end of the cable car routes, and very near good and expensive shopping. We took advantage of all these opportunities.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the room itself. We did not use or need any of the other hotel facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: No suggestions.

review.title: Excellent hotel, close to Union Square
review.reviewText: I like staying at Marriott Marquis because of it's location (3 blocks from Union Square, one block from Blumingdale's and Nordstrom), close to cable car line and centrally located to major San Francisco attractions (only 20 min walk to the Ferry Building or $10.00 cab ride). The hotel is fairly new and they completed some renovations this year as well. Their beds and pillows are very comfortable, they have two restaurants on site, The View Lounge on the 39th floor (amazing views), and Starbucks in the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: The receptionist who checked us in was amazing, waiters and housekeeping staff were also excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: One of their valets who is usually in front of the hotel is very rude and not very efficient. Long taxi lines usually form while he is on duty.
review.locationRemarks: Many attractions are walking distance to this hotel.

review.reviewText: It was conveniently located. Easy access. The staff were friendly and helpful. However, the hotel is too expensive for what you get. The bathrooms are small and the rooms are also compacted and the price is too high for such rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: it was clean, people friendly, convenient location
review.negativeRemarks: lower the rates
review.locationRemarks: union square is a great location in SF! Shopping, dining, sight seeing, close to Moscone for meetings, and close to Nike marathon start line.

review.title: Chain hotel with a boutique feel.
review.reviewText:
I was nervous about staying here, as I typically stay in boutique hotels. Rarely will I stay in a Marriott or Hilton (unless it's the Four Seasons, just saying!) type hotel.

EVERYTHING about the hotel, from the start of my stay to the end was perfect. Check in was a breeze (even with a 30,000 participant marathon and a 20,000 person convention in town for the weekend). The room was clean, spacious, and was fairly modern. The beds were SO comfortable (my mother stayed with me, and is a total bed snob), and the mini-bar had everything we could have needed. The bath products were from Bath and Body Works, and smelled great - I definitely asked for an extra ginger-citrus body lotion. :)

During our one-night stay, LITERALLY EVERYONE we encountered was pleasant - a front desk staff with terrific attitudes (when on a busy weekend you'd think they'd be acting otherwise!), two lovely housekeepers who wanted to make sure we had everything we needed, a bellman who struck up a nice conversation and made sure our bags were where they needed to be in a split second, three luggage storage attendants who were happy to ask about our weekend and interested in our stay, two great valet attendants (Josh and Trevor) who took total care of my mom after a stressful drive due to a BART strike, and a few other people who made our stay feel like we were in a hotel of 100 rooms rather than a high rise.

So pleased that I booked this hotel, and can't wait to visit again.
review.negativeRemarks: Free internet! Nearly every other hotel I've stayed at recently has jumped on that boat.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and is on the best side of Market to get a cab, get to the freeway, etc. Call in advance to get directions to valet entrance!

review.title: Nice hotel in heart of city
review.reviewText: Stayed 2 nights, great beds, clean updated rooms. Good value.
review.positiveRemarks: Beds, number of outlets for charging electronics.

review.title: Not as advertised
review.reviewText: Not really pleased with our overall experience although it is tough to say if this was the hotel's fault or not. The booking I made said that we would have adjoining rooms (important to us with 4 in the family, 2 teenage girls). When I checked in we were told that Expedia misinformed us about the booking and that all they had available was a room with two queen beds. It was late in the day and I didn't feel like looking for another hotel so we took the room. The rooms are nice, very clean and quite comfortable, just not what we thought we booked. Also, this hotel is big for conferences and was one of the busiest hotels I have ever experienced. The lobby was a zoo all day and night. We waited almost 30 minutes to get our car from the valet because they were run off their feet. Not a relaxing place to stay at all.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is good, close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking is incredibly cramped and busy.

review.title: Nice hotel close to union square and Shopping area
review.reviewText:
It was a good experience with the family.
Good location near a variety of shops.
Lots of nearby restaurants.
would definitely come again.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking is so expensive !!!!! Probably do not need a car at all.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, westfield shopping center, theaters and dining areas. location was excellent

review.title: Great SF Hotel Choice
review.reviewText: I highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling to SF. I stayed with a friend for a quick weekend trip. It's very centrally located...right on the edge of Union Square but a block away so not as crazy busy. Tons of restaurants, stores, transportation in very close walking distance. Yerba Buena Park is right across the street. Since it's in South Market (SoMa) the prices were much cheaper than just a few blocks away. The front desk guy who checked us in was super friendly and knowledgeable and answered all our questions about what to see/do in SF. The room was big and clean. We had a great view from our room overlooking the entire city. The bathroom was spacious as well. We didn't get to check out the rooftop bar, but we heard it was great and had beautiful views. We easily able to get taxis from the hotel, and all the drivers knew where it was by name. Great choice and I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Great and convenient location; reasonable price; clean, big rooms. You can always count on the Marriott standard.
review.negativeRemarks: Free WiFi in the rooms

review.title: Great Hotel, Fine Location but Less Charm
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great stay for us for what we needed for the weekend. I loved the surrounding areas that had more charm than downtown. The restaurants and shops in Hayes Valley and other cute neighborhoods were much more our style however. Downtown was good for the night life- but go out and dig into other neighborhoods to get the real feel of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Great staff, clean, everything you would need.

review.title: Good Location

review.title: Not worth the $$
review.reviewText: Hotel staff, great! Hotel food: Room service..seriously overpriced for seriously not good food. Room space: Paid over four hundred bucks for a room that was smaller than my master bedroom. Great view but SOOOOO not worth that price. Parking: Paid $65 for parking my car. That is just stupid. Ate in restaurant, also very expensive and not worth it AT ALL. Stay somewhere else!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Reduce the rate of the room, because its really really was not worth it.

review.title: Escape from reality.

photos.caption: my koala bear and the view from our room

review.title: Amazing hotel
review.reviewText: I brought my mom here for her 50th bday. Was looking at the reviews and it is true. The location is amazing. Great eateries right around the corner. My personal favorite was super duper burger. The staff was so nice and let us check in early. The pool was great and they have an outdoor patio on the same floor. A starbucks right in the hotel and a gift shop. Smack dab in the middle of the city. Easy to get around town. Streetcar and cable car stops on the same street. Clean hotel and clean rooms. The view on the 38 floor was breath taking

review.title: The Valet guys are thieves
review.reviewText: After checking out and getting my car from the valet guys, I went to grab my case that had my $200 pair of sunglasses in the side for where I always keep them were gone, told the manager and haven't heard anything. So at this hotel don't leave any valuables in your car. Read them on yelp, this seems to happen there quite a bit.

review.title: Week in SF
review.reviewText: The hotel staff and location was great. My only complaint, and maybe this is just the way it is in SF, but the room was really warm. We had to have the windows open at all times. I notified the front desk after the first night, and when we returned to the room, the thermostat was set at 60 degrees and the windows were open. I guess that either they attempted to fix it and were unsuccessful or they were indicating that is how it is. Either way, no one followed up with me to see if we were comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great for the financial district. Really close to Muni Bus lines and other restaurants and shops.
review.negativeRemarks: Temperature of the room and follow up by the hotel staff.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is within walking distance to the transportation system.

review.title: Clean, great location, great rooms

My stay was short but sweet.
