review.negativeRemarks: Switching to a Holiday Inn Express
review.locationRemarks: Your surrounded by URINE!!! The homeless defecate on the streets and there's garbage everywhere.

review.title: Very big and loud, definitely a convention setting
review.reviewText: The restaurant is too big and service suffers. I went for a quick breakfast and it took 10 minutes to get seated alone - NOT because it was full, but because there was one hostess that took each individual party to a table far away while the next in line waited for her return - one would think that the Marriott would have it figured out to have at least two people at the front on a Sunday morning. It then took over 15 minutes for a menue item to be prepared. A buffet was available but it seemed like there was no one left in the kitchen.

review.title: A little tired
review.reviewText: We stayed in room 6088. The level of noise coming from the window, which faced the "Target" next door, was unacceptable. The windows are not double paned and we could hear every voice, every siren, every car, bus, etc... All night long. The hotel is huge and the lobby is pretty impressive. However, it's pretty complicated to get to your room (and a looooong walk). The room was very spacious but smelled like 1970s. It's just need a little updating. Windows were very dirty but the concierge was GREAT! He gave us great recommendations.

review.title: A little tired
review.reviewText: We stayed in room 6088. The level of noise coming from the window, which faced the "Target" next door, was unacceptable. The windows are not double paned and we could hear every voice, every siren, every car, bus, etc... All night long. The hotel is huge and the lobby is pretty impressive. However, it's pretty complicated to get to your room (and a looooong walk). The room was very spacious but smelled like 1970s. It's just need a little updating. Windows were very dirty but the concierge was GREAT! He gave us great recommendations.

review.title: Centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: Centrally located hotel a half block away from the BART train to and from San Francisco Airport. Within close walking distance to major stores and shopping as well as many fine restaurants and Chinatown. Lobby can be quite busy at times and feel like you are in Grand Central Station. Breakfast is expensive ($22 pp for continental) but there are coffee places nearby where we had a pleasant continental breakfast for two for $9.15. There is a Starbucks within the hotel but at breakfast times the line-ups are extensive (probably because most guests don't want to pay for the pricey hotel fare). Fast check-in/check-outs.
review.negativeRemarks: More reasonable breakfast costs. Did see a bed bug in the room.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: very clean and staff was excellent.
review.reviewText: enjoyed stay very much hotel was very clean and staff was on point with being helpfull and courteous. only bummer was the $62 a night parking fee, you have no choice but to pay it really should be alot more affordable for guest .
review.negativeRemarks: parking fee sucked.

review.title: Family Vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is awesome, concierge is wonderful, its in the middle of union square so very convenient to public transportation, shopping, and restaurants. The beds were horrible, they have featherbed pallets on the mattress so if you and your spouse are to move the feather pallet moves with you. We would wake up and half of the feather bed would be hanging off the bed so we did not get a good night sleep at all. For the price of the room you would think the beds would be phenomenal. Room was stuffy, no air, thank goodness you can open the windows to get a little air. You just can't sleep with them open, the streets are just to busy and loud.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved that this hotel was close to everything, and that overnight parking was close by so you didn't have to pay valet. .
review.negativeRemarks: The room was so stuffy, we turned the air down to 62 and it felt like it was 78, the beds are so uncomfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, shopping shopping! Great restaurants are walking distance away.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Room was clean, simple check-in. Will be returning.
review.negativeRemarks: The price to park overnight is extremely high. Not worth having a car in the city.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText:
I was extremely pleased with my stay. Check in time was supposed to be 4pm. We arrived early(noon) and our room was ready. We were allowed to go up. The hotel is very clean and carpet new. There wasn't anything else we could have asked for in our room. When we first got there there wasn't a 'fridge but we asked and a mini one was brought.

The hotel is in a great location.

I highly recommend this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and the staff was friendly.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great...near to all public transportation

review.title: Good hotel right off of Market street
review.reviewText: Great location; right off of Market street. Really nice hotel. The only down side was that there was no complimentary breakfast. Otherwise, highly recommended.

review.title: nice hotel in excellent location
review.reviewText: had a wonderful holiday,weather was beautiful in Sept, we love San Francisco!!
review.negativeRemarks: coffee pot and free wifi in room
review.locationRemarks: close to all modes of transportation, restaraunts, shopping ,China town and easy to get to Fisherman's Warf

review.title: Marriott Top Notch
review.reviewText: Excellent from the moment we arrived until we left.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We were greeted with smiles and amazing customer service. It was close to the Piers and great food in and near the hotel. We traveled with a 1 year old and they were very accommodating. When we needed the stroller out of the car, the valet got our car just so we could grab it. They were very patient with us. THANK YOU!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was amazing. From the valet, to the front desk, even the maids had smiles on their faces and valued our business.
review.negativeRemarks: I can not think of any improvements at this time.
review.locationRemarks: Our main objective on this trip was to go to alcatraz and Pier 39. We were so close to both of those it wasn't a long trip to get there.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel!!
review.reviewText:
It began with the warm, helpful, efficient staff at check-in and continued on with The Concierge Desk, security, and doormen. The cleaning staff was fantastic, and we were treated royally from start to finish. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone !
Thanks for making us feel so at home.
review.positiveRemarks: We especially enjoyed being within walking distance of China Town, tour bus stops, cable car and the shopping close by.

review.title: Excellent staff
review.reviewText: The staff was incredibly personable and really accommodating. This was the best part of my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the giant king bed.
review.negativeRemarks: I would say allowing access to the lounge area even if drinks aren't being served before 4pm to enjoy the view at any time would be an improvement.
review.locationRemarks: It was within walking distance to the ballpark, which is why we were there. It was a nice stroll.

review.title: Excellent hotel with friendly, caring staff.
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant stay since the location is exactly where we wanted to be. All we needed are a stroll away from the hotel and the staff we dealt with were all friendly, a real source of delight to deal with because of their knowledge of the hotel facilities and services, we only have to ask and relevant information were given to us in a distinguishingly polite and caring manner. They seemed to have been well trained to handle guests, as guests, and by the time we are about to leave the hotel, we seemed to be leaving and saying goodbye to our own relatives and friends. Our stay at Marriott Marquis was made most enjoyable because of the staff that have ushered us to feel exceptionally good and comfortable every step of the way. Hotel facilities and amenities available to us are all good, we will definitely recommend our friends to stay at Marriott Marquis without any hesitation. We wish all - management and staff at Marriot Marquis to keep on keeping on with the attributes we have experienced during our brief stay and this hotel will continue to be an icon in downtown San Francisco. It would be nice to be able to access the great views at the top level of the hotel not only from 4 pm but from sunrise to sunset and late evening. We enjoyed the breath taking views on this level and wish access was open to public, anytime. In any case we had a lovely time enjoying the views from this level, we came home with fond remembrance of a very delightful stay at The Mariott.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything! Most of all your staff - everyone is willing to help in a very kind and caring manner. The facilities are excellent and well maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe you should open access to the top level 24/7, the views are superb and guests may miss out to enjoy due to its 4 pm onwards restriction to view.
review.locationRemarks: Mariott Marquis is most definitely ideally located being central to many interesting shops and eateries, MOMA and walking distance to Fishermen Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was all friendly and helpful. The hotel was in a great location. The hotel was very accommodating to our family
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was all friendly and helpful. The hotel was in a great location. The hotel was very accommodating to our family

review.title: A great vacation experience!
review.reviewText: I loved the location of this hotel along with the quality service and the beauty and cleanliness of the facilities. We has such a great time in San Francisco due to the location being so convenient to great museums, restaurants and great public transportation. We went to Chinatown, Haight Ashbury, Golden Gate Park, Fisherman's Wharf, the Presidio and of course Union Square for great shopping and museums. Will return again and recommend to our friends.

review.title: Great hotel in central SF
review.reviewText: Clean hotel with lovely staff and up to date facilities. Got a good deal on the room through Expedia and would definitely go back
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable, friendly staff, everything we needed
review.negativeRemarks: No charge for the sauna and steam facilities!
review.locationRemarks: Right near to city center so need I say more

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText:
The Hotel location is very convenient , it is within
walking distance to all transportation, china town, union square. The staff are very friendly . It was wonderful experience. I strongly recommend the hotel for any visitor to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: China town, union square, cable car are within walking distance .. Fisherman wharf is close about 2 mils

review.title: Great position
review.reviewText: We stayed here with children and found it suitable. The rooms were a good size, but we weren't in them very often as there is too much to see in SF. Front desk staff were helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool isn't great.
review.locationRemarks: A very comfortable stay in a brilliant spot close to the F Line that takes you to the Embarcadero. Easy walk to China Town and Cable Cars.

review.title: Marriot Hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
Pluses: We were delighted with our room which had tea maker etc . Hair dryer , ironing board
Nice staff, fast lifts, great views
Minus: Rooms all had quite a bit of noise,, ice machines
mechanical noise, etc. but then we are in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool and gym, fast lifts, amazing roof restaurant with great view and not too pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of great things to do, all the trams and public transport see to go from near by this hotel. Boat rides from the Harbour, shops and stores .

review.title: Sunny San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great city and a great hotel in a good area. Close to restaruants and lots of shops.and all transport at union square. And not a big walk to fishamans wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Cheaper valet parking

review.title: Renovated, great location
review.reviewText: Great overall. Surprised in a good way by room cleanliness.
review.positiveRemarks: Seems very recently renovated. Very clean and very good service.
review.negativeRemarks: The only minus for humming noise in my room because it was facing the interior court hosting some big vent systems. It was not a problem though, the w
review.locationRemarks: Great location in the middle of everything.

review.title: Great Central Hotel
review.reviewText: Great position for exploring San Francisco's city area, close to Nob Hill & Market Street and a stones throw from China Town. BART station and cable cars are available just across the road and you can get a street car to Firshermans Wharf also right on Market street so all together a great location. Hotel was nice and clean, a bit on the "businessy" side but nice none the less.

review.title: Great hotel, great location for eating and shoppin
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Marriott Marquis for 4 nights. The hotel location is excellent - walk to numerous eating and shopping locations, extremely close to the Powell BART location. Less than a two mile walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Our room was very nice and the hotel had numerous amenities, including a Hertz location on-site if you are interested in renting a car for a day.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very clean. Super friendly staff. Great location. Amazing bar on top floor.

review.title: Excellent location. Accessible to all services.
review.reviewText: I completely enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would recommend this hotel to friends. I plan to return to this hotel in a few months as it is now my favorite place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, theatre, excellent places to eat.

review.title: Airport close by
review.reviewText: Wish they had more room for suitcases and place to just sit down. Like a small love seat. very clean and staff very accomadating
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurants right there in hotel and shuttle to airport every10 minutes
review.negativeRemarks: More space for suitcases and room to sit and relax
review.locationRemarks: Very close to airport

review.title: nice hotel, excelent location and staff
review.reviewText: Everything was nice, looks a little bit old, but the room was at low rise and we heard the elevator all day and night, while you are sleeping it is not nice.
review.positiveRemarks: staff, location, pool , gym and spa wow!
review.negativeRemarks: you can perfectly hear elevators going up and down from your room (at low rise)
review.locationRemarks: next to union square, tour bus stop, cable car stop, target if you need something, and shopping near by.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, well situated.
review.reviewText: It was my first trip to San Francisco and it was a memorable experience. Loved the city, the city transit and our hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The beds
review.locationRemarks: Great location. A lot to do.

review.title: Easy Access to down town
review.reviewText: Access to the parking lot is hard to find, they should make that clear on their web site. One way streets made us go round and round the block before we could gain access. Great Breakfast Buffet!
review.negativeRemarks: Put the restaurant locations in the Hotel Guide in the Rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to public transport - Close to Union Square and Cable Cars to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Good hotel great location
review.reviewText: Overnight stay to attend baseball games at AT&T park. Fairly easy walk back and forth. Very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of valet parking is high.
review.locationRemarks: Location near shopping, restaurants, park and just over a mile walk to AT&T park.

review.title: San Fran Mariott
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel. Great location. Staff very attentive and friendly. Would definitely stay there again & recommend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: It was beautiful. Great location Friendly staff Excellent rooms/ beds
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Accessible to everything.

review.title: good location, nice
review.reviewText: great place to be, right in the center, good service, good security
review.negativeRemarks: nothing that much
review.locationRemarks: near everything

review.title: Close to shopping , public transportation.
review.reviewText:
Nice beautiful hotel, room size is good, the staff and house keeping service are good, the public area halls, elevators are kept clean.

Guests are professional and polite.
review.positiveRemarks: The lobby, roof top view are beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: A small fridge will be better, and provide guest to hold some especial drinks.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, hop on hop off tour, access to taxis, cable car......easy to find the way back for out of town guests.

review.title: Good location, home comfort
review.reviewText: The location is one of the best place to start the tour for San Francisco. The executive room had an extra fridge that lets you store food and drinks. Do not expect a view.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the size of the room
review.negativeRemarks: Room furniture can be improved
review.locationRemarks: Market street with shopping centers and cinemas

review.title: Good hotel in Union Square location.
review.reviewText: We were given the option of a smaller room with doubles rather than queens in the high tower with views and took it which was a mistake as the view was of other high rises and backs of buildings. With four of us in the room, we should have gone for space but the room was still good. Great location just off Market Street near Union Square and close to all transport links. The cocktail bar on the 39th floor is amazing and not stupidly expensive. We parked in the public multi storey (5th and Market?) which was a lot cheaper than the hotel parking. Having spent 4 days in SF, we came to the conclusion that we should have stayed at Fisherman's Wharf as we seemed to spend most of our time around there but that's no reflection on the Marriott Marquis.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing particularly
review.locationRemarks: close to Union Square and Market Street

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: We walked to the Wharf for some good exercise and to take in the feel of the city. Marriott always has excellent service, cleanliness and amenities. The $62 valet parking is just the price that you need to pay for the convenience in a big city.

review.title: Great location to everything
review.reviewText: Room is great and had wonderful view to the city. Bed is very comfortable.

review.title: totally great hotel
review.reviewText: We would for sure stay here again. Got great advice/tips from the concierge staff. Bell hops super friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great. Starbucks on premises. Concierges was super knowledgeable and gave excellent recommendations. Close to BART stop.
review.negativeRemarks: Walls are thin at least on the fourth floor where our room was. Person next door fell asleep with TV on - all night.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent!

review.title: Good location/bad view
review.reviewText: Lobby was attractive. 39thfloor lounge was nice. Our room view was of the A/C equipment. We were very disappointed with the view. Doorman was great! Housekeeping was not consistent. Some trash was never picked up; soap dish was a mess. Might try somewhere else next time. We were there to visit family, so would be return guests.
review.negativeRemarks: Soap dish a mess. View very, very disappointing
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping. Long walk to ferry

review.title: Wonderful Family Vacation Hotel
review.reviewText: During a recent visit to San Francisco our family stayed at the Marriott Marquis for 4 nights. It provided a wonderful base from which to explore the city. It is close to everything. The Westfield shopping centre is steps away, and there are numerous restaurants and cafes nearby. We walked to Chinatown, took the "F" Car to Fisherman's Wharf, and enjoyed the many comforts of the hotel. The staff were exceptionally helpful and courteous. I eagerly look forward to staying there again during our next trip to San Francisco. It was affordable and luxurious.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location close to shopping, sites, and restaurants

review.title: Very nice and helpful staff
review.reviewText: My only major disappointment was that when my niece got to the hotel, I should have been given the corporate over 62 rate and the dest manager refused to grant that rate. Probably won't stay there again as it wouldn't have cost you anything to have given me that rate making the trip much more economical for me. In fact my niece said that all other hotels have honored that in the past.
review.negativeRemarks: Rate handling

review.title: Great Union Square Location.
review.reviewText: Room was nicely appointed and clean. The only reason I did not give 5 stars was because the room stayed too warm even though we set the thermostat down, and we could feel the AC blowing slightly cooler air, the temperature stayed too high to use any covers at night. The lovely duvets stayed on the floor the 3 nights we were there! The fitness center is the biggest I have ever seen at a hotel! Large whirlpool and pool also a plus. Efficient and easy check-in/check-out.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location. Very easy to navigate to all parts of San Francisco by public transportion.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve temperature control. Too hot!!!
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is right at the bottom of the iconic cable cars. There is tons of shopping nearby in Union Square. The Muni/BART stop is very near also.

review.title: San Francisco.
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. The Internet connection was terrible. All hotels should offer free wifi these dsys
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were very clean. The view room was great for a nightcap.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi was Terrible. Food and drink in the hotel was very expensive
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Close to everything. Great bar across the road

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely helpful and knowledgable about the area. The room was nice and the pillows were the best hotel pillows I've ever slept on. Centrally located to get to all SF attractions.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a good location. It was clean and staff was friendly.
We stayed for two nights. Was gone most of the day on my second day and my room was not cleaned. That was a bit disappointing.
The hotel was expensive and you didn't get any extras. Parking was very expensive.
review.negativeRemarks: My room was not cleaned during the day. There are no extras like, parking, coffee etc. included in the room price.
review.locationRemarks: China Town and great shopping was within walking distance.

review.title: SF Marriott Marquis
review.reviewText: Great hotel in downtown SF! Stayed here with my family for 3 nights--wish we had stayed there longer. Close to shops and all you need. Staff is eager to help and very welcoming. Doorman has this whistle to call you a cab in a matter of 20 seconds. On the 30th floor there's a lounge/restsurant. Its a bit pricey but the best part about it is the sunset view and the Golden Gate Bridge--breathtaking! Great bistro across the street that has fabulous food and kickass martinis! The hotel has a restaurant that only serves breakfast. It's $30 a person for all you can eat. There's an omlete station, all sorts of jams and croissants, parfet, coldcuts, fruits, salads, and many more things that I'm forgetting. Staff is exceptional at this place...long story short, I would definitely go back to this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: Better pillows
review.locationRemarks: There are a bunch of restaurants and shops near by. It is also close to the modern art museum.

review.title: Convenient for downtown
review.reviewText: A very large, somewhat anonymous hotel centrally located. Was always very busy and bustling with tour groups etc. I felt the pool area could have been nicer - the floor was always wet and dirty around the sides, and there was hardly anywhere to sit or put towels. Otherwise, the hotel was fine.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool area.
review.locationRemarks: Great for transport, shopping, cable car and shops and dining.

review.title: Nice hotel and location
review.reviewText: Very good value for downtown SF. Location is good as well.

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The Marriott Marquis is in the heart of San Francisco - accessible to all shopping, Union Square, fine dining and cable cars. Tours to Napa and sightseeing in San Fran are readily available. The Concierge was phenomenal! She pointed me in the right direction in order to maximize my sightseeing! Upon checking in, my room was stuffy. The maintenance crew came within 10 minutes and had a ionizer up and running for my allergies. I would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Great service from the Bell Hops to the Doorman, housekeeping to maintenance and front desk to concierge!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I could see.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is in walking distance, Sightseeing tour busses, cable cars, shopping, fine dining and Union Square are within walking distance.

review.title: Staff is terrible
review.reviewText: Despite the stains on the sheets and the broken blow dryer the staff was terrible. They would hang up on me when I would call the frony desk to ask a question. I was hung up on 3times before I was even able to ask a question. I was also billed more than what my room receipt says. I tried calling for a week to find out why but I was hung up on or put in hold for hours while trying to reach an accountant.
review.positiveRemarks: The small couch in the room and the AC worked.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Service
review.locationRemarks: Parking is non existent unless you want to pay $68 to park at the hotel. There are poaces to shop near by and a few good resturants.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: other than waiting several hours to fix safe in room it was ok

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Clean comfortable hotel. Staff friendly and helpful
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location close to transit locations

review.title: Nice hotel great location.
review.reviewText: Spent 5 day is San Francisco could have used a few more lots to do and see. The hotel was a great location to get to everything. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff was also top notch.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is great and so is the staff.
review.locationRemarks: You can get to almost any tourist destination by walking or public transportation. AT&T park, Alcatraz and Muir Woods are a must.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location, very clean. Friendly personnel .

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great Location and friendly helpful staff - across the road from Target and along from a huge Westfield - could walk to catch the streetcar in Market St - lots of shopping
review.negativeRemarks: To walk through the driveway of concierge when cars are dropping people off there is no where to walk past as there are huge planter boxes in the way
review.locationRemarks: Ideal situation

review.title: Great hotel with a central location.
review.reviewText: My Mother and I spent 5 nights at this hotel and enjoyed our stay. This hotel is located a short walk from Union Square. It is a short walk to the Ferry Building. The Muni and BART are easily accessed. There are many restaurants nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked everything at this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: There is nothing that we can think of.
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to Union Square. The city sight-seeing tours are available there.

review.title: Great location and fantastic view at the View.
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel several times and always preferred this location. The concierge staff are amazing. Housekeeping staff are incredibly good. The room service are fantastic. Another great stayed at This hotel like the Marriott Marquee in Time Square, New York.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!...
review.locationRemarks: Wine county, Palace of Fine Arts, Golden Gate Bridge, The Presidio, Alcatraz, Coit Tower, Lombard Street, Dinner Cruise, The Young Museum, etc...

review.title: Nice hotel, good location.
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice and very busy. Staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Room was clean and available on arrival. Only downside was that for our family of four, we could only get two standard size beds.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and staff was extremely helpful and accomodating
review.locationRemarks: Wharf, Pier 39, Union square, Moscone Center, Market Street

review.title: Heart of the city
review.reviewText: Close to all site seeing venues easy to find transportaion staff very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: Later food options in hotel 11pm early cutoff wifi service not good connected but never responded,
review.locationRemarks: Nearby to all major sightseeing places union square,fishermans wharf,restraunts

review.title: Short Stay
review.reviewText: It just a one night stay, however I was very pleased with the accommodations. I arrived early and received my room very quickly. Though its downtown San Francisco and I turned in (regrettably) early, my room was very quiet. The bed was amazingly comfortable. Its a little pricey but that's downtown SF. Compared to other hotels I have stayed at in the area this has been the best so far. Will definitely consider staying here again.

review.title: Location!
review.reviewText: Perfect spot to enjoy a night in San Fran! Walking distance to everything or easy access to the trolley!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants and clubs nearby

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location. The staff is extremely helpful. Dan at the concierge was especially helpful and very knowledgeable about the area. I would definitely recommend this property.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the staff, the beds and the breakfast buffet.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walking distance to shops, restaurants and various activities.

review.title: Only stayed one night with our family (2 rooms).
review.reviewText:
The staff was amazing and very knowledgeable! We used the Concierge and were able to book a shuttle to the airport. Very much appreciated. The breakfast, snacks and desserts were great in the Concierge's lounge. Beautiful views from our 26th floor rooms.
Thank you for everything! You'all were great!
review.locationRemarks: So close to Union Square and the shopping. We girls enjoyed that a lot.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel, but it was a bit to busy. Was not able to enjoy the views of the city due to the only place to view it was so crowded, their was no place to sit or stand. They should offer park your own vehicle at the hotel not only valet parking which is over priced. It makes it very inconvienent and kind of dangerous to walk to hotel from parking garage down the street.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, parking parking!

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText:
I arrived at 23:00 last night. There was nobody to help with my bags and no offer to show me to my room. Loud Techno Pop music was being blasting out from the lobby speakers which was completely inappropriate for, what is supposed to be, a luxury hotel largely occupied by business people attending a convention.

The eleveator is located at the end of the building resulting in a long walk to my room which is all the way down the opposite end of a freezing cold corridor. Although I have 2 key cards, neither of them will open the door to my room which means I now have to go all the way back to the lobby and stand in line for 15 minutes to get help.

When I get into my room, the view out of the window is of a service roof with trash and littered broken emtpty vodka bottles. There is almost no natural light, the wifi is $15 per day and there is not even a courtesy bottle of water in the room.

This hotel is worth no more than $100 per night, not $300. I will not be staying in a Marriott again
review.negativeRemarks: no daylight and terrible view
review.locationRemarks: good for shopping

review.title: Wasn't impressed.
review.reviewText: Street noise was incredibly loud in the middle of the night. Came back at 11pm on a Friday night and everything was shut down. Could not get anything to eat or drink. Traffic made the hotel almost impossible to get to. Seemed very sketchy walking near this hotel at night too. Definitely just a mediocre hotel experience.

review.title: Great for visiting downtown SF
review.reviewText: This place is great. Very comfortable stay. Great view from the top.

review.title: Pricey but convenient
review.reviewText: You know what your getting at the Marriott marquis. It's in a great central location and the concierge staff is fantastic for dining reservations and directions. Like everything else though, you get what you pay for. Everything here had an upcharge; be prepared to pay extra for everything from late checkout to gum towels. Staff is super friendly and responsive. Rooms are clean and we had a great view of the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Location location and the assistance of the concierge
review.negativeRemarks: More complimentary services. For example: i was not happy to see a $2 room charge for a towel from the gym/ pool. I felt a bit Nickle and dimed.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of downtown shopping. 15 minute walk to the ferry building and china town.

review.title: Pretty Darn Good
review.reviewText: Great location - close to cable cars, shopping and transportation. The staff have made up a "cheat sheet" of transportation needed to get to all the touristy spots which was very helpful. Room was clean and spacious. Over all a very good experience except that they charge 15 bucks a day for WiFi - come on - even McDonalds has free WiFi !!!

review.title: really 5 hours of waiting for a cot and towels?
review.reviewText: we requested 2 queens and got 1 king, we we traveling with our teenage daughter. it took 4 calls speaking to 2 managers over 4 hours to finnally get a cot in our room, our first request was at 630pm and the cot finaly arived at 11:10 pm. the room only had 2 towels and addtional towels were requested and never arived.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: Stayed one night after visiting Napa. Great location for an excellent price. Newly remodeled too!

review.title: Pride weekend
review.reviewText: The staff went above and beyond expectations. First they upgraded our room, then took care of an accidental overcharge (our fault on a movie). They helped in every way possible.
review.negativeRemarks: parking was expensive.
review.locationRemarks: near Market.

review.title: Great San Francisco Visit
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. The fact that it is a three or four-minute walk from Union Square is, in my opinion, a plus. You're in close proximity to the liveliness of Union Square, but a bit removed from the chaos. San Francisco, as a whole, made for a wonderful four days. The city is extremely visitor-friendly, with plenty of great sites, and a very good public transportation system. Everyone was as friendly and helpful as you hope for.
review.positiveRemarks: The location of the hotel was excellent. The staff was helpful and friendly. The lobby area was a fine gathering place. We totally enjoyed our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: My room was a 2-Queen room. The beds were actually "Full" beds instead of queen. But that's a small complaint. Otherwise, the hotel was perfect.
review.locationRemarks: You're a 4-minute walk from Union Square, and a 20-minute walk from AT&T Park. There's ample public transportation to get you anywhere in the city.

review.title: Excellent hotel in heart of city
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in heart of city. Nice pool, bars particularly view. It's pricey when it comes to food, but good.

review.title: Getting there was a headache
review.reviewText: For the 2nd time in 13 years that I went to SF, it turned out that it was gay Pride Parade day. Nothing wrong with that but the traffic was a nightmare. Very poor planning from the city and for the Hotel. Streets were blocked off, absolutely crazy traffic congestion, poor parking at the hotel. When we finally arrived after 3 hrs (just from the Bay Bridge), yeah, $62.00 for valet parking..... I'm not cheap by no means...but $62.00???? You can have this place. Zero satisfaction just to get there. When I made my reservations online, there was no mention of a city wide event and that traffic would be backed up that bad.
review.positiveRemarks: The view and the bedding was very nice
review.negativeRemarks: Keep the website updated with current local events for proper planning for the guest's
review.locationRemarks: I initially booked the room because I thought it was close by Pier 39...nope, 2 1/2 miles away.....

review.title: *GREAT* Location For Powell *MUNI/BART* Station.
review.reviewText:
This is my second time staying at the MARIOTT MARQUIS HOTEL, the first time was back in Oct 2012, and so I chose it again. The rooms are clean and the hotel is in a pretty good location near Union Square.

Aside from being in a great location and the fact that you can ask them to send up an empty mini-fridge to store your own beverages, so you don't have to pay for the ones in the room, this time our room seemed a little on the hot side. I think it had to do with the location of the air vent because if you stood in-front of it you could feel the cool air. However, the beds were situated around this protruding corner, so the vent was facing out toward the room rather than towards the beds, which made it somewhat warmer than it should have been. This didn't happen the last time we stayed here.

We were on the 8th floor with a view of the front of the hotel.

The only other thing to mention is that there are limited places to eat after midnight for those late night party people. Mel's Drive In Diner closes at 12am and the Denny's near there has the WORST service that you'll be driven to either Subway sandwich or 7-11 for late night food.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the location, the cleanliness, and the friendly staff. I also like that you can request extra beds
review.negativeRemarks: The air conditioning vents on some of the rooms need to be rearranged so that the air gets circulated better.
review.locationRemarks: There's a Mel's Diner close-by but they close at Midnight. Subway Sandwich is open 24-hours. Don't go to Denny's.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText:
A little outdated, but great location. Close to a Bart Station and easy to walk everywhere.
Staff were helpful. Wifi should be free within the rooms but isn't.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a bit daggy
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was central to everything and within walking distance to the Trolley's, buses and for longer walks, to China town. The staff was super friendly and helpful.

review.title: Hotel conveniently located!
review.reviewText:
Positives:
* Hotel conveniently located to everything
* Spacious room

Negatives:
* Room smelled like a smoking room even though it was listed as a non smoking room
* Room was located too far away from lifts which was a bit of a walk
* Room ceiling décor dates back to the 1970's
review.negativeRemarks: Room smelled like a smoking room. Ceiling décor a bit dated.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel conveniently positioned but room was too far away from the lift which was a bit of a walk.

review.title: Convenient, friendly reception staff & overpriced
review.reviewText: Great location, clean comfortable, but seriously overpriced

review.title: WEEKEND GET AWAY
review.reviewText:
Great weekend everything went well, the weather was really nice everyone was really nice.
The hotel was close to everything so walking was an easy choice.
The staff was very Friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Overnight parking Cost for the rental Car
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the Piers and weekend market.

review.title: Excellent Hotel in Downtown.
review.reviewText: Great Hotel! Very close to all modes of public transit so you can reach all popular areas from about a half a block walk from the hotel. Hotel restaurants are overpriced and other establishments with just as good quality are within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Price of hotel dinning.

review.title: very nice close to all attraction.
review.reviewText:
I had great experience.people are friendly.transportation very close to all the places.Room is very nice and clean
this is the best place for family want to move without having car.
review.negativeRemarks: Great
review.locationRemarks: Easy transportation

review.title: Convenient location, great conference facilities
review.reviewText: Only challenge- our conference was held in the AMA Center and was not posted on Hotel's conference schedule

review.title: great hotel with their hand out
review.reviewText:
The hotel room was large enough for 4 girls but the hotel needs to update the full size beds to queen size bed. The west coast seems to be the hotels with the BIG charges but no queen size beds for the charges.

Also the parking charges are terrible. The rooms cost enough they should accomodate parking for their guest. Down by the Pier parking was close to $20 cheaper and I know that several hotels much, much cheaper offered FREE parking...What is your problem.....MONEY,MONEY, without a care of those whom are visiting and had to drive across the country to even afford a nice trip..... We have actually parked for weeks in Orlando without paying through our hotel experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for parking
review.locationRemarks: good, walking distance to the "F" trolley which takes you to Pier 39 for $2

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel with superior customer service! Couldn't have asked for a better experience!

review.title: Generally satisfied
review.reviewText: Hotel refurbished recently. Well positioned just off Union Square. Only negative is that the bed was too hard. Free wifi in lobby (very expensive in room), and seemed to have good bandwidth. Would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed

review.title: Good Place to Stay, Pricey to Eat
review.reviewText: Previously stayed at the Powell twice. Upgraded to the Marriott Marquis. It was nice, not fantastic, but nice. My wife enjoyed it. Downside for us was the cost of the breakfasts. We were going to get room service, but saw that a simple egg and bacon dish was $26.00 (ouch). So we decided to go downstairs and get it at the restaurant on the 2nd floor. It was only $2.00 less, priced at $24.00. I understand making money, but that's just ridiculous as a point of principle. So, we ate at the homeless and crazy person infested Carl's Jr. close by. I almost wished that I bought the $26.00 breakfat, almost. Other than that, the bar/lounge on the 39th floor was great. We both enjoyed it and got a few pics from up there.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to BART and the Great Views.
review.negativeRemarks: Food Costs
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from BART, No cab or bus ride necessary. We really like that.

review.title: Great time for the whole family!
review.reviewText: It was easy to have a great time at this hotel because the rooms were clean and comfortable and the service was friendly and competent! Valet was pricey, but so necessary in downtown San Francisco. I appreciate the attractions in the lobby to distract the kids (ok, adults too) during the brief check-in/out process.

review.title: Would definitely recommend
review.reviewText: Hotel is attractive and very well located for sightseeing and getting around the city. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. Staff is friendly and was very helpful with directions and services. The breakfast buffet is particularly noteworthy...outstanding quality and selection of breakfast items and excellent service. Would definitely return to this hotel in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Quality of accommodations and service; excellent breakfast buffet
review.negativeRemarks: Overnight valet parking is pricey
review.locationRemarks: Very well located; easy walking distance to major attractions

review.title: Nice and well located!
review.reviewText: The room had wonderful views. The View lounge was amazing! Comfortable beds, good sized and quiet room. This hotel was worth every penny.
review.negativeRemarks: I found nothing amiss.
review.locationRemarks: Steps from BART, Union Square, streetcars , cable cars, everything!

review.title: First Class
review.reviewText: Superb service from all staff,from doorman to cook. First Class all the way

review.title: VERY LOUD
review.reviewText: THe hotel was VERY loud. the doors are not sealed properly so when anyone opens and shuts a door along the hallway the entire room shudders. I mentioned this complaint to the hotel front desk and was told " I'm so sorrry, did you tell anyone else about this problem?" I'm not sure what kind of service THAT was. but this is the first and last time at this Marriott. I strongly recommend any other hotel other than this. It does not deserve the star rating it has. belongs in the 2-3 star range at BEST.
review.negativeRemarks: Room sound insulation and door way systems, front desk staff
review.locationRemarks: near union square.

review.title: Wonderful hotel, rooms should be cleaner
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights and the rooms are beautiful, good wines, very nice people. The only disappointing issue was the cleanliness of our room on the 2 & 3 night, they only made the beds and took away towels the floors were never vacuumed.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel has a great location and beautiful rooms
review.negativeRemarks: communications with the cleaning staff

review.title: Beautiful views and great location
review.reviewText: The Marriott is in a great location near shops and restaurants. Beautiful views and the staff was wonderful. I would definitely stay here next time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Adequate
review.reviewText: Hotel overpriced. Room was small & location was not goo, hard to get to valley parking do to construction near by
review.negativeRemarks: Room
review.locationRemarks: Horrible, too much construction

review.title: Convenient, clean, friendly staff
review.reviewText: This hotel was convenient to all of the places that we wanted to visit. The room was clean and spacious, and the staff were friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: This hotel was convenient to all of the places that we wanted to visit. The room was clean and spacious, and the staff were friendly and helpful.

review.title: Very nice stay!
review.reviewText: From the beginning, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Only drawback is parking. $60 a day or park a few blocks away for about $18. Still, enjoyed myself and so did the kids.
review.negativeRemarks: More affordable parking.
review.locationRemarks: Walked from hotel to AT&T park for Giants game. Easy walk. Avoided parking at AT&T.

review.title: Friendly staff and clean room
review.reviewText: We loved it! The staff was super friendly and we really enjoyed our stay

review.title: Perfectly fine
review.reviewText: Well located. My floor appeared to have been recently renovated. But a large fairly generic hotel so not a lot of charm.
review.locationRemarks: Well located

review.title: very central
review.reviewText: Just right, would say it's good value for location and facilities - pool is great
review.negativeRemarks: cost of room internet was expensive

review.title: Good location to Union Square shopping district
review.reviewText:
Air conditioner barely worked.
62 yrs old & bad knees placed at far end of several halls.
A member of Merriott Reward Card & was still going to be charged $14.50 per day for WiFi.
Were helpful planning tours & directions.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Union Square shopping district & the BART subway system.
review.negativeRemarks: Said they were remodeling in the near future.

review.title: Great hotel. Excellent location. Kind staff.
review.reviewText: Loved this place. Fantastic location near shopping, malls, right near the Powell St. BART station; short walk to Chinatown. Close to pier, etc. Beautiful hotel, very clean rooms, great staff. Would stay there again in a heartbeat! And NO signs of any bed bugs!!!
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if extras - like WiFi, were less expensive - but this is San Francisco, after all!
review.locationRemarks: Central location for all downtown things, close to BART. Easy to get to pier area.

review.title: Everything great except the WiFi
review.reviewText:
$14+ per day for WiFi is ridiculously expensive.
Concierge desk staff were the best!
Hint: Check out the shopping at Ross's Dress for Less, just next door :-)
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge desk staff were the best!
review.negativeRemarks: $14+ per day for WiFi is ridiculously expensive ...especially when it should be included, FREE!
review.locationRemarks: Well situated near the shopping district, Chinatown and lots of transportation options to Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Quick Weekend Trip
review.reviewText: We flew in Thursday night late from Dallas. Drove around awhile after calling the hotel to let them know we would be checking in late. When arriving at the hotel, we were upgraded without request to a deluxe view room which really started our trip off great! The facilities and service was exceptional. I will say that the front desk, the restraint staff on site and Specifically all the valet guys and greeters on 4th street were be far the most courteous and friendliest hotel service staff that I have seen in a long time. I did ask a few questions from the concierge desk and they were not as friendly, but perhaps its because the others shined so bright! The location is great with great places to eat and drink within walking distance. 5 minute drive to Fisherman's Wharf and 20 minute walk to ATT Park, which was great. Getting to watch the Giants beat the Dodgers in a sweep Friday night was the bomb! Staying at this hotel will be a must for us whenever we come out to watch a game again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, great service and location
review.negativeRemarks: Not much
review.locationRemarks: Great!!!!

review.title: there with family for a Giants game
review.reviewText: Was allowed to check in early, which was awesome! Gave the truck to the valet, took our stuff into the room, and had time to shop and eat. Very nice and very appreciated.
review.positiveRemarks: Have stayed there before, and love the location! and the hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: I was sad that there was no longer Starbucks at the valet parking outside desk like there used to be. Times have changed : (
review.locationRemarks: So much shopping, and so many places to eat! Love Westfield Mall!

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Had a great stay for an extended weekend. No conferences so the hotel was not crazy busy. The property is located in a great location and you are only a cable car away from Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Will definitely come back to this hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location! many clothing stores and restaurants around especially mels's diner!!

review.title: great hotel, bad night stay
review.reviewText: everything about the hotel was great, except we had to complain upon checkout about the actual room we were placed in for our stay. We happened to be put on the same floor right in the middle of all the rooms of a highschool band that was staying there the same night. We were woken up several times through the night and early the next morning by running and yelling down the hallway. other than that the hotel was very clean and the staff gave us a credit for our stay because of our discomfort.

review.title: Great hotel location
review.reviewText: My wife and I spent 3 nights over the Easter weekend and had a great experience at the Marriott Marquis. The location and staff were ideal. Even though it was very busy at the front desk during check in, Miguel was extremely professional and helpful. We will definitely stay here again when returning to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Location is near great shopping and restaurants

review.title: Great Choice
review.reviewText: Great Location right off Market street, close to Bart station.

review.title: S.F get away...
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I had a great experience. I have no complaints. We had a warm welcome when we checked in, had a nice view from the 6th floor, it was very quite on our floor. We asked for extra towels, and they were up within 30 mins. The View on the 39th floor is beautiful, however, you need to get one of the 8 or 9 tables to fully enjoy it. If you like to shop, the hotel location is perfect. Everything is within walking distance from the hotel, and to Fishermans warf is about a $12.00 taxi ride. FYI,some the taxi drivers drive fast to make it seem like their doing you a favor, when all there doing is getting you for those few extra dollars.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfest price. $24.00 each for Bacon, Eggs, Hashbrowns, Toast and Juice. It was good however.
review.locationRemarks: We took the B.A.R.T from the airport $20.00 it dropped us off at the Powell & 4th st station, which is a very short 1/2 block away.

review.title: Super Location
review.reviewText:
It's a great location in San Francisco. It's an easy walk to Bart station and all the other public transportation that runs along Market Street. The big shopping mall is a short block away and there are lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. At least 3 different Starbucks within 1-2 blocks in any direction (no need to use the overpriced Starbucks in the hotel lobby). For food nearby we liked Annabelle's at the Mosser hotel, right across the street, and about 4-5 blocks away, past the convention center is the Thirsty Bear (Spanish tapas & great beer). About 2 blocks away is Mel's diner, a good breakfast spot - they were offering $8.99 steak and eggs breakfast and the steaks were (very) surprisingly good.

Our hotel room was on the 7th floor in the low-rise corridor and faced the back of the property which is a pedestrian walkway, so it was very quiet - no street noise, only the church bells ringing on Sunday morning! The hotel staff were excellent - very helpful; especially the concierge desk.

I would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Overpriced Starbucks in lobby - really, there's no need for that kind of gouging.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Bart and SF Muni transportation stops, shopping, restaurants - can walk to Union Square.

review.title: Bad service hotel
review.reviewText: Bad service, not nice, bad experience. i called many times for service, no responds, the management is not good. employees are not nice, make you feel bad. They looks you own them something
review.negativeRemarks: Bad service, not nice, not poliie
review.locationRemarks: Ok

review.title: Nice hotel and conveniently located
review.reviewText: Most staff were friendly, professional, and helpful but some were not up to par. Had lots of problems with my bookings and made several trips to the front desk to fix things. Overall, it was good because most of the front desk staff were patient enough to fix the problems. It was stressful and tiring though.
review.positiveRemarks: 39th floor has an awesome 360 degrees view of the city! Concierge was very helpful. Most front desk staff were very helpful and patience.
review.negativeRemarks: Booking and Billing was confusing and stressful for multiple rooms with multiple check in and check out dates - was tiring and disappointing to fix.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient location.

review.title: Great hotel, nice location, good money value
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed this hotel. The room was very comfortable . The location great. The staff very nice and helpful. Go up to the 39th level to see a great view of the city.

review.title: Room with a view.
review.reviewText: Hotel room was on the 38th floor with a great view. Bed was very comfortable. Only complaint air conditioner was not very effective. Otherwise, nice place to stay.

review.title: Don't expect Marriott quality
review.reviewText: Hotel had a bad smell from the hallway to the room.. bathroom was really old and in need of renovation. Some of the tiles needed to be replaced
review.positiveRemarks: Concierge was very helpful and friendly. Great service at the breakfast buffet.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricey buffet, have to pay for wifi
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a great experience from the moment we stepped out of our car service/check in, to leaving our bags at the bell captain and checking out. The staff was super friendly and very helpful! It was close by to everything which made our 2 day trip so convenient!

review.title: Best Marriott I have stayed in
review.reviewText: Overall very good. The accommodations were good, restaurant food was good but pricey, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Service level was exceptional.
review.positiveRemarks: The people and service were outstanding
review.negativeRemarks: Road construction made it difficult to get to.
review.locationRemarks: Great location and access to many amenities, but road construction was bad in the area.

review.title: Great Hotel, expensive parking
review.reviewText: Great hotel in all respects except for their parking policy. Expedia states that this would be a "surcharge expense." I had Expedia call the hotel to inquire as to how much this "surcharge" would amount to, and received an answer of $50.00. Upon arrival the valet told me that it would be $70.00 due to my car being "oversized." The car in question was a Cadillac Escalade. I complained to the supervisor of parking, and he reversed it to $50.00; however with taxes, etc. it still ran over $60.00. I find this to be outrageous; however, it seems that all the S.F. hotels do this. Other than this the hotel was a great choice.
review.negativeRemarks: parking
review.locationRemarks: close to all public transportion and sights

review.title: A good choice in downton San Francisco
review.reviewText: Good location. Better price than other similar hotels in the area

review.title: Always a good choice.
review.reviewText: Really Really nice location. Right in the center, and great shopping and restaurant around. Hotel staff are really nice and helpful. Couldn't love Marriot more.
review.negativeRemarks: Hair drier. But I guess we get somewhat dusty hair drier everywhere.
review.locationRemarks: Great! Right in the center and also really close to public transportation and the cable cars, which can take you to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: Clean, nice hotel in excellent location. Just steps away from subway. Highly recommend.

review.title: The great visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was great! All the staff very helpful and kind. Would recommend this Hotel to friends and family.
review.negativeRemarks: Small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Great location, in the center of everything. Near all the good places

review.title: Great location, pool and spa
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location, walking distance to Union Square and many great restaurants. The hotel gym, pool and spa were great. We met many families with young kids at the pool, no doubt choosing this hotel for these amenities, as we did. The rooms are clean, though basic. The food left much to be desired though - we had dinner at the Sports Bar, and the breakfast buffet. If you are not too tired, try to walk elsewhere for meals.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We found a Condon and panties under the bed and we was with our three kids so this situation was so bad

review.title: Great hotel for students and friends.
review.reviewText:
It is a comfortable hotel. We six Chinese students lived together and had fun. The hotel location is wonderful, there are big shopping markets near there, convenient!
Though there was no free wi-fi in our rooms, every night, we went downstairs and saw dramas in lobby and the speed was awesome.
Everything in hotel was excellent and I remembered the first day, one of my friends broke her lock on the suitcase, and she could not open the suitcase. We went downstairs and asked for help. A hotel officer helped her with patient and smile. So she solved her problem quickly.
:)
review.negativeRemarks: No free wi-fi in room
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: A Business travelers hotel; not a tourist hotel
review.reviewText: A large anonymous hotel whose apparent focus is business travelers. I have stayed here many times as a business traveler and always liked it. This was the first trip where I stayed on a purely personal basis. I felt less valued on this trip as a non-business customer. The standard scrambled eggs, bread and fruit breakfast buffet was a total ripoff at $29 per person and we paid almost $70 for two people for breakfast! Skip the Mariott and head across the street to Mel's Diner for breakfast. The room was strange - it felt as if they had an extra space and moved a bed and tv into it at the last minute. The room was a large space but strangely empty of furniture. There was ZERO view. It felt a little prison like. I will seek another hotel the next time I am in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location for events, shopping and as base for seeing the city
review.negativeRemarks: Ridiculous price for breakfast buffet. Prison like room with no view and an absence of furniture. Two light weight towels seemed skimpy.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Good, well located hotel
review.reviewText: Nice, clean well located hotel.... the only problem we faced is that it was oversold and we had to wait until they clarified with expedia and provided a temporary room .... this was extremely uncomfortable mainly when arriving tired at night afeter been driving for hours...

review.title: Great NYE at the Marriott!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and nice room. Good bar and lounge areas downstairs and the lounge with a view bar on the top floor is really cool too.

review.title: Perfect.
review.reviewText: Attentiveness of the entire staff was spot on. Fabulous spa facility. Hotel was VERY comfortable in all aspects, the bed was exceptionally comfortable at the end of the day, which is essential in San Francisco. Very clean throughout the hotel. Perfect location.

review.title: Nice hotel with great location,
review.reviewText: It's a nice hotel but little bit old, great location though,

review.title: Customer-Oriented Hotel Manager
review.reviewText: The Hotel Manager was most accommodating of my late flight schedule. I had requested an extension of the checkout time and I was graciously given a complimentary reasonably extended time. I was also able to check in on the date I arrived, 25th December, as soon as I arrived at the hotel around 0930H--I did not have to wait until the check-in time.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located; excellent fitness center; great swimming pool.
review.negativeRemarks: a worn-out mattress; Mission Grill could improve their menu, although the service is just great. Wait staff is well-trained.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located - easy to get to the BART; shopping centers, restaurants

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Good room size. Great views. I was there with my wife and 5 year old son. We were able to walk almost everywhere. It is also conveniently located next to cable cars and the BART. The pool and hot tub on the 5th floor were a great way to end the night. I loved it and will definitely stay here on my next trip to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Centralized and near many forms of mass transit

review.title: Good location and staff, but wouldn't go back
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights after booking a fairly last minute break, and chose Marriott having had a great experience with the Park Lane, London hotel.
Whilst the staff were great at the San Francisco Marriott Marquis, I was glad not to be staying longer. The lobby and other shared areas look very nice indeed, but I felt that the room was quite outdated compared with similar hotels I've stayed in, and wifi was not included, but the bed was comfortable.
The spa treatment I had was interesting; if you stay here, I wouldn't recommend it. It's attached to the gym and seems like an afterthought. Again, lovely staff, but lacking finesse. I had a hot stone massage and felt like I was being pelted with the stones at one stage. Add to that the sounds coming from the gym changing rooms, and it wasn't that great!
Location is fantastic; right by the shops and easily walkable distance to many of the places of interest, such as Fishermans Wharf.
Not bad, but nothing to write home about. I'd rather pay more to stay elsewhere.

review.title: Great for whole family, or weekend girls trip.
review.reviewText: Stayed on the 25th floor. Room size was small. Forgot about paying to park - valet is 60.00 and i guess we could have parked across the street for 20.00. Proximity to shopping and other things were great!
review.positiveRemarks: Beds were very comfy although very short in length.
review.negativeRemarks: wifi was slow
review.locationRemarks: Location is great for proximity to Union Square.

review.title: Not recommended for families
review.reviewText: The hotel staff seems to be rude in the information section.
review.negativeRemarks: Access from the street to the Valet parking
review.locationRemarks: hard to get too

review.title: Great hotel for a holiday stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My 3 adult kids and I travelled to San Francisco for a holiday vacation and stayed at the Marriott Marquis. We were very pleased. The front desk was very welcoming and got us our 2 rooms well before normal check-in time. The concierge staff was excellent and had many recommendations for restaurants and transportation. The only complaint I have is that WIFI was only free in the lobby, but from all the research I have done, that is the case everywhere in San Francisco.

review.title: A real nice place to stay

review.title: Great hotel for everyone.

review.title: Nice location, service and rooms

For people that have jetlate this is terrible because you do not known the time of the day and you will miss the all nice view from this great building. The restaurant and bar on the roof are amaizing
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms with no view (see picture)

review.title: Awesome hotel.

review.title: Great location and quiet hotel for 4 nights.
review.reviewText: I left an article of clothing in the room and when I called about having it returned the quick response that it was found and they were just waiting for instructions how to return it back to me. That and they did return it at no cost after I offered to pay for the express mail fees.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bed and the deluxe room was just the right size
review.negativeRemarks: though no fault of the hotel - they had a h-u-g-e convention of people in town

review.title: home
review.reviewText: Our Stay was awesome. The location was excellent for us. I cant say enough about the staff. Always pleasant and always very helpful. The only thing that prevented me from giving the hotel a 5 star was the fact that there wasn't any Internet in the room without a charge. There was Internet in the lobby but extremely slow. And the charge for it in your room to me was too pricey. When shopping for a hotel, we were looking for a continental breakfast and Internet. I am not sure if Expedia had it wrong or if the hotel had it wrong or just very misleading. Either way we couldn't find the continental breakfast and wound up using our own data plan for internet.When we did have breakfast in the hotel, It wound up costing us over $60. for the two of us. We should have gone across the street to Denny's ... would have been a lot cheaper. If you don't mind spending money then this is the hotel for you. I have nothing bad to say about the hotel itself and the staff couldn't have been more helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: the internet
review.locationRemarks: awesome so close to everything

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Great location close to Union Sq, shops, restaurants & cable car. Great view from bar at top of hotel (2 other bars at hotel also good). Great Bistro for dinner across from the hotel main entrance. King Exec Room was great size, nice lounge area to relax, fridge for drinks. Staff very friendly & helpful. No wifi in rooms but free in lobby where there are plenty of seats (& even a Starbucks). Would recommend this hotel & stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. King Exec Room (great size for relaxing in). Staff.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Sq, shops, restaurants, cable car. Great view from bar at top of hotel. Great Bistro for dinner across from the hotel main entrance.

review.title: Best location and staff
review.reviewText: The only complaint was some things in the room were a little dated. But great friendly concierge?
review.negativeRemarks: Dated furniture in room
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location was very convenient, it was close to many destinations that we went to. The staff that helped us check in were very friendly and prompt.

review.title: Beautiful hotel and view of the city!
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were awesome! Our only complaint was that it was our first time there and we had a horrible time trying to navigate around the block multiple times because we were not familiar with the one way streets. Then, when we finally pulled up in front of the hotel we had to drive another 2 blocks and circle back around to the entrance of the valet parking. Of course, this really doesn't have anything to do with the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The one way streets to get there!
review.locationRemarks: The one way streets!

review.title: Great Location Near Powell BART STATION!
review.reviewText:
The MARRIOTT MARQUIS HOTEL on 4th Street is conveniently located near the Powell BART/MUNI stations, so you can just take the BART from either Airport (Oakland or San Francisco).

The room was very clean and the beds were super comfortable. Hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful, and even though the check-in time is listed as 4pm, we arrived at about 2:45pm and were just going to ask them to hold our luggage, but they let us check-in at that time.

Another thing that was good was the roll away bed: It's pretty large and we needed it for a friend who was just staying for two nights.

The reason it only gets 4-stars is the refrigerator in the room is already stocked with SUPER EXPENSIVE drinks like water and soda, so you can't use it for your own stuff. If you move a drink it automatically charges to the room

Another draw back is that you get charged if you want to use wi-fi or wired internet in your room. Even though the guest (free) wifi shows up on the list of options on my iPhone and Tablet in the room, we were on the 8th floor, I couldn't connect. My friend says it works in the lobby.

Ice is free and the room comes with coffee maker and free coffee. There's also an ironing board, iron, shampoo & conditioner, face and body soap bars, body lotion, and hair dryer.

The room was very quiet; but maybe nobody was booked in the rooms next to us, not sure.

The hotel was also in a good location close to Walgreens, 7-11, Mel's Diner, and Denny's.
review.positiveRemarks: Location near the Bart station. Super convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Fully stocked fridge. Can't use it for your own items.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located near the Powell Bart/Muni station, the hotel is in the thick of things.

review.title: Great hotel for a great getaway!
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel with my co-workers. It was a wonderful experience! The staff was amazing the rooms were beautiful, and the restaurants and Starbucks inside were a huge plus! I would recommend this place to everyone looking to get away for the weekend or have a business event. Will definetaly be returning :)
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful location in the heart of shopping restarunts and nightlife

review.title: Good

review.title: In the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: Had a "cousins reunion" in San Francisco, had 2 rooms, two doubles. The front desk was able to accomodate our needs, our request was to have two rooms next to each other on a high floor, excellent service! The lobby is very appealing, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and I got a great deal. The downside is that my savings went to parking, $120 for two nights, ouch! I guess it was expected since it is a major city in the heart of union square. I can't wait to go back to SF and stay here again. Close to EVERYTHING.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, minimal free amenities
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of SF.

review.title: Highly recommend !!! and would stay here again

The staff was very helpful and pleasant. It was Labor Day weekend that we were there and the hotel was very busy, but everyone still maintained above and beyond customer service attitude.....would certainly come back!! Happy couple from Florida !!

review.title: Convenient for downtown San Francisco and shopping
review.reviewText: Hotel is conveniently situated. Staff are very helpful and keen to please. Room was ready for an early check-in, and they gave us an extra hour for check-out as well, so no complaints on that score. The only reason we haven't scored the hotel higher is that the beds were not very comfy (slightly saggy mattress) and out of sight areas could have been cleaner. Hotel feels a little 'tired'. Very convenient for shopping!
review.negativeRemarks: Beds, Decor/Cleanliness

review.title: EXCELLENT VALUE
review.reviewText: KABIR, AT THE FRONT DESK, PROVIDED CARING, PROFESSIONAL ASSISTANCE THROUGHOUT OUR STAY.

review.title: Great location - but very busy & noisy hotel lobby
review.reviewText:
We had a great room, good view, nice & roomy, tidy and clean, and the location of the hotel is smack in the middle of downtown SF.
So, what's not to like?
The only reason I rate this hotel overall as 4, not 5, is the noisy lobby and bar: the hotel is way too big for it's own good (25 floors?): the hotel lobby resembled a noisy bus terminal at most times - millions of people milling in and out, crowding the lobby with traffic jams created by luggage carts that make navigating in and out of the hotel an utterly unpleasent mess.
The hotel bar is right in the middle of all this, so don't expect any quiet down time, you won't find it there. Better leave and head across the streat to a quiet local bar.
review.negativeRemarks: loud and noisy hotel lobby resembling a New York bus terminal during rush hour.
review.locationRemarks: great location, walking distance to most everything

review.title: price gaudge
review.reviewText:

$5.25 for a small container or chip that cost .69 at Walgreens? wow

Bring you check book and take out a loan!

review.title: Great for families and couples!

review.title: San Fran hotel

review.title: Great if you have an expoense account!
review.reviewText: Staff was very helpful and accomodating-although it's a Mariott and the mini bar, etc. food, etc. is VERY EXPENSIVE!
review.negativeRemarks: charged for the sauna and steam-(come on!!!!!); and the food/mini bar and parking were way overpriced! Even by SF standards.

review.title: Nice but basic
review.reviewText: A double bed room was reserved over a month in advance as I was traveling with my daughter. No double bed rooms were available upon my arrival and I was forced to sleep on a portable cot as an accommodation. The complimentary breakfasts had a decent selection. There are NO vending machines - you have to buy snacks & refreshments elsewhere.

review.title: Very friendly staff.
review.reviewText:
This is our second stay in the Marquis and it is a fine hotel with very friendly and pleasant staff. When meeting in the hall, they always make eye contact, say hello, and wish you a good day.

Two pet peeves:

(1) The vent in the shower on both stays was caked with dust/dirt. It is highly visible and, therefore, always leaves me to wonder why they are not wiped when cleaning the shower/tub.

(2) Only two thin towels. Yes, only two of us stayed in the room, but one of us having long hair, an additional towel would have been welcome without having to call housekeeping.

We enjoyed a cocktail in the View and it is a great little meeting place with good drinks and tasty snacks. Service is somewhat slow and ordering an appetizer took quite some doing and a long wait for it to arrive. Just leave time to relax and enjoy the city views and all is well.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't be in a hurry, they are a busy place with a lot of guests.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to, even for San Francisco.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: A coffee pot and glasses set in the hallway outside a room for 3 days.
