review.title: Greg's Marriot stay
review.reviewText:
The biggest gripe is that the valet entrance is NOT on 4th st. If you set your navigation to 786 Mission street you will be alright. They have a nice fitness center and a nice pool and spa. There is a restaurant on the 39th floor with a wonderful view and the food is excellant also. There's 2 Walgreens on Market Street real close to the hotel. If you don't mind paying 8 bucks for a bottle of water then don't bother with them. Personally, I'm a .59 cent a bottle kind of guy. Starbucks in the lobby open until 2pm and many others are close.

Market and 4th is a great intersection to start from if you are walking around. The beginning of the Powell-Hyde cable car is just a block away. Thats fun for a few times. It's just the wait in line that is bothersome. It takes you near Pier 39 on the other end.

The F line train runs down market all the way to Pier 39 and back. You must get a Clipper pass at Walgreens for 27 bucks per week. It covers everything you should need. F-line, cable car, bus, just not the BART transit system.

VERY IMPORTANT: Alcatraz tickets are sold out for 2 to 3 weeks in advance. I got mine by talking to the concierge who got them added to a package deal from Blazing Saddles. It was a hop on hop off bus tour that crosses the Golden Gate bridge. Note: Dress warm if you go on the top of the bus! It also goes through the Haight-Ashbury district and the Golden Gate Park. It's a good tour.

review.title: Perfect get away
review.reviewText: I personally loved the city view the convenice of the stores surrounding the hotel and what was the pinnacle for me was the spa experience that was the highlight for me
review.negativeRemarks: Didnt have one

review.title: Great hotel

review.title: Highly recommended

The breakfast buffet is a must! Such a great selection of healthy and diverse foods.

review.title: overpriced, no view
review.reviewText: WAY Overpriced....the lobby is awesome, but the rooms are like every other motel 8 in the world, it was clean and comfortable. Open the curtains and you are looking at an office/appartment building across the street (the street is 12 feet wide, plus sidewalks on both sides, so the building is litterally 30 feet away and as tall as the marriot), do not count on a view. Internet is free in the lobby or you can pay $8 a day or $14 a day depending on speed. It will not stream netflix or hulu.
review.negativeRemarks: view

review.title: An awesome hotel.

review.title: Great

review.negativeRemarks: I thought the pool would be bigger. But it's really nice that it's an indoor pool.

review.title: Typical Marquis
review.reviewText: Typical Marquis, professional staff, very busy atmosphere, nice ambiance but not outstanding. Still charging for Wi Fi is irritating to say the least when their lower end hotels (Fairfield Inn) provide it for free. Especially irritating when the food court across the street provides it for free. Doorman handling taxi stand on 5/20 morning was curt to the point of being rude.
review.negativeRemarks: Charging for Wi Fi.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown, near financial district, chinatown, shopping.

review.title: Amazingly luxurious
review.reviewText: amazingly luxurious and comfortable. beautiful view.

review.title: Clean, Comfortable Stay.
review.reviewText:
My fiance and I stayed here for two nights on a vacation to San Francisco. We were staying for 4 nights in San Fran overall and wanted to split our time between this hotel in Union Square/SoMa area, and another hotel in the Marina district.

When we checked in, it was very busy, but the front desk clerk was very pleasant and even upgraded us to a corner room. Our room had an awesome view of the city, was clean and very quiet. Bed was super comfortable. The hotel was packed with all different sorts of people (business travelers, conventioneers, families, couples on vacation, etc.), but the staff was prepared and it didn't bother us at all. There is an awesome view from The View lounge on the 39th floor.

Hotel is within walking distance to Union Square area and some good restaurants. We walked to the Ferry Building about 1.5 miles away, but we like to walk to our destinations when we travel if it's not too far away.

Would stay here again and would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

review.title: Great location and service
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is great; it's not far from a BART stop, and fast taxi service. the only complaints include expensive parking was $58/night, the available refrigerator in the room is for the hotel's alcoholic beverages sale, and the coffee maker was not working.
review.positiveRemarks: Amazing view of SF from the 27th floor
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly and the hotel itself was very clean. Room service dinner was delicious. Nice hot tub and pool. Great central location for easy walking distance to shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Superb Quality

Asked for a taxi from doorman at valet at 10:00 pm and was told he could not get us one. when asked where we could he merely said "0n the street" Not very service oriented nor up to par for Marriott chain.

You would think that the high price of this room would at least include internet access. You could get access in the lobby for free but I had hoped for room access.

review.title: The best locacion! Very Good Hotel!

review.title: Marriott Marquis

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. Easy access to streetcar.

review.title: nice hotel, nice location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. What you would expect of a Marriott. Valet was very expensive. Ate a few snacks, but was charged more for tax and restocking, ridiculous. Starbucks in the lobby closed at 2:00 in the afternoon. No restaurant, but food in the bar. Waitress was okay. Clean and a pretty lobby.

review.title: Great location, poor hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is superbly located. Unfortunately, overall quality is somewhat poor, which explains the affordable price for SF.

review.title: A bit disappointed
review.reviewText: The lobby of the hotel was nice but the room was quite unimpressive. Our 'king' sized bed was only a queen, and half of the desk was taken up with precariously balanced mini-bar items that would charge automatically if disturbed. I'll try somewhere else next time.

review.title: Reasonable
review.reviewText: I found customer service generally good. I was not impressed with not being able to enter our room when we had had some snacks from mini bar and intending to pay on our departure from hotel as what we're usually used to!!

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText:
Good location near union square, and Bart station. Hotel staff very professional.
Restaurant very expensive for breakfast if one is not on an expensive account.
Some panhandlers and drug addicts present in the area.
Hotel security always present. Room properly cleaned.
I would go back.

review.title: almost impossible to access because of all the 1 way streets in the area. Also valet parking outrage
review.reviewText: valet parking outrageously high, almost impossible to access because of plethora of 1 way streets in that area

review.title: Too Big for Me
review.reviewText: I had to book this hotel for a family of 5. Unfortunately they had no single room to accomodate all of us, so I had to pay for 2 rooms. On arrival, which was about 3pm, I asked for adjoining rooms and a higher floor and was unable to be accomodated on my request. We were placed next door to each other (not adjoining) and on the 7th floor. I listened to loud traffice and voices till about 2am. This hotel is one of the largest in downtown SF and I wasn't at all happy about the noise. There is a JW Marriot up the block and I would stay there instead. Smaller hotel and hardly any noise.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, clean, friendly staff, and a great location. Would reccomend and return if necessary.

review.title: Was everything I could possibly ask for in upscale accommodations!
review.reviewText: I couldn't have asked for better accommodations than the Marriot Marquis! The only thing I was disappointed about was they did not have FREE wi-fi so we actually went to a restaurant "outside" the complex to get wi-fi--I would have eaten in the Marriot but I needed to get my emails and I did not want to pay for wi-fi access.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText:
My friend and I were pleased with the hotel and our room upon arrival. We found it really close to great shopping and parks/museums. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool and hottub were not crowded and very well kept.

The best and most unexpected thing happened on our 3rd day when we realized that our room key gave us access to the concierge lounge. In the morning, a full continental breakfast was laid out (eggs too!), during the day, fruit and chips, later in the afternoon hors d'oeuvres and at night, cookies, brownies & fruit! Also, Starbucks coffee and tea, bottled water and pop was available all day. We don't know why we were granted access to it, since we didn't pay any extra, but we weren't complaining! We were on the 18th floor, so maybe ask for a room on it??

Overall, it was a great stay and I'd highly recommend the hotel!

review.title: Clean, not fancy.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed this Marriott because it was clean and located in a great area. We were able to walk everywhere with ease. The staff was also very helpful and friendly. I expected a bit more luxury being that it was a Marriott.

review.title: FUN!
review.reviewText: Upon checking in, Kenneth, was very accomadating-finding us a "quiet" room. For 4 days we didn't hear a single peep from another guest! The city sounds are to be expected, but not noise from hotel. It was awesome! beds are comfy, room was big, had 2 different views-glorious! Housekeeper was a doll, service was quick when we needed extra things. Concierge was helpful, doormen were very pleasant. Not one complaint. It is not a "luxurious" hotel so if you're looking for top notch luxury-go somewhere else. This is a very nice, aesthetically pleasing, extremely clean, centrally located, friendly hotel--but it's not the Ritz so have realistic expectations. One thing that should be better noted in the room, however, ids that the cold bar is electronically monitored. We removed their water to put ours in and were charged for everything we touched. The charges were reversed with no hassle at all, but maybe a better "warning" would be helpful to both hotel and guest. Will stay here again for sure!

review.title: Downtown Location
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Marriott Marquis for 3 nights. We upgraded to the 37th floor which had panoramic views of the city including the Golden Gate Bridge. The room was extremely large with a sitting and dining area. The buffet breakfast was incredible and easily worth the steep price. This hotel was right in downtown San Francisco. We took the BART in from the airport and back. We were also able to take the MUNI just steps from the hotel to the Ferry Terminal. A great central location close to shopping and easy to get to the other tourist locations. Bustling, busy hotel with great customer service.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: While the staff was great, the downside to a large hotel is that checking in on a Friday afternoon took almost thirty minutes. And, while the room was okay, the sound transference through the connecting doors was bad. The couple might as well have been staying in my room with me.

review.title: Great time
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our trip. Hotel was beautiful with courteous and friendly staff. Our room had a wonderful view.

review.title: San Francisco Marriott Marquis
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable. Beds were great.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Older hotel with some remodeling. It was very clean and was quieter because it catered to business clientele.

review.title: Convienent hotel with excellent customer service
review.reviewText:
We arrived 10A local time and just expected to do a luggage drop grab some lunch and come back. What a surprise when a front desk clerk motioned us over and we were able to check in so early! She was extremely helpful and unfortunately I can't recall her name but she was from Russia.

Our rooms were adequate, the LG HD was a nice touch and the bed was extremely comfortable. Housekeeping was very good and kept the room nice and clean. The hotel is starting to show a little age, but with the tremendous location right next to the Powell St. BART station, cable cars and bus terminals it's hard to beat.

A suggestion: hire at least one more person at the Starbucks station. Every morning the line was 10-12 deep and I would instead go to the Coffee Bean around the corner.

review.title: Great location. Reliable Marriott service.
review.reviewText: Best thing about the hotel is its location. We flew into SFO, took BART to Powell station, walked everywhere all weekend. The hotel staff was great. We enjoyed our stay and can't wait to go back.

review.title: Barf & Beer cans
review.reviewText: At first I was very pleased with the hotel. The place looked nice and they allowed us to check in early which was great as we were travelling with our toddler and I was 7 months pregnant. However our in-room check out did not work. I noticed in the room there were left over items from the guests before us which leads me to believe the rooms were not thoroughly cleaned/checked out. The indoor pool was one of the reasons we selected this hotel as my daughter loves to swim. We were very disappointed with the pool. It was dirty, debris floating, it was COLD, and had an awful smell. We only swam for about 20 minutes and did not use the pool again for the rest of our stay. We unfortunately were woken at 2AM by partiers on our floor. They were standing in the halls yelling and screaming and running up and down. I called security and they did come right up; however the partiers only stopped for a few minutes and then continued to be noisy for the next hour. As we were leaving to check out two days later, there was throw-up in the hallway on our floor by the elevator and beer cans in the elevator. As we got off the elevator in the lobby, there was more throw-up which my daughter almost walked right into. I told the front desk clerk about this and he seemed un-fazed and as far as I could see made no rush to get these things cleaned up. The location of this hotel was great, but I do not think I would stay here again.

review.title: Loved it!!!!
review.reviewText: The best hotel ever!

review.title: It was alright I guess
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, nothing impressive. No continental breakfast, no WiFi. You would think there would be a few more extra perks to such a nice place. The concierge desk was excellent by the way. Very helpful, informative and knowledgeable. They helped my visit to SF more memorable.

review.title: Quality hotel - close to transportation
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel. Great location near the cable cars, street cars, and bus stops. Concierge was fabulous. Would recommend to others.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: This hotel had a great location and was great for the price!

review.title: So-So Hotel
review.reviewText: This Hotel was ok. They didnt really have any good dining options. Be aware that if you order room service or drink anything from the mini-bar there will be a lot of extra charges. A 14 sandwich ended up costing almost 30 bucks and a jack daniels that stated that it was 7 dollars ended up being 12. When we checked in we asked if our room had a view. She switched us to a corner room which was smaller than the other rooms. Not pleased. This is a business hotel. I needed to print my boarding pass and I had to pay to get on a computer and then pay to print at the fedex kinkos. Anyway, I am tired of all of these hotels and their hidden charges and taxes,etc. etc. I wouldnt stay here again. It was a little outdated as well. The location was good. Central and close to all of the public transporation.

review.title: Loved It!
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived our experience was great. Milte at the Marriott Rewards Elite desk was amazing.....our room on the 28th floor had an awesome view of the city and the bay. The king size bed was super comfortable (we usually sleep on a tempurpedic mattress). The hotel is located close to shopping, transporation, etc., everything you need to enjoy San Francisco. We will definitely stay at this hotel again!

review.title: Great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in agreat location convenient to the cable cars, shopping etc. Would stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel at a great location.
review.reviewText: If you are visiting San Francisco, this hotel's location is perfect. Near all modes of transportation, shopping, and sights that are interesting to tourists. The staff is friendly and generally knowledgeable about the area. The bar on the 39th Floor was a great place for a nightcap as well. We were totally satisfied with our stay here.

review.title: Would stay again!
review.reviewText: Hotel was awesome. Great location. Street noise could be heard in the room but never bothered us. Homeless are EVERYWHERE so don't worry about anything that says they are bad

review.title: Nice comfortable rooms, great location
review.reviewText: I was impressed with how quiet the rooms were!

review.title: Close to shopping and museums in downtown S.F.
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located for my needs and in general was very nice. The few downsides: the Starbucks in the lobby closed extremely early and there were no soda machines or other places to buy beverages after the Starbucks and lobby shop closed. Your choice was then to either walk down the street to Walgreens or purchase an expensive beverage from the snack bar in your room (or use room service). I also had a few comfort issues with the bed being too soft and the room getting rather stuffy, but these were overall not huge concerns and may just reflect my personal preferences. The staff provided excellent service and the food in the hotel's restaurants was very good. I would stay there again.

review.title: Great San Fran location
review.reviewText:
The Marriott Marquis is a terrific property for a number of reasons. The rooms are really good and best of all the location is outstanding with easy access to the convention center, Market Street and Union Square.

The rooms are very comfortable, with good seating and workspace. Best of all, it's just a really comfortable place and you can get terrific prices on the weekend.

review.title: San Fran's best hotel
review.reviewText: This was the most confortable hotel that I've stayed in. Great location too. Friendly staff

review.title: Change Hotels
review.reviewText: Rooms extremely small, no counter space in the bathroom, central unit did not function properly.

review.title: will definitely stay here again
review.reviewText: The hotel was packaged with airfare and was offered through Expedia. It was a great hotel - service - cleanliness - lots of convenient amenities. Will definitely stay there again

review.title: Extremely Impressed
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend the San Francisco Marriott Marquis. From the moment we stepped foot into the hotel we received outstanding customer service. The front desk staff was exceptional. They were prompt and courteous. The only downside to our experience was the service we received in the hotel bar. I am certain that the Marriott Marquis will have our business in the future.

review.title: Nice but expensive
review.reviewText: It's a Marriott and I have found Marriotts meet a consistent standard. For this reason and that it was located close to the event I attended made it worthwhile. The hotel was nice, but having said that I missed not having a coffee pot in my room forcing one to choose room service for an arm and a leg or going down to the lobby to wait in line at Starbucks. At their restaurant Eggs Benedict and a coffee will set you back $30 and a glass of orange juice of unknown size will cost $8. The View bar on top of the building is nice and again somewhat pricey. The drinks are strong which I think is designed to keep you there consuming. The concierge and other employees were quite excellent at answering questions. I would not choose this hotel for personal trips because of the expense.

review.title: The BEST location!!!
review.reviewText:
My husband and I went to San Francisco for our 10-year anniversary and stayed at the San Francisco Marriott Marquis! You honestly could not ask for better service, friendlier staff, and the location was perfect! It was, literally, right around the corner from everything! Shopping is across the street! Starbucks is downstairs in the lobby! The lounge on the top floor is a MUST, especially at night! WHAT A VIEW!

We ended up upgrading our room to a suite, which is why I think we loved it SO much. We had a separate living room area to hang out in so we wouldn't have to be scrunched in a tiny space. I highly recommend the upgrade - it was SO worth it!

review.title: Will definitely go back.
review.reviewText: This a safe hotel to stay in. I was disappointed that the Starbucks in the lobby closed early. Room service was efficient and the food was good. During this trip I stayed at 4 different hotel chains. This hotel was my favorite.

review.title: Great Deal from Expedia on Marriott Marquis
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable...a little concerned about bed bug reports but we escaped unscathed! This hotel is just a few blocks from Union Square so it's in the heart of a lot of shopping and good restaurants. Public transportation is abundant around this hotel so don't bother renting a car unless you have a day trip planned for out of the immediate area. Parking is way too expensive to consider. There is a Hertz in the hotel if you do have car rental needs. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful with all of our questions. You have to pay for internet in your room, but they have free wi-fi in the lobby which was adequate for our needs. Overall it was a good experience. It was made most possible by the deals via Expedia.

review.title: Cautious Recommendation
review.reviewText: The Marriot Marquis is a lovely hotel; staff are excellent, rooms clean and location close to Market and Powell Area. Regrettably parked my car in the parking lot across the street for $22.00 USD. On site hotel parking is $68.00 USD a day. My car was broken into, a major hassle; Enterprise Rentals were good about it, upgraded vehicle to a brand new SUV which I used to drive the Pacific Coast Highway to Monteray, CA. There are many harmless homeless folks with mental health problems. I would recommend this hotel and stay again in the future.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco and the hotel was perfect. Centrally located and easy to get to and from the SF airport on BART. Concierge was the best and helped with so much of our activities and restaurants. Would definielty stay here again.

review.title: good if you don't mind tons of tourists
review.reviewText: may have had a better time if we didn't have the kids with us. surrounding neighborhood bordered on seedy, was very very crowded and busy.

review.title: Marriot Excellence
review.reviewText: I love Marriot, and depending on where you are in the country, the aesthetics of the hotels will vary, but the customer service excellence never falters. This holds true for the Marriot Marquis. All the staff were friendly and personable, the interior of the hotel looked more posh than I expected for the amount I paid, and the location was great for walking to major spots in the city.

review.title: This was a nice hotel...
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed in a room with a king sized bed. The room was a good size, and so was the bathroom. The bed itself was very comfortable. The lobby is nice, and we liked the coffee shop located in the lobby. All the staff were pleasant to deal with. The hotel is located walking distance to many attractions which is convenient. We stayed for 7 days, and wouldn't have a problem staying there again!

Valet parking is too much money per night though, and we only ate breakfast twice at the hotel. The buffet is good, but expensive.

review.title: Great location for Union Square & Bart transportation
review.reviewText: The concierge at this hotel was FANTASTIC!!! Extremely knowledgeable and SUPER friendly. I tend to have really high expectations when staying away from home and this hotel exceeded my expectations... the only negative I could say is I requested a HIGH FLOOR room, and was put on the 11th floor (the hotel has 39 floors) and the somewhat unfriendly guy who checked us in tried to tell me all the high floors were taken... RIGHT ALL 28 floors above me were full?!?!?!) but other than that, it was awesome!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, excellent location close to chinatown, shopping, Ftrain, cable cars etc etc... Shuttle to the airport was $17 per person. Room was good I got a good rate of $125/night, but I would not pay over $200 per room as there was nothing special about it. Huge fitness room with lots of equipment and nice indoor pool with hot tub. Overall nice hotel i would stay again if I got a good deal.

review.title: Very affordable and nice location
review.reviewText: We liked our stay at this Mariott hotel. The location was in the middle of everything and the room was very comfortable. The only issue was that they were still putting in the wireless so for the WiFi connection so we had to go to the lobby to get access.

review.title: Be sure that you understand that no tub means an ADA bathroom!
review.reviewText: We were offered a "big" shower with no tub thinking that it was enclosed. It was a shower that meets ADA regulations and not what I would have preferred. The cover of the feather bed was leaking feathers and kept poking us when we went to sleep. Will not recommend this hotel at all.

review.title: Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Really a great location Hotel in San Francisco. We'll stay with them again. Staff are really helpful

review.title: San Francisco Marriott Marquis - Good Hotel...Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Will go back.

review.title: I'd love to go back again.
review.reviewText: The service was fantastic. Everyone was so kind and helpful. When we needed pillows they came up within a few minutes. They even found us a corkscrew when we asked. The location was phenomenal. We walked everywhere, but the trolley was right there, too. Great shopping and great restaurants close by.

review.title: Very convenient!
review.reviewText:
We got a three days package from Expedia (flight included) and it made it more convenient for us. Got a very good price for the hotel. It´s right in the downtown. You can go walking around during the day hours (at night it gets kind of dangerous but honestly I saw nothing happen) and it´s near the metro stops, buses and cable cars at Powell St.
Just a tip: do not hire the "city sightseeing" hop on hop off bus. There are other better options with more confortable buses and more frequency.

review.title: would go back
review.reviewText: hotel was great, good service, parking expensive. Liked the pool

review.title: Fabulous location
review.reviewText: Yerba Buena Park on one side, Union Square on the other. Phenomenal location. Bed was super comfortable. Just wish I had found the little coffee maker in the drawer before my last day. Waiting in line for Starbucks in the lobby got old fast. Otherwise, hotel is fab.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with very friendly staff in convenient part af SF. Would stay there again.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Could use some upgrading but overall a decent stay

review.title: Staff is Amazing
review.reviewText: I stay at the SF Marriott Marquis a few times a year to attend conventions at the nearby Moscone Center. They have the most eager to please staff of any hotel I've ever stayed in and I'm a road warrior. They go the extra mile to be sure I've got the best room in the hotel I can get for what I want to spend and call me to be sure I'm thrilled once I'm settled in. Love these guys.

review.title: Going back soon
review.reviewText:
We love this hotel. The main draw is the location and pool. Traveling with 3 kids between 8-14 years old we need down time and the pool is perfect for this. You can walk everywhere and public transportation gets us to all the attractions.
Stay away from room service. The quality of the food is inconsistent and mostly bad. However all around the hotel are great places to eat.

review.title: The Marriott Marquis is a fantastic hotel
review.reviewText: Love this hotel. Perfect San Fran location, good neighborhood, the rooms are always very clean and feel more expensive than the cost. Terrific 360-degree views at the sky bar, which is a nice stop for a drink before or after a night on the town. Can't recommend strongly enough. And be sure to get a city view room - worth it!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our hotel stay at the Marquis Marriot on Mission and 4th Street.
Consierge was great, very helpful with maps, directions, ideas of what to do.
Room had a great view of the city. We had a car and traveled to the North of the city and really enjoyed the Sonoma area, beautiful scenery, visit the Wolf House which Jack London built.

review.title: Everything else is good except Noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel is at a great location of downtown San Francisco with walking distance to many stores and good restaurants. Everything is expected except it's noisy at night. I can hear neighbors opening and closing their doors and someone next door flushing toilets. Every early morning, I was waken up by a bell striking 15 (?) times somewhere outside.

review.title: No better value near Moscone
review.reviewText: Marriott Marquis is always my first choice anytime I'm attending a show at Moscone

review.title: Wonderful, spectacular
review.reviewText: The kids loved the pool and spa...Awesome beds..

review.title: Love this place!
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with this hotel. Great location. Ben the concierge was outstanding. Will definately stay there again.

review.title: Toliet Problems
review.reviewText: We stay with Marriot most of our travel. We have never had a complaint before and that is why we stay with theym. We were very happy with the size and cleanliness of the room. We had problems with the toliet being stopped up the entire trip. We called once or twice a day to have them fix. They came and plunged but it stopped right back up. The last time we called they didn't come at all. We had to use the lobby restroom to go to bathroom. It was very inconvenient.

review.title: Perfect location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Location was 100% perfect. next to gorgeous shops and mall, next to museums and theaters, next to muni station, bart station and cable car stop. Hertz office right at the lobby. Service was very good, rooms spacious, clean and fresh.

review.title: New Year's Getaway
review.reviewText: Hotel stay was very pleasant and staff was very helpfull and friendly. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. Good location for shopping and conveniently located to other sites, museums...etc..

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Close to shopping, cable car, and BART bus system. Good hotel. Was very comfortable and safe.

review.title: Great location, great weekend!
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel to others interested in traveling to San Francisco. First, the hotel itself is very nice. The rooms were spacious and the hotel is in a great location within the city. A BART station is also nearby, which was even better for getting around (and to/from the airport). Everyone at the hotel was very helpful and courteous. I would definitely stay at this hotel again during a future trip.

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: For the price of the room, we were expecting some sort of view of the outside world. Our view consisted of the conference rooms in the lobby area, and that night, we could see and hear the sound of the party/disco ball going on downstairs. The toilet ran all night long, and all of the electrical sockets in the bathroom quit working that night after minimal use. We attempted to order a movie and had to eventually cancel the order after 20min of waiting. The hotel was nice, and I'm sure there were better rooms, but I've gotten better rooms at better hotels for the price we paid. Based on our experience, we'll be booking rooms at the previous hotel we visited last year.

review.title: san francisco center hotel
review.reviewText: excellent services

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: What a great location. Close to everything you want to see or do. The Bart and cable cars are only a few blocks away. China town and numerous great restraunts are walking distance. Great rooftop bar with wonderful sunset views and martini specials. Only complaint was the weather. Pack a sweater and a rain coat even if you don't think you need it!

review.title: The Marriott Marquis had the best staff! I would love to stay there again.
review.reviewText: Every Marriott staff person we encountered was exceptional, from the parking valet, to guest service check-in and the conceirge. Our room was clean and nothing fancy...but the bed! It was heavenly! I could have slept for days!! It was so comfortable. And, it was quiet. I couldn't believe I was in a big city and there was no outside traffic noise that could be heard.

review.title: Excellent experience at Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location and is in good condition. The service was of very good quality as well. The concierge desk was extremely helpful and courteous. My one complaint is that there is a significant charge for Internet access in the room. I am many others were not willing to pay it so the ground floor lobby was filled with people using the free wifi.

review.title: Great location and ammenities!
review.reviewText: Loved the location. Centrally located to Union Square, SOMA, BART, and walking distance to Folsom. Most of the staff was very helpful and accommodating (except for initial check-in clerk who had a chip on his sholder). Manager Alicia was VERY welcoming and helpful. Will stay again for sure!!! Nicely equipped gym and fun hot tub!!!

review.title: Marriott Marquis
review.reviewText: Everything was great.

review.title: Marriott in the middle of the shopping district - nice location!
review.reviewText: Room was a little smaller than expected for the price we paid per night and bathroom only had one sink, but total over all service was fine.

review.title: Quality as expected!
review.reviewText: Location was great and the hotel was very good.

review.title: Excellent hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText:
The Marrriott Marquis was a wonderful place to stay during my visit to San Francisco. The room was well appointed, and the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever been in! All staff members I encountered (front desk, concierge, bell boys) were courteous and professional. The
hotel was very easy to reach if you take the BART train from the airport - it is just a short walk from the Powell Street station. The surrounding area (south of Market Street) can be a bit "scruffy", but is not particularly dangerous in my opinion. I will definitely be happy to stay in this hotel again on future trips to SF.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Outstanding hotel would highly recommend

review.title: Love it, Love it, Love it!!!
review.reviewText: The service was fantastic, the location was convenient, the concierge was impeccable. My room was remarkable, the bed linen was to die for... I could sleep in it all day!!!

review.title: Can I live here?
review.reviewText: Wonderful customer service!! The beds are to die for. We had breakfast in bed one and we thought about skipping the ball game because the bed was so soft and awesome. Will defiantly stay here again.

review.title: Great Hotel so central within walking distance for everything.
review.reviewText:
Would recommend this Hotel to anyone thinking of travelling to San Francisco. It was so central and the staff were very polite and helpful.
Rooms were cleaned daily and towels replaced every day, very much appreciated.
The view Bar on the 39th floor was lovely and so were the cocktails, we enjoyed them very much. A bit pricey but as we were only there for 4 days it was not too bad. Happy Hour helped.
Ice machine was broken near our room so had to walk further for ice, but not any bother.
All in all it was a lovely visit and would love to do it again some day.

review.title: ideal location
review.reviewText: would go back.

review.title: Great deal in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was a reasonably priced hotel with parking. The only thing we were not prepared for was that the valet parking is on the side entrance, so look this up ahead of time if you are planning to use the valet so you can avoid traffic. The parking did cost extra, but the location was great, service was great, and the room was nice. The room was a little smaller than we are used to, but it still had a nice king size bed and all the amenities that we needed. Overall, I thought that this was a great deal for the $. We have had friends stay at other hotels for a little less, but then they were staying at a 2 star hotel versus this one, which is more like a 3-4 star hotel.

review.title: Marriott Marquis San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location, service. Attention to room amenities offered lacking.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: excellent service from the bell hops , nothing was too difficult, they are wll versed with all the hotel and full of information

review.title: Great treatment!
review.reviewText: The parking was a little of a problem.However; the stay was great and the spa treatment was excellent. I will recommend the Marriot to my friends.

review.title: A good place if you are willing to pay the price
review.reviewText: This is one of the main and busiest hotels in SF

review.title: Lovely place to stay!!!!
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean and beautiful. The lobby has free internet access which is great. Parking is $50 but if you park at Mission garage, $32 per day, 2 minutes walk. We love the location, close to everything. Our daughters love the hotel and want to stay there next time we are in SF. Our first stay with Marriott and we love it!!!

review.title: Loved the Marriott Marquis
review.reviewText: We would definitely return to the Marriott Marquis in SanFrancisco. The staff was very helpful with directions and transportation tips. They even printed out our e-boarding pass for us the morning of our departure so we could avoid that step at the airport. I highly recommend consulting with the concierge service for any directions or tips. The hotel felt very safe. I was traveling with my teenage daughters for this "girls only" trip so security was important to us. The location was perfect. Just a block or so from the BART station and convenient to all the transportation. We walked from our hotel to Chinatown. No surprise charges to my credit card. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great for family vacation
review.reviewText: Super satisfied---was traveling with our family on vacation...they gave us a bigger room at no extra charge as we were staing a few days. Offered us a mini fridge at no extra charge. Staff was super nice and very helpful. Concierge gave us a great restaurant recommendation and gotta love that pool!

review.title: very comfortable hotel , but find an other parking space - do not use the hotel vale !!
review.reviewText: Hotel was comfortable with large rooms , also very well located as you can reach most of the points of interest on foot . But the parking and vale was very expensive for hotel guests , there should be discount for the ones already staying in the hotel .

review.title: Excellent service; will return
review.reviewText: Marriott provides excellent service. Everything, from check-in to check-out was first rate. We had access to the concierge level (which helps with expenses when one is traveling with family) and were able to take advantage of the free breakfast each day. Further, housekeeping was great in responding to our requests for extra towels, clean up at certain times, etc. The location of this Marriott was helpful since it is near to the Embarcadero, Union Square and the cable cars. Further, our conciege gave us a quick tutorial on using the trolleys, once again helping us save money. Overall, this was an excellent hotel for our purposes. We will certainly return to it when we return to San Francisco.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Marriott Marquis a few times and loved it both times. The pool is one where you can actually get a workout -- even a lap lane. Beds are super comfy. Everything is great. If you order room service, the service is so great. Overall I give the hotel a big thumbs up. Great location. Bar at the top offers an awesome view of the City and good appetizers. Fun.

review.title: SF Marriott
review.reviewText: The room itself was just a standard hotel room, but had allo that was needful. (The refridge and snacks are in that dreadul new style where any *movement* of an item registers immediately as "use.") One candy bar was too stale -- smell and solidity -- that I just threw it away, and wasn't charged. Lack of fresh refreshments could be problem anywhere, however.

review.title: It was a very nice place to stay while we were on vacations
review.reviewText:
My husband, my four years old son, and I stayed in this hotel while we were on vacations in the San Francisco bay area, and we had everything we needed; good restaurants, car rental, and we didn't even have to take a cab to transport us from/to the airport, because the BART station is very close to the hotel!
The only thing is that if you need to use wifi in your room you have to pay $15.00 daily, or go to the hotel lobby where you can get it free.

review.title: Great Hotel, would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel...the parking was kind of a pain. Have to drive a mile to get to the valet garage (one-way streets). Then, the valet was also a rip off...$55/night! We ended up moving the car after the first night to a public garage on Stevenson (1/2 block from hotel). But, for our purposes, the location was perfect, the service was excellent and we got a pretty reasonable rate on the room too.

review.title: Luxurious room with amazing view
review.reviewText: We got a great deal on this room thru Expedia and weren't sure what to expect. It turned out to be a gorgeous corner room on the 27th floor with a beautiful view of the Bay, the city, and Yerba Buena Gardens. We both had great sleep in the luxurious king-size bed with pillow top. The room was spacious, quiet, and clean, everything you could want. It was fun having (expensive) drinks on the 39th floor, but truthfully we thought we had a better view from our room since we had a corner. The location is fine; on the "wrong side" of Market but just by half a block. Now all we need to figure out is how to get that room every time!

review.title: Impressive San Fransisco Hotel
review.reviewText:
As stated previously the hotel housekeeping and front desk service providers were very agreeable, helpful, accommodating and friendly.
The hotel is very well located within a few block to union square for tour bus Hop-on stops, close to prime shopping, walking distance to china town and the cable car to Fisherman's wharf.
The concierge was very helpful with restaurant suggestions for breakfast and dinner. Mels diner of American Grafetti fame was a 3 minute walk and great breakfast location.
The doormen were also super friendly and helpful..They did visual inspections of taxis before we got in and even discouraged us from taking a taxi when we were going to China town..told us it is easier to walk.
The ferry stop to cross to Marin county in a short cab ride or would be walkable.
There is plenty of shopping in the area with an upscale mall and various other well recognized stores. Free interenet access in the huge lobby area was very convenient.
Overall we were very happy with the hotel staff, our rooms and hotel locations. Would definitely stay again on return trip to San Fransisco.

review.title: If I ever return to San Francisco I will definitely stay here again.
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Marriott Marquis was the best hotel we could, find it was super centric near everything. The room was bigger than I thought the beds were super comfortable the temperature outside was great so we basically didn't use it at a low temperature. The lobby was big, the staff was nice and very respectful and helpful (they helped us book a tour to Muir Woods and Sausalito that was extremely good and one to Napa that didn't reach our expectations) The best summer vacation ever in my life. The view from the top floor is amazing though you can't see the golden gate bridge from the top.
I would definitely stay here again. I'd recommend this hotel to everyone I know.

"EVERYONE SHOULD BE ABLE TO LOVE TWO CITIES: THEIR OWN AND SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!!!!"

review.title: I would not stay anyplace else!
review.reviewText: Our first visit to San Francisco was most enjoyable because at the end of the day we got to come back to such a nice hotel. Every employ was so nice and helpful. We had an amazing view of the city which we found so soothing at nite.

review.title: Excellent Choice
review.reviewText: Great hotel. We have stayed here before and we will again.

review.title: Very nice upscale hotel
review.reviewText:
Room service & mini-bar prices were ridiculous, so was the daily access fee to wi-fi , pay per view rates and parking fees.

Everything else was superb.

review.title: I'll sleep in my car the next time I'm in SF.
review.reviewText: 1500 character is the max.

review.title: Excellent, downtown location. Beautiful, clean hotel with delightful staff. Concierge service = A+
review.reviewText:
Wonderful experience. My husband and I travelled cross-country from VA to SF with two teenage girls for vacation, June 2010. The Marriott Marquis was everything we could have hoped for. Clean, comfortable room -- feather pillows and all! The location was perfect. We walked to lots of fun sight-seeing spots, Chinatown, etc. And we were right around the corner from cable car or street car access and lots of shopping! We also walked to AT&T Park to see a Giants game. Everything was very accessible and hotel staff and employees at stores and venues were wonderful -- helpful and friendly.

The only negative was the *prices*, especially at the restaurants in the hotel. SF is expensive, but the Marriott's prices were ridiculous. We stayed 6 nights and did not eat at the hotel at all, even for breakfast. We did take advantage of the Starbucks inside the hotel tho!

We booked a "wine country" day trip. A van picked us up at the front door of the hotel - enjoyed the Muir Woods and several wineries in Sonoma. Highly recommended.

The lounge on the top floor has really spectacular views of the city. We enjoyed a quiet moment, having a sip, looking down over the city lights on our last night in SF. A very special moment. I'm sure the girls will remember it always. Hope we get a chance to return soon. There's so much more to see!

review.title: Great trip
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was excellent. We were able to walk to the cable cars to get to the wharf area. We were able to walk to restaurants, Chinatown and North Beach. The staff was very friendly and nice to work with. The kids enjoyed the pool. I think someone had smoked in our room, despite the claim that all rooms were non-smoking. Also, the towels weren't very soft. Other than that, I have nothing to complain about. The View lounge had an excellent 360 degree view of the city.

review.title: Sweet Stay by the Bay
review.reviewText: Wonderful location for both business and leisure travelers. Great shopping and restaurants a short walking distance from the hotel. Main lobby is spacious and beautiful with a convenient Starbucks. Guest rooms are clean and comfortable.

review.title: Just what I needed!
review.reviewText: The room was clean. The hotel location was close to a lot of shopping and food spots. The room was comfortable and clean. The only complaint was no air in the room. It was hot and stuffy at night, difficult to sleep.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: Large well maintained Marriott, with a great top floor bar overlook.

review.title: WE WAIT TO GO BACK SOON
review.reviewText: IT WAS A N INCREDIBLE EXPERIENCE

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Concierge most helpful

review.title: They did everything they could to make it a pleasant stay
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our weekend at the Marriott Marquis. You couldn't get a better place so close to everything...shopping, the BART system, Union Square, the Cable Car, etc. There was a lady at the Concierge desk that went above and beyond helping us out. She got us a reservation at a lovely restaurant on Pier 39 and sent us a free appetizer to boot. There was also a very helpful lady at the front desk that was very friendly and also tried to do everything possible to make sure we had a great stay. The beds were very comfortable.

review.title: crappy
review.reviewText: crappy

review.title: convenient and nice place to stay
review.reviewText: if you are looking for a hotel that is close to market st. and within walking distance of union square and/or AT+T Park, then this is the hotel for you.

review.title: Hotel bed was terrible
review.reviewText: Hotel is excellent but the bed was terrible.

review.title: So/so experience
review.reviewText: I should have done my homework more thoroughly so I could choose a hotel that included parking. The price to park at the hotel is outrageous. Had to park at a garage elsewhere and pay cab fare. The room was nice, but small. The bathroom was clean, but the exhaust fan did not work, turning it into a steam sauna. Forget about room service -- it is an hour wait at minimum.

review.title: Will always stay at this hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Extremely convenient location. Very helpful and courteous concierge staff. Comfortable room.

review.title: Deplorable Internet situation
review.reviewText: The Internet available was a disgrace for a major hotel in San Francisco. First off, NO WIRELESS. You can get wireless at a motel 6. Second, wired Internet was expensive and unreliably slow, not to mention the cords not being available in the room upon check in. Lobby Internet is even worse. Seems they have yet to upgrade their infrastructure on something that seems very basic in the city where apple was born....

review.title: Excellent location Great value!
review.reviewText: Highly recommend it! Near every thing that you might need to buy and see. Every mode of transportation was available right in front of the hotel. Very freindly and helpful staff, and great amenities. Our room was very clean and comfortable. You barely spend anytime in there anyways. Having an in room safe was fantastic. The pool was nice and well maintained. Great location if you travel with kids as it is near a park with many activities suitable for kids. Lots of places to eat near the hotel. The only negative: no free internet access!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel, good location. parking is expensive but there is a local garage that is cheaper. Lots of restaurants nearby. Nice gym.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable beds, wonderful to come back to relax in after a long day at a conference. Room service was excellent and reasonably priced for the caliber of hotel. Service was wonderful. Would go back in a heartbeat.

review.title: SAN FRANCISCO'S HEART
review.reviewText:
HOTEL WAS CLEAN AND WAS EXPECTED BASED ON THE DEAL I GOT. IT'S NOT AS MODERN BUT WAS CLEAN AND HAD AN EXCELLENT GYM AREA INCLUDING A MODERN STEAM ROOM.

STARBUCKS WAS LOCATED IN THE LOBBY AREA BUT WAS OPEN ONLY DURING THE MORNING HOURS.

WALKING DISTANCE TO ALL THE RETAIL LOCATIONS AND HAS A GREAT VIEW AT THE BAR IN

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: good location for a business or leisure trip;good price if you get specials;

review.title: Surprisingly Nice and Reasonably Priced in Downtown
review.reviewText: My wife and I got a very reasonable rate at this hotel for me to attend a large convention. We were surprised at how inexpensive it was, given its location only two blocks from the Marscone convention center, so were prepared for a low-end room. We were shocked at how large and comfortable the room was! The bed was comfortable. There was a generous desk area to work at, in addition to a sitting table and a nice television. The bathroom was spacious and sported a nice shower/tub. My one complaint was the lack of free internet ($14.95 per day)...but overall, Marriott really came through with this.

review.title: Served Its Purpose
review.reviewText:
Key points about the Marriott Marquis:

-Location is amazing for access to Moscone Center.

-Bell and front desk service are top-notch.

-Room service is surprisingly reasonable.

-Valet parking is CRAZY expensive.

-Charging for in-room, WIRED internet in a premium hotel like this is actually disgusting. If I can get free wireless internet at Starbucks, there's no good reason the Marriott can't do it too.

-Hallway/tower/elevator situation can be labyrinthine and confusing.

-Our room was clean and comfortable enough, but showed its age--ceiling still had 70s-style acoustic popcorn, which I might not have noticed if there weren't a big huge stain in the middle of it.

review.title: rcw 2009
review.reviewText: Good hotel. Well run and convenient to Moscone Center.

review.title: would stay here again
review.reviewText: nice hotel, good location

review.title: Great Service, Great Location
review.reviewText:
Hotel is within 1/2 block of Moscone Center in San Francisco.
Quick, easy check-in.
The daily internet access is a little pricey, but available.

review.title: SF Hotel: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: This downtown Marriott location is extremly well suited to the traveler that wants to enjoy shopping and the arts. Comfortable and spacious rooms and a friendly staff combine to offer the business and weekend traveler a home away from home in San Francisco.

review.title: Wonderful place to stay for convention and travel
review.reviewText: The hotel was just cross a street from the Moscone convention center. It was also close to downtown and its famous shops. The hotel attendents were nice and kind. I could see that they tried to help their customers in every way. However, one draw back was too much expensive valet parking fee. Since the location was near to downtown, it was understandable. If you plan to drive to the hotel, you'd better think again and add more money to your expenses.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: It was beautiful inside and all the staff were extremely nice and helpful. The rooms were a good size for our family of 4. The kids loved the indoor pool and everything was very clean. It's in a great location, walking distance of the main street shopping and about 10 minutes from Pier 39. The only thing is to get to the parking attendants you have to go to the back side of the hotel, which is extremely difficult to do, and the parking fee was $55.00 a day.

review.title: Extremely comfy beds with great amount of pillows!
review.reviewText: The staff was very accommodating and friendly.

review.title: Great place to stay for a trip to the theatre!
review.reviewText: Our stay was fantastic. The hotel is centrally located near Union Square, BART and several good restaurants. We were in the city to go to the theatre and found the Marriott to be a perfect location. The concierge desk was extremely helpful in recommending places for late night dining after the theatre.

review.title: Good location, but nothing special.
review.reviewText: Hotel was adequate for our quick trip to the city. Luckily, we didn't need to spend much time at the hotel. Parking rates are atrocious but typical in city.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: great location, beautiful rooftop bar, friendly staff

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great, the only thing we did not like and didn't expect was the pricing for overnight parking at the hotel. It was about $50 per night plus tax. The restaurant inside the hotel was very nice, somewhat pricey for a hotel. Usually other hotels have complimentary breakfasts but not this one. A breakfast that would usually be a complimentary continental breakfast at another hotel would cost you about $16 at the Marriott Marquis. That was kind of disappointing. Internet access as not complimentary either. They have stations available and internet access is $6 per 20 minutes. Not expected! Overall the stay was great, cannot really complain. The staff was friendly and helpful. Great customer service. I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone else but also mention that extra costs will incur.

review.title: Would stay there again in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: I was very pleased all around with the Marriott Marquis: Service, Location, Appearence of Lobby, Bin 55, views from the cocktail lounge on the top of the bldg and of course the room. The only thing I wasn't impressed with was the breakfast.

review.title: Very Impressive Hotel.
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic time at this hotel. Very courteous staff. The concierge was very knowledgeable and friendly. The pool and fitness room were a little small and crowded. We didn't mind though because we were too busy to use the facilities. Our room was very clean and everything was in good working condition. Our hotel was very close to great shopping and dining. Fortunately for us, there were no events at the nearby convention centres. Which made our stay very quiet and pleasant. Would definately stay here again.

review.title: Very Impressed and Highly Recommend
review.reviewText: Hotel was wonderful and the room was spacious and had great amenities such as a starbucks, Bin 55 lounge and in-house restaurants. Location is excellent with only a 2 block walk to the Moscone Center and approximately 3 block walk to the Powell Street Bart Station. Room was very clean, service was excellent at the Hotel and will definitely go back at this hotel again. I would Highly Recommend this Hotel particularly if you are attending a convention or conference near or at the Moscone Center.

review.title: As expected.
review.reviewText: Convenient, clean, prompt service..what else is needed!

review.title: Good location. Great price for New Years. But thin walls/door.
review.reviewText: We stayed here for New Years and I was very happy with the price. Probably only available because of the economy right now. The place was nice with one exception: our room had a door directly into another guest room. The door was double locked on both sides so privacy was not the issue, but this door to the other guest room was thinner than the wall and therefore we could hear their conversation pretty easily. It was a little annoying.

review.title: excelent hotel
review.reviewText:
excelent hotel , good location
everithing was ok

review.title: Great base for exploring San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very conveniently located at only a few minutes from the Bart/Muni Metro station Powell.
Shopping area is at your feet, opposite Bloomingdales and Westfield, so you can walk your way around easily. Chinatown, litte Italy are at walkin distance.
Tramrailway will take you in historic cars to either the fishermanswarf or the Civic Center and Castro area.

review.title: Already planning our next mini trip.
review.reviewText:
Great experience starting from from our arrival to the airport . We took the Bart which dropped us off at Powell station and forth just 1/2 a block from the Marriott Marquis. We purchased the Muni fthree day pass which gave us an array of choices to visit, we walked 1/2 a block to visit most of the sites. The Concierge was of great help arranging prime tickets to see "Wicked". Gret play. Great trip.

We are already planning our next mini trip.

GM

review.title: San Francisco best hotel.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is well located and the staff was very kind with me, so I am
good impressed an definitly I widely recommend the hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel, Definitely Recommend
review.reviewText: For the price, I feel like this hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff was all extremely friendly, the room very clean, and my view of the city was great. The downtown location was perfect and close to everything. I would definitely recommend to others.

review.title: WOULD I GO BACK?
review.reviewText: I would go back if vacationing or visiting in the area.

review.title: great locaton, nice room.
review.reviewText:
My only objection is not specific to this hotel, but having a vending situation in the room where an assortment of snacks and drinks are sitting there, and if you move them, you have made a purchase. It takes space and is an inconvience.

The pool was outstanding. Set up so there were areas to swim laps, and still space for families to play.

review.title: Convenient and great service
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel. The location was perfect for shopping, eating good food and seeing movies. It is close to BART and the Embarcadero.

Check in went very smoothly. They let us check in early and upgraded us to a city view. Awesome service!

The room was really nice, but I would have preferred if the seating area was by the window so you could enjoy the view from there.

Definitely get a drink at the bar on the top floor, fabulous view!

review.title: Fantastic Place
review.reviewText: Beautiful Hotel in a great location.

review.title: Excelent
review.reviewText: Excelent

review.title: Perfect Getaway
review.reviewText:
Everything was perfect with our stay except we were very disappointed that the Starbucks in the hotel had such limited hours and limited selections compared to other Starbucks.

Our experience at "The View" was wonderful. Your bartender from Denmark was great and the little cocktail waitress was very nice too. Anyone visiting San Francisco should go up to "The View" it is beautiful.

One very big disappointment was upon leaving. We left at night on New Years Eve and the taxi line was very long and the doormen were less than helpful getting us a cab to the airport and wanted us to take a car with an extremely high rate - we were very surprised to be treated like that seeing we were guest at the hotel - New York doormen are nothing like these men.

Overall great stay and would recommend this hotel - great location downtown for shopping!

review.title: Everyone was very nice and I would return
review.reviewText: The rooms were clean nice. Everything was close by shopping, museums, resteraunts

review.title: EXCELLENT FOR FAMILY WITH KIDS
review.reviewText: WE LOVED THIS HOTEL, THE POOL WAS REALLY A WONDERFUL OPTION TO HAVE. THE ACCESS WAS A LITTLE BIT OF A HASSLE BUT THEN AGAIN I THINK THEY DO IT SO THAT THEY CAN MONITOR THE PEOPLE USING IT. THERE WERE PLENTY OF TOWELS AND IT WAS RELATIVELY CLEAN. MY KIDS LOVE IT, MY CORNER ROOM GAVE US A BEAUTIFUL VIEW. I WILL STAY AT THIS HOTEL FROM NOW ON. LOVED IT.

review.title: "What a Wonderful World Within"
review.reviewText:
Hi, my 12 year old daughter and myself just returned from San Francisco,our first trip to this lovely city. We had 5 days to spend our time there. Unfortunately, my daughter was very sick with a cold. She didn't get out of bed one day! Went thru boxes of kleenex and felt pretty sick and tired. This was the only bad news we had. When you're stuck in your room due to sickness then, what a room! When you run out of kleenex, what a maid! When you need a treat to eat, what a city!! When you're bored, what great movies in the room! I was only 4 minutes by walking away from the most exciting shopping I've ever been priveledged to. I would go for an hour or two while my daughter slept. We caught buses just outside the door on the days she started to feel a bit better and rode all around the town. Great way to see everything. Firmly recommend the Alcatraz experience. Anyways, back to the hotel, the concierge were so helpful, the location worked out perfectly for us and I would love to go back to see what I missed. Great place to stay and don't miss the top floor "bar"...what a view! I insist on saying that the staff were very good, very helpful, very gallant in most cases.
2 country girls from Saskatchewan

review.title: What a surprise!
review.reviewText: We went to San Francisco to attend a 49ers football game on Sunday. I had never stayed at the Marriott Marque, and was not sure of the area when I booked the room. We were pleasantly surprised by the location and how nice the hotel was. The only downfall was the price of parking was pretty high. We went to the top floor and had cocktails with a spectacular view of the city. We used public transportation the entire time we were there, and going to the 49ers game was awesome, being dropped off right in front of the park and picked up at same spot. The conciere was very helpful in guiding us through the bus schedules and recommending dining. We will definately stay there again, as we frequent San Francisco several times a year.

review.title: Great Marriott
review.reviewText: Everything was great, the bathroom always very clean and good bedding, well the beds were a very soft and personally I don´t like that.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: Extremely well located hotel, friendly staff, its less than a block away from Market Street, MUNI stop, and BART station which is in front of powell cable car stop. Even the amtrak pickup stop is a few steps fron the hotel. The lobby is really nice and theres free wifi as well. Rooms are modern, clean and nicely decorated, beds and pillows are so confortable. Never tried the restaurant but it seemed ok. Theres a starbucks inside the hotel and the Metreon and Mels diner are just around the corner. I highly recommended this hotel.

review.title: Service was Excellent!
review.reviewText: What impressed me most with this hotel was the friendliness of the staff, and how helpful they were at every stage of our visit: check-in, bags to room, bags to storage, valet parking, restaurant recommendations, directions, etc. I would definately return!

review.title: Second Honeymoon
review.reviewText: We have stayed in San Francisco many times and this was the best one ever. Besides being able to check in early which might not always be available, the room was spacious and the service was wonderful. Our room was cleaned daily with new bathroom supplies including extra towels. The exercise size room was state of the art. The hotel is in a central location...walking distance to the cable cars, great restaurants and shopping experiences. We had a wonderfeul time and look forward to coming back soon.

review.title: Nice Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, but the San Francisco experience very disappointing. Harrassed by panhandlers every 50 feet. Sidewalks smelled of urine. Outrageous parking charges. And a city healthcare tax on my restaurant bill? Give me a break!

review.title: Great place close to Union Square
review.reviewText: This was a fantastic hotel very close to Union Square, at a great price. The lobby was very welcoming and the rooms were great. Clean, very comfortable bed and blankets, flat screen tv, and a good size bathroom. The location was great, definitely within walking distance to Union Square. Recommended!

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: wonderful hotel, clean

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We got a fabulous deal through Expedia for this hotel, which was right where we needed it to be to attend a party in the museum district of San Francisco. The room was fine, but not particularly luxurious, given what it normally costs to stay there. The staff were pleasant and helpful. The one thing we got a huge laugh out of was the mini-bar. There was bottled water, candy bars and small snacks, all ridiculously priced as usual, but each were set on an electronic pad, so if you even moved one, your room was automatically charged, even if you put it right back. You have to be very careful not to knock one over! We were careful, so no problem, but I can imagine someone piling their stuff on the desk and not noticing, getting a huge surprise.

review.title: Great location but NOT IMPRESSED!
review.reviewText: I would and would not recomend this hotel. The location was fabulous, thick glass windows made for a quiet stay. Lobby is beautiful, indoor pool is very nice, starbucks in lobby area much enjoyed. On the other hand, the beds were awful and our room looked as though it had not been dusted in a few weeks. There were a few hairs in the bathtub and the coffee maker had old water deposits, that I removed with my finger. The sheets had holes and rips and the bath towels were scratchy. The water valve inside the shower wall made a knocking noise. If I go back I will insist on inspecting my room first and I should have changed rooms this trip, I just didn't figure they had different beds in different parts of the hotel.

review.title: Not a four star hotel!!
review.reviewText:
On our first night, we were exausted from our long flight and all we wanted to do was crash in front of the tv for an hour and go to sleep. We couldn't find the remote. It was about 10pm. I phone downstairs. They said they would send housekeeping right away. I waited. I kept looking for the remote. I made the mistake of looking under the bed. Tissues, old and used, dust balls... I took a shower with someone's long black hair on the shower curtain. I finally fell asleep waiting for the remote to arrive. I crossed the cleaning lady on my way out and asked if she could please take care the stuff under the bed. She never did, in the whole week that we were there.
On the other hand, concierge service was awesome!!!

review.title: What a view
review.reviewText: The Sky Lounge on the 36th floor has a great view of the city.

review.title: Great location, excellent service
review.reviewText: Hotel was very easy to get to by BART from SFO. I was able to walk to all my business meetings and catch some museums as well. Though "big city" hotel, Marriott staff actually took the time to talk to me and accomodate my room request. Plan to repeat visit.

review.title: Location is Good!!!
review.reviewText: Hotel location is Good!!! But alot kids will handout in lobby (i don't think is hotel guest!!!!) at night time???? they not in the Bar just handout inside the lobby! I don't like it at all!!!!!

review.title: Very good (but not spectacular) for the price
review.reviewText: A solid hotel experience. Could be updated a little, but no complaints. Great location and reasonable rates.

review.title: nice... IF they clean your room beforehand
review.reviewText:
We checked in and got to our room and it was lovely, until we looked around. There was a weird white stain on the coffee table and crumbs on the carpet. Upon closer inspection, we found a TOENAIL CLIPPING ON THE FLOOR! They had serviced the room, but did an incredibly poor job cleaning.
We went downstairs and asked for a new room, and the second room was a smaller room with a very small window. Unacceptable.
We went downstairs and asked for another new room, at least equal to the one we had given up, and were finally given a clean room, identical to the first.
I guess third time's a charm...

I won't ever be going back to the Mariott...

review.title: Best location
review.reviewText: Very good good location to go around the city.

review.title: Great location for shopping and BART
review.reviewText: We liked everything about this hotel for the most part. The beds were a little too firm for us and we tossed and turned somewhat. The room was very clean, all staff were very helpful. We had a drink one night in the bar at the top and the view was beautiful but drinks are rather pricey. We did not eat at any of the hotel dining rooms since there were so many other options close by such as the Drive in Diner across the street that has great burgers, breakfasts, etc. at very reasonable prices. Old Navey is right across the street as is the shopping mall and Bart is half a block away as is Market Street and Union Square is one block away, this hotel has a great location.

review.title: Clean and Good Location
review.reviewText:
Hotel is located heart of Market Street. You can walk a block and you'll able to see cable cars and major transportation. Only thing that surprised me was the parking rate. Paid $55 per day 24hr with valet( hotel does not offer self-parking).

Overall, very pleasant with the stay with reasonable price.

I strongly recommend to those who is traveling out there.

review.title: Sanfrancisco Marriott
review.reviewText: Overall very satisfied with the hotel. Great service and good location. I would definitely recommend this one.

review.title: Great Place, but parking costs too much
review.reviewText:
This hotel was really nice and most everyone we dealt with was very helpful and courteous. The valet parking was really convenient, but really expensive. We had a good price on the room through Expedia so that helped to lessen the pain of that expense. And we found other places nearby to eat and have beverages, so we didn't have to endure the hotels high prices on those.
We were looking for a hotel that was near the Tenderloin so we could search for our daughter, but wanted to feel safe at night. This hotel was just the ticket for us. By day, we roamed the Tenderloin (only a few blocks from our hotel) posting flyers and visiting soup kitchens. By night, we went shopping at Macy's and other fine department stores and even watched the lighting of the christmas tree in Union Square...talk about your two different worlds!?! And, we heard from our daughter!!! It was a great trip!

review.title: I could not BELIEVE, $60.00 dlls parking per night
review.reviewText: Rates were great, but parking $60.00 dollars per night....

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: We bought a city pass and went everywhere by public transportation very easily. Hotel has all major routes within a block including airport BART line. A find was the food court at Westfield or Westin vertical mall a block away where we ate inexpensively. Hotel had comfortable beds and bath, good climate control. Great shopping nearby. Starbucks in the lobby was great. A good hotel in a great city.

review.title: Great location for families
review.reviewText:
This is a beautiful hotel and we will definately stay there again. The proximity to Yerba Buena Gardens was very convenient for us with two kids. There is a lovely play park there to run to for a little exercise for the kids as well as the museum, carousel and ice skating rink. The indoor pool does NOT look like the picture (they did some fancy photography). It looks like a regular indoor pool that any Y would have. It served our purposes just fine, though.
We did notice we were very warm at night (too warm). The beds have good quality down comforters that would keep any eskimo toasty! The bellhops were very nice; the concierge guy was a little snippy, and we felt rushed even though there were no other guests in site. Overall, great great hotel!

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, nice location. You get what you pay for. Plenty of good restaurants at walking distance, and Union Square is just a few blocks away. The Sky lounge is also worth a visit, though drinks are overpriced. I come often to SF and this was my first stay here. Will definitely consider it again next time.

review.title: great price. I love it.
review.reviewText: I've always been looking for a good price and nice place in SF. found it !!!

review.title: Great location for everything. Would stay again
review.reviewText: Great hotel with everything that you need along with a central location to everything that you will want to see.

review.title: Most likely to stay here again.
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, in the heart of San Francisco. My only complaint is for out of town people, renting cars, using GPS to find hotel, as I did-The hotel gives you the address for the front of the hotel, and valet parking entrance is on another street. In a city where you can't easily make a U-turn, with alot of one way streets, it was difficult for me to find the correct route to get to valet parking. I must have driven an extra 20 minutes trying to figure out how to get to the back street. Hotel should include address of valet parking entrance. Other than that, extremely satisfied.

review.title: ok, but noisy
review.reviewText: the room was clean, comfortable, but there was a strange fan noise of fan during all the day, expecially the night...my room was 1842

review.title: Very Good Area & Hotel: SF Marriott
review.reviewText:
Took a trip to San Francisco to see Wicked. The location was close to public transportation and walking distance from shopping and the theatre.

I have stayed here before and everytime, I have enjoyed it.

review.title: value priced...
review.reviewText: Good for a couple of nights... close to a few shopping areas. Not a one those legendary SF places but for the price paid, well worth. But parking was a rip off, so find your overnight parking.

review.title: convenient + classy + affordable
review.reviewText:
this hotel is centrally located to the downtown area with easy access to the BART for travel around the san francisco area. the staff was helpful, whether it was giving us the good news our room was ready when we arrived early or helping us get an early-am cab to the airport. they also passed out handy info sheets on the area events going on the weekend of our stay.

rooms were large + clean, and the value was on par with what you'd expect for the location and name-brand service.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: Awesome service, great room, wonderful location!!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
The Marriot was a perfect choice for the Convention I attended in the Moscone Center. You cross the street through Yerba Gardens and you're there.
It is centrally located to a variety of shopping and restaurants.
You can ride BART from the Airport and get off at the Powell St. station, which is less than half a block from the hotel entrance. The Cable Car turn around is a block away and you can ride them to Fishermans Wharf.
China Town is an easy 3 block walk.

review.title: This hotel ruined my vacation!
