review.reviewText: I was having a hard time deciding detween this hotel and the Westin. So I called up both hotels to get further information to help me decide. This hotel told me that they offered a free shuttle to local attractions and most importantly, to Candlestick Park (I was taking my boyfriend to the 49ers game-that was the whole purpose of the trip). I was also told that when we got to the airport that they offered a shuttle for $25 per person but recommended that I take the BART (which thankfully we did). The Westin did not offer any of that so althought the Marriott was more money I figured with the incentives it would be worth it. I WAS WRONG! When we got to the hotel the first thing I did was go to the concierges desk to get all the details and was looked at like I was an idiot. Everyone who worked at the hotel were the rudiest people I had ever dealt with. Very unhelpful and could care less about you. Turns out everything I was told was untrue and we were left with no transporation to the game on Sunday! It was a waste of my money to spend the extra on this hotel on top of the extras we had to pay since they did NOT provide any transportation. It completely ruined the weekend!

review.title: A Marquis experience
review.reviewText: Great hotel in a great location for shopping and restaurants. Very friendly staff. Great views of the city and the bay.

review.title: SanFrancisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, prime location, really enjoyed our stay!

review.title: Good choice
review.reviewText: I was entirely pleased with this hotel. Mind you, I use hotels on vacations only to sleep in, so I can't any much about amenities outside the room. But the bed was comfortable, the room was bright, and I had enough pillows that I didn't need to call room service to ask for more. Checking out was a breeze. The location is brilliant (and why I picked the hotel). Just a block or so from BART and many, many busses, which means that I could go all over the city without any hassle. I will definitely stay here again when I go back.

review.title: Very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: Everything worked. Room was very nice. Breakfast was good. It's close to the BART station for the trip from and to the airport.

review.title: Great Concierge
review.reviewText: The hotel is extremely big in a business area. So, dont expect for personal assistance. Except for the great concierge desk.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: I am very impressed with the quality of the hotel. The location is excellent and the area is nice. It is a central location and close to everything.

review.title: $55 Parking.
review.reviewText: The room rate was good, but what they don't tell you is that parking is $55 per night and a tiny pour of wine in the lobby bar is $18

review.title: easy going
review.reviewText: nice hotel for its price. there r other hotels in the area for about the same price. I would easily recommend this Marriott, the Sir Francis Drake, and the Hilton. The price is right (during the not-so-high season), and the location is very easy to all places.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Loved it

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: Room was nice, food & drinks at the bar & resturants in the hotel were very over priced for what you got.... but other than that everyone was very nice and helpful.. I will definetly go back..

review.title: Great Hotel for Price and Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and all hotel personnel were kind and very helpful. We were greeted and checked in promptly with all questions answered. I received great information from the concierge on transportation, and places to go. The location of the hotel was great for grabbing a cable car, muni bus and shopping all around. Enjoyed the stay and felt the hotel was well worth the price paid! Definitely would stay there again and recommend to others.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Wasn't quite sure where to stay but had researched and found this to be a great location if you were only using public transportation. You can access Bart and Muni a block from the hotel. We would stay there again.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: We got an offer and could stay in this hotel for a reasonable price. It is very big, very nice and the room was perfect. Also, it is located very close to Union square, close to the cable cars and to all the public transportation that goes along Market street. Take a look at the top floor, there is a bar where you can have some wine while contemplating the espectacular views of San Francisco.

review.title: San Francisco's Best
review.reviewText: This is the best location in San Francisco, it's very close to the Powell Bart Station. You can get off the airport and be in your hotel without worry about parking within half hour. It's one block from the Westfield Shopping Center, and walking distant to Union Square and Chinatown.

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: Great location!!Close to everything you want to see in San Fran...very very comfy beds and room was clean. Thats all I need.

review.title: Business Office and Coffee
review.reviewText: Ouch! 30 cents a minute for internet access in the business office. More "upscale" hotels are starting to charge to check your emails in their business office. I don't cart my laptop around on leisure travel and like to spot check my friends or work email if I have time, but not here.

review.title: San Fran Trip
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located. The room was comfortable as well, but the bathroom floor needed some more leaning.

review.title: Great location . Would stay again .
review.reviewText: very clean room , great indoor pool .

review.title: Very Impress
review.reviewText: I love the setting of this hotel. Lobby always crowded with people and front staffs are very friendly. Shopping malls is right at the corner which made it very easy to access.

review.title: Awesome Beds. Great Location. Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at this Marriot over Labor Day weekend 2009 and couldn't have been happier. We got a great price through Expedia and were pleasently surprized by all this hotel had to offer. The beds were especially comfortable with their pillow top matresses, down pillows, and great bedding. There is an awesome bar on the 39th floor with spectacular views of the city. Our room had a fantastic view of the city as well. We were able to see the sunrise over the buildings. The cleaning staff was very helpful and plesant, going out of their way to help us when we had issues with our key. The concierge was also very helpful in recomending restaurants that are close to the hotel. This hotel is just a block away from the action of the trolly turntable and amazing shopping.

review.title: Glass
review.reviewText: Broken glass was fixed up in my bathroom.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was ideally situated for our needs. It was close to Union Square, and the Academy of Arts dorm my daughter was moving into. We were able to access public transportation easily and learned to move throughout the area easily. The room and hotel accommodations were excellent. Our room had a nice city view.

review.title: A great location, easy to get to BART
review.reviewText: This is a big hotel -- three different towers -- but they seem well organized and the location in the Yerba Buena redevelopment area is good.

review.title: It's OK
review.reviewText: Cattle car mentality--lots of people running through the hotel. Expensive valet parking but adjacent parking lot for self parking. Conveniently located for shopping--and some major tourist attractions. Would go back if they had a special on room rates; otherwise would stay more near Union Square.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This was my 3rd stay at this hotel, but it was the first time my room was uncomfortably warm. Air conditioning was at its lowest setting, but the warm room kept me awake at night.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Close to Union Square and the Embarcadero, as well as the BART and Muni lines. Great work-out facility.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful downtown area hotel yet within easy access to all San Francisco has to offer. At check in there was a minor miscommunication as to the type of room requested but the replacement room had a better view and location,(had requested a double room which had a city view, received a corner upper floor king room with fantastic views over Union Square on one side and bay views on the other). Nice hotel that appeared to just be getting some remodeling glithes finished, ice makers on our floor and one down and up were not in service on arrival and on second day hallway between our room and the elevators were partially blocked to allow workers to tap in water lines for these devices. Will go back on future visits to the bay area.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with this hotel. Hotel service was excellent and the rooms were clean. We made a special request asking that the 3 rooms we reserved be next to each other; the hotel was able to accomodate without problems. Parking was expensive, but to be expected when staying in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Marriott Needs to Step Up
review.reviewText: The welcome and greetings were ok, but this should be a flagship Marriott given its location in the heart of downtown San Francisco. The furniture in the rooms was dated to 1973, the concierge had a huge line at all hours. They have ZERO free internet, you have to pay $13 for every 24 hours or $4 for 15 minutes in teh business center. I've been to hotels across the country and most provide free internet kiosks in the lobby. The location is outstanding, otherwise, not impressed.

review.title: Right in the Heart of SanFransisco
review.reviewText: Magnificent Hotel. Wonderful rooms and views. Opulent lobby area. Very helpful staff.

review.title: Great Stay!
review.reviewText: We stayed 3 nights and the hotel was great. Within easy reach of everything we wanted to see in SF. The showerhead was the best! The view was spectacular. The only downsides were the sound of the elevator going up and down all night (which didn't bother me, but did my mother) and all the kids screaming in the pool area. We had 2 meals in the restaurant and both were excellent. The concierge was extremely helpful on more than one occasion! We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: My experience in the San Francisco Marriott hotel was the best, the room always clean, staff very friendly, the concierge guys always gave me the best tips on directions and locations, the view from the VIEW incredible, I did my booking several months before and the price was incredible, I have recommended it to all my friends and I go back especially quito, very quiet rooms, in order for me has everything you need while on holiday.

review.title: Excellent hotel!
review.reviewText: Not a single point of failure! a 4 star hotel that has the service of a 5 star, in the most convinient location of the city.

review.title: Hotel staff was wonderful!
review.reviewText: We had some issues with our room but the hotel staff responded quickly. Hotel was in a nice location and you could walk to different venues.

review.title: Exemplary Hotel
review.reviewText: Exemplary servive... Exemplary personnel

review.title: Great location, thumbs up from the parents
review.reviewText: My husband and I took our parents to San Francisco and the Marriott received thumbs up from everyone. Very clean, great service, amazing views from the bar on the 34th floor. One day the cleaning crew must have skipped over my mom's room, so the next day they left chocolate on her pillow which made her happy. Very helpful staff always willing to provide directions and tour ideas. The Marriott is in a central location - close to all of the museums, cable car, buses, street cars. Parking was very expensive at the hotel - $55/day and the alternative was $35 across the street that is not secure.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was in an ideal location. Trains, trolleys, etc. very close as well as Union Square and great shopping!

review.title: will stay there
review.reviewText: you can use free WIFI in the lobby

review.title: Very nice hotel and close to everything
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the rooms were nice. The beds were very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Good food

review.title: Standard hotel room
review.reviewText: Standard hotel room, a little small though. No wireless internet in the room - this was a little surprising for a hotel in one of the big cities in the country. Hotel service was excellent.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Affordable. Great friendly service. Free wireless would be nice.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: My guest room, lobby and function rooms are clean and well maintained. The hotel staff were always friendly.

review.title: It was great
review.reviewText: Located in a great area of downtown San Francisco. A very nice hotel.

review.title: Great Place To Stay! Bad Parking!
review.reviewText: This hotel was a really great place to stay. Walking distance to AT&T park, so that was nice. Check in and check out was so fast! You actually do it yourself on a computer in the lobby. That was super simple. The only bad part about this place was that the parking lot was full, and does not accommodate full size trucks. So we had to park in a public garage a couple of blocks away. They also charge $35.00 to park in the hotel garage.

review.title: Great location, could walk to almost all the points of interest.
review.reviewText: Very clean and friendly.

review.title: Terrific Choice
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay in this hotel again. It is very well located, the staff is friendly and efficient, I couldn't have asked for more.

review.title: nice hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the middle of shopping and only a few blocks from China Town. The breakfast buffet was nice and the kids price was very reasonable. Rooms were decorated nicely, but in a generic beige color. Beds were well appointed with feather beds, down comforters and soft, fluffy pillows. We faced the street on the 7th floor looking right at the China Town gate. The street noise was probably there, but nothing that I remember being a big deal. The indoor pool was very nice and my kids enjoyed it almost ever day of our visit! Parking is off the hook ($55 a day) and internet is also extra ($12.95 a day) so make sure you add that to the daily cost! The worst thing about the room is that the $4 candy bars were right there on the table. If you even move them you'll be charged. I stood a book up in front of them so the kids would forget about them and I would remember not to put anything next to them so they wouldn't get bumped. You can not even put anything in the mini bar fridge without being charged. They do say they'll bring a fridge to you, but I didn't try.

review.title: Nice place but internet options not good enough!
review.reviewText: Overall happy with service and my room during a developers conference there. A big minus is the lack of true open wireless internet in the public areas. The "Free" internet still demands registration through a web browser screen and this technical setup is NOT compatible with most smart phones (I use an iPhone 3G). Furthermore there is no wireless option for the rooms and the overall price of cable based internet is horrible high... Come on Marriott, even Lori's dinner(50's breakfast place) in downtown SF can figure out to provide free, open standard internet. As long as they just regard it as a money machine and not as an essential service to business customers, I guess things wont change...

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 3 nights June 5-8. Convention people arrived Sunday, hotel was quieter on Fri/Sat. Our room faced away from the street so it was super quiet. Very comfortable bed, decent size bathroom and nice large flat screen TV. Desk chair looked a little worn out. Free wireless internet available in lobby areas but wired ethernet for a gouging fee $12.95/day. Lots of comfortable and even semi-private lounge areas for doing computer work in the lobby (look to the left of elevators behind curtained-off areas). Elevators were very quick and rarely had to wait long. Pool and Spa was clean and not too crowded. Never got up to the bar with the famous view but maybe next time. We heard drinks are not cheap but the view is spectacular. Lots of homeless druggies asking for money near hotel.

review.title: Whirlwind Weekend
review.reviewText: Just what we hoped for. Our schedule left little room to enjoy the many amenities, but our room was beautiful and the staff helpful. Fun and happy experience.

review.title: Would Stay Again
review.reviewText: Hotel Staff was exceptional

review.title: SF Marriott
review.reviewText: This hotel is good. Not great, but good. It is definitely geared to the business convention crowd - therefore, there may be waits in line for the elevator or to check in. The concierge was very helpful, although there was a wait in line there too. The room was a little dated, but clean and well maintained. Overall, I would stay here again because of it's excellent location.

review.title: Quality hotel in great location
review.reviewText: I was here for a short business trip, and this property filled all my expectations along with having a very convenient location, just a few blocks from Union Square.

review.title: Comfortable in San Fran
review.reviewText: Great doormen! Room was a little small with view of roof, but adequate. Hotel close to everything in downtown, a block or so from the trolley stop and the subway stations. Right in the middle of all the exclusive shopping! Great for a convention - one/half block walk to Moscone Center.

review.title: Just what I needed - almost!
review.reviewText: For business, or plesure, location is perfect. Staff (maids, front desk, restaurant) were all very accommodating and friendly. Room was extremely comfortable. I will use this hotel again. As a single female traveler, it would be nice to have better lighting in the bathroom, a make-up (or rear view mirror) would be helpful.

review.title: BEST hotel stay ever!
review.reviewText: This hotel is 4 stars in my book... expedient check-in, very nice room, luxurious bedding, and excellent service especially the concierges. Also, a great location... near the cable cars, F streetcar, and BART... no need for a car. Definitely a favorite!

review.title: well located hotel
review.reviewText: really well located and wonderful views from the top floor.

review.title: One of the best hotels in which I have stayed
review.reviewText: When I first arrived at the hotel, at the registration desk I was attended to by the most helpful, polite person that I have seen in a long time. It was a pleasure to be greeted by a professional person. He should be rewarded for his outstanding customer service which seems to be lacking at most hotel. The 39th floor lounge has the most beautiful view of San Francisco.

review.title: pool and jacuzzi broken
review.reviewText: the overall hotel was excellent and would recommend it to anyone. Very beautiful and convienent to Union Square. The hotel failed to mention to us that the pool and jacuzzi was out of service for three weeks. My familiy and I were looking forward to soaking in the hot tub.

review.title: Great hotel, good value
review.reviewText: We would surely come back

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Enjoyed a very nice stay at this hotel. From our greeting on arrival and throughout our stay,we were impressed with our room, service and overall quality of this hotel. Would recommend it to our friends and family. Great location made it easy to get where we wanted to go. Wonderful staff.

review.title: Nice and central place at SFO
review.reviewText: Nice and central place at SFO & a good restaurant

review.title: Disappointed hotel guest
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Marriott for two nights. Upon arriving we went directly to our room. The room was filthy. I phoned the front desk and was given the run around about moving rooms. I was even told I would be charged an additional $20 for the move. I told them I was a 100% unsatisfied customer and would be writing a review. After sharing this info they immediately agreed to move my room without the threatened charge. A women from the front desk and a man came to check on the room as if they didn't believe me and seemed surprised to find I was in deed telling the truth. The room was disgusting. The shower curtain had black mold on it and there was hair and toe nail clippings on the floor and toilet area. The windows were so dirty you couldn't see out them, and the carpet was gross. I was thankful my stay was only for two nights. I usually stay at the Marriott Hotel chain when I travel but after this experience I will no longer.

review.title: Business Travel
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend the Marriott. Its friendly and efficient staff complement the comfort of the rooms and the hotel's convenient location.

review.title: Surprised and impressed
review.reviewText: We selected this hotel because we attended an Alumni Meeting there. I was completely surprised at the comfort and size of the room...the beds are extremely comfortable, and the view was outstanding. The hotel is only a few easy blocks to shopping, theater and restaurants. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location for a conference at the Moscone convention centre.
review.reviewText: Very adequate for business. The price is good but from the room to the spa, I wouldn't stay there on vacation. The location is great and the employees are helpful.

review.title: Super location
review.reviewText: This is a great location, especially if you are going to the convention center which is just a few short blocks away. There are tons of great restaurants within a 2 block radius.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Nice hotel overall, great location -- very close to BART station which saves on the high parking costs. Beds/pillows not as comfortable as most Marriott hotels. Our rate included breakfast buffet, which was a very good option.

review.title: Typical business hotel
review.reviewText: Nothing special and no disappointments Decent fitness studio Expensive internet access

review.title: Great location and very nice accomodations
review.reviewText: This hotel is one of my favourite places to stay in San Francisco - just minutes from the shops of Union Square and access to the cable car. It's around the corner from the BART station making it a very easy hotel to get to from the airports without needing to take a taxi. All in all, a fantastic hotel.

review.title: Nice Views
review.reviewText: The views from the sky lounge were incredible, but the ht tub was out of service and the hotel employees stated the it had been for 6 MONTHS! It was quite a bummer sine we had already paid to the fee to enter the facility.

review.title: Valet Parking Nightmare
review.reviewText: The only thing I remember from my hotel stay was the very beginning and the very end. Waited 25 minutes to enter valet parking, got out of my car, walked to the hotel and was told they were short handed. Walked back to my car and waited my turn. The next morning I called down for my car, waited more the 25 minutes. Finally went inside, brought a manager out to deal with all the other guests that had waited longer than I had. None of this has anything to do with the cost of valet parking either. Would not have thought twice about the $50.00 charge if I had not had the worst service. No one cared that we were unhappy. No manager outside dealing with the issue until I complained. Will never stay there again. All would have been solved by a manager there dealing with the problem and maybe a cup of coffee while waiting.

review.title: Valet Parking A Mess
review.reviewText: Waiting 1+ hours in the Marriott's valet parking line forced us to exit that line and delay check in because we were going to be late to our event. Returning after the event at 12:00 midnight to finally check in we found there still to be a line and wait for valet parking. Valet parking is open to the public with no separate provisions for guests checking into the hotel. The resulting long delays and guest frustration are compounded because hotel staff offers no explanation - they do shrug their shoulders quite well!

review.title: Internet charges roll on / Whirpool out of service
review.reviewText: The whirpool has been out of service for at least two months and there seems to be no plan to fix it. It was raining for three days in a row so the whirlpool would have been nice. The manager on duty graciously upgraded us after I pointed this out. I asked for internet service for 3 days (needed it for business) and activated it online on each of those 3 days. But they charged me for six days. The charges were removed after I complained, but was given no reasonable excuse for the unauthorized charges in the first place. Online account information was not available, so I couldn't dispute it earlier. Great location. Near museums. Near BART. Near numerous buses and underground Muni on Market Street. Near shopping. Near movie theater. Easy bus ride to Golden Gate Park or to Fisherman's Wharf. Easy to rent a car from Enterprise for day trip to wherever. (Hertz on site is overpriced and has an additional $10 valet surcharge.) Parking is expensive - even more than NYC!

review.title: PERFECT LOCATION
review.reviewText: OUTSTANDING HOTEL WITH THE MOST KNOWLEDGED STAFF. THIS PLACE IS IN THE MIDDLE OF EVERYTHING. GO FOR IT IF YOU WANT TO GET THE MOST OUT OF SAN FRANCISCO. ROOM APPEARED TO BE A LITTLE PLAIN LOOKING & IT WOULDNT HURT TO HAVE SOME KIND OF AIR FRESHENER.

review.title: Internet failure
review.reviewText: The Internet was down ,,, sadly , but overall a nice and very friendly hotel

review.title: Excellent location, comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the SF Marriott on New Year's Eve. It was delightfully within walking distance of the BART train, restaurants, theater and NYE fireworks festivities. My husband is a Marriott Rewards elite member, allowing us to bypass the *long* check-in line, which was much appreciated. Same for check-out. Our room was comfortable and surprisingly quiet for a crazy night in the big city. We recommend the SF Marriott. Thank you!

review.title: Great Hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText: This hotel was great,one of the best hotels I've been in the US.

review.title: Room was smelly and worn. Valet cost $56. Ouch!
review.reviewText: We stayed there for two days on new years eve. Our first impression when we opened our room was that this room needs remodeling. The rooms stinks like mildew. Beds were on the worn side and the hotel towel and sheets were very worn. C'mon now. Hotel towels had strings showing at the edges. Location was nice and so were the gym and pool. Oh yah, watch out for the valet. It's 56 bucks! We stayed at Hotel 480 last year. It was a much nicer room and but it cost more. I guess you get what you pay for.

review.title: Beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful time..

review.title: Better Marriotts out there, but good location
review.reviewText: There are better Marriott's out there...but its not at all bad. The location is very good for sightseeing and attending conferences and... the proximity to the Powell station makes getting around San Francisco a breeze. I'd rather have a place with a small kitchen area, but, apart from that, it was perfectly fine.

review.title: Location ,Location ,Location
review.reviewText: Great Location, Convenient to all. Kids loved the indoor pool!! Must go up to the "View", it's just beautiful!! Great wings in the Sports Bar!! We would recommend this hotel.

review.title: It was a nice location
review.reviewText: There was a bit of confusion with a special request that we made upon booking the hotel; we needed a wheelchair and they could not accommdate us when we arrived. If we would have known that it was not possible the we could have made other arrangements prior to arriving. We ended up having to get one from the mall and as you can imagine it was a complete hassle with making calls, walking around, etc. trying to locate a wheelchair.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: In the middle of the shopping district. Step outside and you can catch the bus, subway, or trolly. Walking distance from China Town and Little Italy.

review.title: No Surprises
review.reviewText: This hotel was exactly what you would expect from reviewing the description on expedia. Great location in downtown area.

review.title: A satisfying stay
review.reviewText: I have been visiting San Francisco every year for the past 9 years, and have made a point of staying at different similarly-rated hotels. The San Francisco Marriott has been one of my most satisfying hotels stays. From the attentive staff to cleanliness of public spaces, and especially my room, to hotel amenities, I couldn't ask for anything more. I was the most happy camper.

review.title: great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: Great located hotel, Marriott service is always good.

review.title: Convenient, comfortable, but not clean
review.reviewText: Great location to shopping, dining, and public transportation. The beds were very comfortable and the spa treatments were great. Opportunity for improvement lies within cleanliness. We found food and trash under the bed and under the desk. There were small curly hairs near the toilet area. On the second day we noticed the hairs were removed, but the food/trash under the bed remained during our entire 5 day stay.

review.title: Awesome Stay
review.reviewText: I only spent a night here and it was great. The Hotel staff are nice and insist on helping you have the best stay possible. I would definitely stay here again and again.

review.title: checked as soon as i got back to go again
review.reviewText: the hotel was great, clean, comfortable, and the staff helped out with anything. The location is perfect close to all transit stops and the shopping in and around in walking distance is amazing....if your going to a baseball game or football as i did. stay here... i plan on going back soon

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Right near Union Square - close to all the shops. Concierge extremely helpful booking dinner reservations. Great view. Valet parking a bit pricey, but you can leave and come back. Would definetely stay again.

review.title: Great location, great staff, great rooms
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff, great rooms

review.title: Stay in Marriott San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent location, just 5 minute walk to Union Square, Powell St. cable cars, shopping, dining and BART (train to SF airport)! Friendly service and fantastic eagles eye of SF from the "Views Bar".

review.title: Best choice for hotel in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: The staff of hotel very Friendly and helpful. Compared to the rest of the towns people the Marriott staff were most friendly. Needed a small refrig to store some food brought back from a resturant. The refrig in the room was full of beverages and snacks you must pay for and no room for extra stuff the guests might want to store in it. The desk arranged for housekeeping to bring a little frig to our room. Great customer service!

review.title: Very nice hotel to stay in SF
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed in this hotel over labor day weekend. The hotel is very quite (don't hear much people talking loud at hall way or throw the door although it is convention hotel. It is at very good location to many places, etc. it only cost less than $11.00 to take taxi to Fisherman's warf. It's very close to the location you can cathch city tour bus, etc. I have to mention that the bed is very comfortable compare to many 4 star hotels around the country. We didn't use hotel other facilities except had breakfast buffet twice (it is ok). We definitely recommend this hotel to other people.

review.title: Great Location and Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: All the staff were friendly. The hotel is 2 blocks from the bart and cable cars. Try the chicken wings at the sports bar downstairs GREAT. I would stay there again.

review.title: Very nice room, perfect location!
review.reviewText: I chose to stay in this hotel for several reasons, including the location being downtown, it got great reviews, and I was able to afford it! The room was comfortable and clean, and the staff was very friendly.

review.title: Great Downtown Hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel is a great place to stay when you visit San Francisco. It's right in Downtown where the city never sleeps. Not far away from major transportation systems and the famous cable cars. The staff was very friendly and helpful! I will definitely stay here again!

review.title: enjoyed its facilities very much:sauna,swimming pool,comfortable envirnments
review.reviewText: first of all, I liked mordern and new facility,but I couldn't use internet at my room free.

review.title: VERY , VERY NICE!!!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel(nice property),Close by all-China-town,BART,UNION SQUARRE,SHOPPING,WATER,in DOWNTOWN.Good management!!!

review.title: Long Weekend
review.reviewText: Overall, pretty good value. Hotel is in a good location within a half block of Market street and all the public transportation that goes through there. Good shopping close by. Only real complaint about the hotel service was that if you were still in your room at 9am, the maid service bypassed you and do not come back later to clean, make beds, provide fresh towels, etc.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: I was beyond impressed with the service of this hotel! the conceirge was great from even before we arrived with suggestions of restaurants and tours, to helping us with everything once we got there. The trip couldn't have been more flawless!

review.title: Gorgeous
review.reviewText: This hotel exceeded our expectations in that it was lovely, spacious and well-located. The room was elegant, had a nice view, and was roomy. The staff cleaned it and then did a refresh of the room in the late afternoon. The one thing I would say was that there was more to this hotel than we realized. The top-floor cocktail lounge was elegant. Perhaps it would be good to ask the staff about hotel amenities or go on line and look around so you will be able to use all the nice amenities of this lovely hotel. We walked everywhere so we did not have to pay the car parking fee, which I saw was substantial. Overall, we both thought the hotel was wonderful, beautiful, the staff knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Their professionalism was refreshing. This hotel helped to make our experience wonderful.

review.title: recomended
review.reviewText: this hotel was very comfortable, excellant room service, and downtown is just right around the corner. the only thing was sometimes when you turn on the shower it made an awful noise, but it is easily fixed if you just simply turn off the shower and then back on again..i wish the neighbors would have used common sense and tried this little trick instead of waking me at 5am..otherwise beautiful hotel, excelent service, and just a very comfortable atmosphere with a bed that felt like you were in heaven.

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel with lots of conveniences.

review.title: It was nice
review.reviewText: Overall it was nice but the last day of our stay suck because the electricity went out so we had to carry our luggages along with two kids from the 21st floor to the 1st floor.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: I liked the hotel. It was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great Hotel for business or leisure
review.reviewText: The staff of the Marriott are committed to making your stay as pleasurable as possible. The accomodations are great, the restaurants and bar first class, and the overall experience warrants a return.

review.title: impressive
review.reviewText: Perfect location, and very nice hotel overall. Of course it is expensive though..

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was very convenient to everything we wanted to see and do. It is only two blocks to Union Square, shopping is everywhere, public transit is very convenient. The hotel is buzzing at all hours of the night.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: First trip to San Francisco and will definitely stay at this hotel next time. The hotel was clean, the staff was very courteous and helpful. If you plan on just staying in the bay area, no care needed because the hotel is centrally located to almost everything. We used the valet service at the hotel, and it was a little expensive, but so worth it. Great hotel!

review.title: LOVED THIS HOTEL
review.reviewText: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Marriott San Francisco. It was awesome! The Concierge service was above and beyond what we would have expected. It was in a great location in the city. We were surrounded with lots of shopping! We will absolutely return to this hotel. Loved it!

review.title: Very pleased with our stay!
review.reviewText: Excellent concierge service with great advice! Clean, comfortable room and good location.

review.title: Impressed and Satisfied
review.reviewText: Although I feel the price is a bit high, it is still comparable to similar class of hotels in the area. The room are bright and clean. The location is convenient and easy walking distance to almost anything...shops, restaurants, the famous cable cars and public transportations. The staff are incredibly helpful and accommodating. You can tell, they enjoy their work. Smiles are all around. I even witness a fine example of staff's superb customer assistance training wherein a Marriott building electrical engineer offered to help carry bags for another guess to the elevator. Kudos to the staff and crew of the Marriot San Francisco. Looking forward to staying there again.

review.title: I liked it
review.reviewText: Great place, great consierge service

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: We were completely satisfied with our stay. Centrally located and easy to find it will be a must on our list next visit to San Francisco. The rooms were clean, the staff friendly and helpful to our needs and to all of our questions. Located close to all transportations, restaurants, shopping and sight seeing.

review.title: I won't go back
review.reviewText: Although the accommodations were fine, there was nothing special about them. With few exceptions, the service was poor, especially at the lounges/restaurants.

review.title: stay
review.reviewText: Extremely helpful concierge staff

review.title: Good for rich
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was good. However, basic things such as internet access or breakfast weren't included in my reservation. And, they cost more than what I expected. Overall, the hotel was great but only if you don't care about expending a lot for your hotel.

review.title: I'd Stay there again
review.reviewText: The service and quality of the hotel was excellent. It was conveniently located for public transportation .

review.title: Over-charge for parking
review.reviewText: Everything was quite decent at the hotel except the cost for parking was outrageous. It costed almost 50 dollars a night.

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: Well located. Close to shopping and main city attractions....A bit noisy and busy as well especially if a big conference is on.

review.title: Very nice.
review.reviewText: Excellent service. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Nice hotel.

review.title: No Comment
review.reviewText: No Comment

review.title: Perfectly Located
review.reviewText: Wonderful stay, excellent conceirge service. We were perfectly located for everything we needed. Would definetly stay again. Freindly service and great coffee downstairs.

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: great location and service. clean rooms. all was very good!

review.title: Keep up the good work
review.reviewText: Impressed from 1st day till the departure

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the overall level of quality of this hotel. It was also very conveniently located for my business needs in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Nice well-located Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel. BART is 2 blocks away. Market Street, 1 block away. Beautiful rooms.

review.title: great stay
review.reviewText: great place to stay in the heart od San Fransisco

review.title: Nice hotel to stay
review.reviewText: The view from the hotel room window (facing the Bay bridge) is great. It is very clean. Close to Cable car temrinal and Union Square.

review.title: One of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in
review.reviewText: Concierge very helpful. Bed so comfortable. Very quiet. Very clean. Top of the line fixtures and furnishings.

review.title: Great first Visit to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Well staying at this location was the best idea. A ll the team at the hotel were wonderful. We had a great time and the rooms were great . Thank you we enjoyed our stay in San Franciso @ the Marriot:)

review.title: In the middle of where you want to be
review.reviewText: Perfect location!! Would recommend to others!! Had a great time and can't wait to go back.

review.title: Improvement needed
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to everything,which is a plus. For the three nights that we stayed there, the sheets were not changed at all. Room service was not to my expected standards, they did not clean the bathroom, all they did wqas give us new towels. Also, the room was extremely dusty.

review.title: Pretty Cool..
review.reviewText: The Hotel was nice and all, but the noise was not comfortable at all. The shower made a very loud banging noise when you try to turn the water hot and you could easily hear the pipes through the walls. The walls seemed thin, as you could hear anyone that walks by or is talking in the neighboring room. It's alright. Good location.

review.title: will go back
review.reviewText: bath walls and floors lack cleaning.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location with easy access to public transportation. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable. I love the hotel and SF! I can't wait to go back and I know how Tony Bennet felt when he said "I Left My Heart in San Francisco."

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: We had a corner room on the 16th floor and the views were fantastic. The bar on the top floor of the highest tower also has great views - worth checking out. The beds were extremely comfortable. Overall a very nice hotel.

review.title: LOVED IT!!!
review.reviewText: Our hotel stay was fabulous. I will always stay here when I visit SF.

review.title: good value all around
review.reviewText: great location and a great hotel

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The location was perfect, walking distance to all the brand stores, union square, cable cars, and Bart. Ten minuite walk to China Town and a 30 minuite walk to Pier 39. The room was spacious and had a great city view.

review.title: OK... Not Spectacular
review.reviewText: The lobby was always crowded with big groups of people..the staff was friendly...the pay per view movies (in the room) didn't work properly. (We had to call twice.)The location was great for shopping downtown.

review.title: will return
review.reviewText: The hotel was amazing. The bads were super comfy! Best hotel I have stayed in in a long time.

review.title: Can't go wrong with this hotel choice!
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to get to and from SFO airport on the BART. The BART drops you off 1/2 a block from the hotel. Cost was only 5.35 each way $15 on shuttle. Concierge's were helpful and friendly. Hertz rental was conviently located in the hotel lobby for the day trip we booked to wine country. Hotel is centally located to trolley's and Muni- transportation and the BART.

review.title: Great Location/Great Service
review.reviewText: Perfect location in downtown San Francisco. Staff were very professional. The king bed was soooo comfortable I wanted to take it home.

review.title: Good hotel, perfect location...
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable hotel. Good service. Perfect location.

review.title: Pretty good
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel. It's in a good location, close to everything. Comfortable beds, but our room was very stuffy because it only had one air vent blowing accross the window, not into the room.

review.title: Upscale business or pleasure!
review.reviewText: The concierge helped us with everything in San Francisco and made our visit much more pleasurable.

review.title: Excellent location and service
review.reviewText: The hotel is in an excellent location from the standpoint of being able to get to all of the various sites and places in San Francisco with relative ease.

review.title: Enjoyable
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at the San Francisco Marriott and would definitely stay there again. Very conveniently located.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. Hotel staff is helpful and friendly. Conceirge available for a wealth of information pertaining to dining and transportation. In-room internet service available but fee is a rip-off. Internet should be free for all when staying at a four star establishment. Bottled water and sodas should never cost four bucks in America. Visit the Walgreens down the street for your refreshment.

review.title: Marriott, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, will stay there next year!

review.title: I love SF!
review.reviewText: I enjoyed this downtown SF hotel. Try the bar at the top of the hotel, breathtaking view. Close to all public transportation and attractions. Chinatown is within walking distance. Remember to pack a pair of comfortable walking shoes.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: We recently stayed in this hotel and really loved the location. Beds in this hotel have feather bed top on them, it took a little getting used to, but comfortable. Lobby area can be a bit noisy, but our room was quiet.

review.title: ok stay
review.reviewText: there was some kind of a high school prom during this memorial day weekend in the hotel. Some of these kids stayed on my floor, and they were noisy till the wee hours

review.title: Very good service!!!
review.reviewText: Everything was great at the hotel, very friendly, very informative, clean, comfy. Only thing was the prices for the lounge on the 39th floor. That was pretty ridiculous. You only are paying for the view on that one. But as long as you stay away from drinks and apps on that floor, it's all good!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: I invited 5 family members to stay. This was a complaint from all. The pillows were very full and made it very difficult to sleep, the rooms were very warm, hard to regulate the temperatures, the buffet was boring, same food every day.

review.title: Would definitely go back!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel - friendly staff - great location. It is within easy walking distance of Powell Street Bart Station, Union Square, Ferry Building. I had 27th floor and heard minimal street noises.

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Great hotel to stay at, confernce services were great too. Lots of places to shop within walking distances. Nearby places didn't stay open as late as I expected though.

review.title: Great Hotel for the Value
review.reviewText: We had a great time in the hotel. The room was very clean. The staff was very helpful and checking in and out was a breeze. The downtown location was convenient to Chinatown, Union Square, and shopping. We didn't pack for the weather and were able to go out and buy warmer clothes right around the corner the first day. The few downsides were that we rented a car and parking was very expensive. Coming from NYC, the parking cost more overnight than what we are used to. Also we had to get on a few elevators in order to get to our room since the hotel is doing renovations. But other than that it was a great value for the location.

review.title: WILL ALWAYS STAY AT A MARRIOTT
review.reviewText: EXCELLENT VIEW, SPACIOUS ROOM, SERVICE (HOUSEKEEPING) WAS A one. MARIOTT SF has my vote for all around excellent. when traveling will always look for a MARIOTT

review.title: Outstanding hotel!!!
review.reviewText: The elevator exchanging was a bit of a pain but overall not that bad.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Had a great spa and gym The only negative would be having to use 2 elevators to reach our room.

review.title: Great location of Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Would recommend this hotel as it is close to shopping, cable cars, subway, trams. Very comfortable. Front desk staff are not the friendliest but the Manager is great. Very comfortable rooms and beds.

review.title: Great downtown location
review.reviewText: Stayed four nights in a two bed (double) room with my two kids, ages 13 and 11. (wife was not able to join us). Room was great, although we spent little time in it, meaning we were there to sleep and change to go to the pool. It was cleaned to perfection, especially considering the kids. Location is perfect. Best outing we had was walking straight up/down Stockton St., through China Town to Pier 39 at about the noon hour, took about 45 minutes and we walked really slow. China Town was busy and before the kids knew it we were at the pier. The concierge was superb. We used their services several times, from "where can we get a Coke" to recommending where to get dinner. Their dinner recommendations where spot on. They were able to send us to places that were within walking distance (5-10 minutes) and not only met the dining experience we ask for, but in every instance exceded them. Tell them what you want to eat and they have the answer. Great Marroitt right in downtown SF that also works well for families.

review.title: True San Fransisco Hospitality
review.reviewText: What a luxurious room from the feather duvets, to the friendly and helpful service. I would recommend this hotel to all of my friends and family, right in the heart of downtown, with a view of the entire city from the 39th floor lounge!

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located, easy access to Union Square, China Town, cable car and shops. Our room was spacious, the bed and pillows very comfortable. The employers at the hotel are very friendly and eager to assist you. The building itself is of modern and elegant architectural design. There is a diner around the corner, Mel's, the breakfast menu is great and the prices are reasonable.

review.title: Would stay there again
review.reviewText: This hotel was very conveniently located to downtown shopping, restaurants, and to public transportation. The hotel was doing some renovations and this involved two elevator trips to get to our room but as we were traveling with children, this added to their enjoyment of the hotel. My only complaint would be that the indoor pool water was too cold to swim in, but again, the kids did not seem to mind. The hot tub was nice. The beds were super comfortable and the rooms were quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: good shopping

review.title: Great Place to stay.
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay and easy close to transportation to go anywhere in the city. Great experience.

review.title: Great Time
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, including maid service. Concierge desk employees were helpful and had good suggestions. Snack box in room was annoying. Snickers cost almost $5 so be careful not to bump anything on that stand. The View on top of the hotel was unbelievably fabulous in the evening. Great hotel choice.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: This hotel is located well and is close to all amenities.

review.title: great choice
review.reviewText: The location was great; only 1/2 block from BART, cable cars and busses and short walk to Union Square & China town. The room was very clean, quiet and bed was very comfortable. We were also able to check in early.

review.title: Best Marriott so far...
review.reviewText: Excellent service, eloquent and clean, close to trains, F-Train stop, busses, and Union Square. View Lounge is perfect to end a tiring day from touring San Fran - awesome view of San Fran from the rooftop. In all, this was a perfect hotel.

review.title: Would go back again
review.reviewText: Great location and great service

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel exceeded our expectations. The front office staff was friendly and very helpful. They were the beginning of a great stay. I would especially like to mention the concierges who helped us in many ways and saved us a lot of time and money. The pool and jacuzzi are great to relax in. Overall, a place where we are looking forward to go back to.

review.title: When in San Francisco, this is where I would choose to stay.
review.reviewText: This hotel meets the Marriott standard with its great facilities and cordial, professional staff. With this ideal location to Bart, a variety of stores, fabulous restaurants, and the theatre I could not have been more pleased with my stay.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel to stay if you want to be close to the downtown core. Parking is EXPENSIVE but I knew that before, $50/night + tip for the valet driver.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Clean hotel and room, great location and walking distance to nearby restuarants and shopping at Union Square. Hotel was going under renovation to be completed in May '08, but that did not effect our stay. Only problem was there was a long wait to get a taxi outside of the hotel each night, but it was Valentine's weekend, so that may have been a reason? Would recommend and stay there again!

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my stay. Very helpful and polite staff, excellent facilities and the food in the restaurant is EXCELLENT!! Would definitely go back and highly recommend to others.

review.title: I don't like it
review.reviewText: Very good ubication is the only thing that I like.

review.title: was a perfect stay for a perfect new years!
review.reviewText: PErfect setting for a perfect new years eve celebration!

review.title: hotel made our vacation very enjoyable!
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and comfortable. The location was excellent! We could walk to great restaurants, shopping, and transportation via buses or cable cars. The hotel made our vacation great!

review.title: Best view
review.reviewText: Our room was great! It was close to all transportation, shopping, and coffee shops. Our room looked over the city and out the other window was the bay. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I would stay there again.

review.title: Will stay here next time
review.reviewText: The room comfortable, the towels could have been softer. We were initially given a room that was already occupied but this situation was taken care of efficiently.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel would have all outstanding marks except for the inconvenience of the remodel thery are currently undergoing.

review.title: Too Noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel was undergoing remodeling so it was confusing and hard to find the room. My main problem was a lot of unruly children running around the hallways making a lot of noise. Also, the pool was very cold and pretty much unusable and there were a lot of kids playing and splashing in the jacuzzi. The Courtyard Marriot was much nicer.

review.title: Family oriented. Enjoyed my stay. Will return.
review.reviewText: The room was always well stocked and maintained clean.

review.title: Loction, location, location
review.reviewText: Convenient location --- shopping, restaurants, public transportation all were footsteps away. Room had beautiful view of city and the bay. The hotel staff was pleasant, friendly, and accomodating. Would definately stay there again. For church-goers, St Patricks, Catholic church is located next door to the hotel on the side street of the hotel block. We attended a service there - church is very beautiful and welcoming. The beautiful Yerba Buena Gardens are right next door to the hotel also.

review.title: Not Good Sleeping
review.reviewText: If you like sleeping on the floor, try out this hotel. Booked a room with two beds for four people and got stuck with one bed and a four foot long couch to sleep on.

review.title: Best choice to stay inside the city
review.reviewText: Rooms should be modern

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: The hotel is doing some renovations and it took forever to get an elevator to get to our room. We booked well in advance and requested double beds as we have two children with us. When we got to our room, we had the view that we requested but one bed. We requested a rollaway bed and it never came. We had to go down and re-request. The next morning when we called for our car, we got an answering machine. Hotel looked like a construction site, the service was not good but in the end our room was comfortable and the kids enjoyed the view of the Bay Bridge.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The room was comfortable, the towels could have been softer. We were given a room that was already occupied at first but that mix up was taken care of timely and efficiently. Some construction was going on but didn't really disrupt guests. Great location, close to Union Square and the Bart stop, good restaurants near by.

review.title: Bad Customer Service
review.reviewText: Took over 1 hour waiting in line to pull into valet. We were then told our vehicle would be parked off property, and the staff seemed uninterested in helping to make our stay pleasant. And the bar/lounge was so crowded we were unable to enjoy it throughout our stay.

review.title: SF Marriot
review.reviewText: The Hotel is great. Location is good. Our biggest complaint is about internet access. Much lower priced hotels have free WIFI or DSL available at no cost. This hotel charged $11.00/day. This should be included with the cost of room.

review.title: Very convenient SF location
review.reviewText: Easy to reach (used BART). Good location for Union square/Chinatown/Financial district.

review.title: very impressed
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel extremely easy to get to on the bart system with easy to follow signs from the airport.Cheap fares and comfortable seating and a thirty minute journey. Shopping at a nice market and a wallmart just round the corner from the hotel with many other shops both to browse through and eat in to your hearts delight. The tram system is just across the road and turn left trams at the next block obtain a muni pass for cheapness. Hotel room was very comfortable and a non working hairdryer was replaced within ten minutes. Would definatly recommend this hotel even though they were doing renovation at the front of the hotel and started at 7a.m.

review.title: Couldn't have made a better choice
review.reviewText: Everything was great!

review.title: Excelent Hotel
review.reviewText: Personnel were very nice and hotel was really comfortable and nice. Rooms clean and bed nice. My wife and I really enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Great place to stay. Excellent location for shopping and sightseeing. Will certainly go back.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very comfortable. The rooms were large and the king sized bed was a joy to sleep in. The breakfasts were superb. Overall an excellent place to stay whether on business or pleasure.

review.title: Will go back again
review.reviewText: Very nice and close to main shopping.

review.title: Outstanding Employees
review.reviewText: The hotel and hotel room were great! The hotel staff however, were very curtious, helpful and immediate to respond to a slight problem that I ran into with my television. Kudos to all of the Marriott San Francisco staff! There were staff always at doors to give direction, help with luggage or to answer questions about the city in general.

review.title: SF's Nicest Big Hotel
review.reviewText: Big,clean,convenient to major downtown sites, restaurants, BART and stores. Nice lounge at top and good health club.

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: excellent location - right at Market & 4th, clean and quite room with contemporary decor and HDTV.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: We were extremely happy with our hotel. The room was comfortable and clean, and the housekeeping staff were very thorough and efficient. The staff at the concierge desk were very helpful and friendly and gave us exact directions to a restaurant we had no address for. The pool and workout facilities were great (lots of cardio equipment), though not well ventilated/air conditioned... dress accordingly! The location was fantastic, just steps from market street, powell street station and union square. A great starting point for shoppers or those seeking tourist attractions. On a side note, skip pier 39. Definitely a tourist trap out to milk you... Except for the sealions!

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful and comfortable. The View Lounge was amazing! It was in a great location. Close to public transportation. It was also great having Starbucks right in the hotel!

review.title: If You're going to San Francisco.. It's a great place to stay
review.reviewText: Overall I was very impressed with the San Francisco Marriott. Room was comfortable and kept clean and staff were always friendly and helpful. Location is great, a short walk to Market Street which has a abundance of Streetcars and busses to use to explore the city. Also close to the famous Cable Cars.

review.title: It's not a dry hotel, but....
review.reviewText: This is a fairly good place to stay as Marriotts go. The health club is large and lots of equipment. However, if you're a traveler who likes to bring in a bottle of wine -- beware -- they are very strict about banning outside alcohol from the hotel. However, with the lovely wine bars in walking distance, this is not such a great problem.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Only problem with our hotel was that we were close to the elevator, and sometimes it was noisy!

review.title: I left my heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel and most of all great area to have a relaxing drink at the top floor of the hotel.

review.title: NO
review.reviewText: nice but not what i expected... food sucked..!!!!!!!!!NO GOOD AND VERY EXPENSIVE

review.title: Dude, where's my car?
review.reviewText: They reccommended I use budget to rent a car, needles today, the budget service was horrible and we ended up parking the car overnite in a garage, which costed me $30. Anyhow, Marriott stepped in and gave my wife and I a free cab ride (a value of $45) to SFO at no charge, they were great! I will definitely use them again whenever i travel to San Fran, and I have family there!!

review.title: Good hotel in great position!
review.reviewText: Good Hotel with great views from the top floor bar. Great location with the tram running to Fishermans wharf about 50 yards away!

review.title: Superb Hotel
review.reviewText: This was a superb hotel in a great location for shopping and close to the cable cars for easy access to fishermans warf. There is a lovely bar on the top floor with excellent views of San Francisco. THe hotel has a nice pool that never seemed busy and also has a spa which is great for relaxing them tired muscles after a hard day. The staff could have been better they were always helpfull but i sometimes got the impression they were a bit snotty. The hotel room was spotless and a nice size aimed mainly at the business traveler. Be ware of the tray with the chocolates etc on, they look tempting but if u even knock them by accident you automatically get charged! I was a bit suprised to find that a hotel like the Marriott only supplied paper cups for the tea and coffee in the room, im sure they can afford to splash out on some proper cups. The Marriott San Francisco is a great hotel that I would recommended to tourists and business travelers alike and you can get some great deals on room rates.

review.title: Cleanliness
review.reviewText: The bathroom could have been cleaner when we arrived - hair on the floor and on one of the towels - still very happy wth the hotel, but this was not a good start - every other day of the 4 day stay was fine

review.title: Just as expected
review.reviewText: The Marriott San Francisco was just about what I expected -- a very comfortable place in the heart of town. The rooms feature comfortable beds, HD televisions, fast internet connection (for $12.95/day) and a good sized bathroom. There's a big fitness center and pool -- perfect for a morning or late afternoon workout. I wasn't crazy about the place the concierge recommended -- I asked for a comfortable place where I could go to sit at the bar and get a bite and she sent me down the street to some huge sports bar. After sitting for a few minutes and being totally ignored, I got up and left and went looking for a place on my own. I ended up at Puccini & Pinetti. Sat at the bar right in front of the kitchen and had a good time watching the cooks work their magic. Their spaghetti and meatballs were great.

review.title: Incredible hotel in the perfect spot
review.reviewText: We were really impressed with the spacious room, friendly staff, and great buffet in the morning. We stayed for 1 week and would have stayed longer. The location was ideal and a close walk to all the hot spots in San Fransisco.

review.title: It was wonderful
review.reviewText: It was a beautiful hotel. The view is really only of the city, but you are out from sun up to sun set any so it doesn't really matter. The beds were comfortable and the service was great.

review.title: In the Heart of the City!
review.reviewText: Recommendations for food and fun were excellent! Everything was well within walking distant.

review.title: very good
review.reviewText: too bad the Hotel did not provide free parking.

review.title: Very large hotel & very nice
review.reviewText: Location is very nice -- just a few blocks from Union Square (and a safe walk). Hotel registration area being renovated but staff was very helpful in directing people where to go. Rooms were very large (a nice surprise). Parking fee of $50 was too high -- but I guess to be expected in large city. We rode the "electric" tram to Fisherman's Wharf -- quicker than the cable cars and not a long line to wait in. Great trip and great hotel.

review.title: Not really a 4 star hotel but nice....
review.reviewText: The best part of the hotel was the location. Beyond that, the hotel was really just mediocre. The bed was too soft and therefore not very comfortable for us; the bathroom was old and could use a face lift; the prices for food were atrocious! We were told that the refreshment tray in our room was more of a "you touch it you pay for it" kind - whether you actually consumed it or not so we asked them to remove the snacks from our room since we had our 6 year old son with us. They removed the snacks and returned them the next day. The bedside lamp wouldn't work and the air vent made scary noises (for our son) every time we turned it on. So if you want a location hotel - this is teh one for you, if not, find a real 4 star hotel.

review.title: Excellent service
review.reviewText: We had a great time at Mariott San Francisco. WIll definitely come back.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay. Conveniently located.

review.title: Great Location, Great Service
review.reviewText: Convenient to everything and everything handled extremely well. didn't eat there so can't comment on that category

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Central, but must be ready to take public transit to go to the Piers.

review.title: Great Location; Don't Rent a Car!
review.reviewText: This hotel has an ideal location. If you stay here, you will do yourself a huge favor because you will save yourself a ton of time. It is within walking distance of the Ferry Building, Lombard Street, and Pier 39. Tip 1: If you stay here, don't rent a car! If you rent from the hotel's Hertz, they will tack on a hidden valet fee. If you *park* at the hotel, you will pay dearly. Buyer beware - Check out these fees in advance. Of course, if you're not interested in driving to Big Sur, Carmel, Santa Cruz, or San Jose, don't even bother renting a car in the first place. You can reach everything else by either foot, public transportation, or guided tour. Tip 2: If you stay here, you don't need to pay for an airport shuttle, because you can take the BART from SFO to the Powell Street stop and walk several hundred feet to the hotel. P.S. This hotel should upgrade their pillows! My wife and I had sore necks!

review.title: Good, solid hotel in the downtown area.
review.reviewText: The room we reserved was the one we received and was ready ahead of time. Basic room, but clean and well-maintained. Hotel service was good--very friendly personnel. The area around the hotel can be a little sketchy in the evening hours. However, the hotel is within easy walking distance to a variety of shopping areas, restaurants and movie theaters.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Marriott during the All-Star game. It was really busy inside the hotel, but the staff was very friendly and made us feel comfortable. When we reached our room, we were pleasantly surprised by it's size. It was very roomy compared to many of the other hotels that we have stayed at in SF. It was equipped with a separate lounging area and had a large bar area. It is near everything, the shopping center and movie theater is just a walk across the street. Union Square is just a short walk from the hotel too. We actually walked to the ballpark because it was only a short mile away. All in all, it was a great place to stay at an affordable rate.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: feathers under bed; no refrigerator; poor reception on tv; breakfast buffet high priced and mediocre

review.title: Very Satisfied - No Complaints
review.reviewText: The hotel was prepared for our arrival and provided very comfortable accomodations. Staff was friendly, courteous, and helpful. Checkout was a breeze. Location downtown met our needs very well, even though some of our events were elsewhere in the city. Public tranportation was ample and easy to use. If there is another trip to San Francisco, we will attempt to use the same accomodations.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely. Make sure you have a drink in the View Lounge, awesome view!!! The Westfield Mall is a very close walk, if you don't mind the homeless people panhandling. I definetly would't go walking alone. But, the hotel has everything you need, rental car counter, currency exchange, luggage storage, it was nice.

review.title: Need to be a techy to use free wifi connection
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel right in the busy part of downtown SF. Close to shopping, restaurants and public transit. Rooms are large and clean. Be careful with the snackbar, the snacks sit on an electronic tray, even a slight movement causes a charge to register on your bill. The snacks are exhorbitantly priced so we had no intention of buying any (there's a Walgreens 5 mins walk from the door) so you can imagine our bewilderment when we saw $50 total charged to both the rooms we had. When we called they said they would send an auditor who never showed up, but they did reverse the charges. The fancy Sony room alarm clocks are complicated to set up, first time I set it for 6am, it went off at midnight. Just ask for a wake up call. But all in all, a very nice hotel, I would stay there again. Don't forget to go to the top floor (39th) to check out the breathtaking view.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Very helpful staff. Very convenient to shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent location, the bed is very comfortable and the room is clean.

review.title: Excellent Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: The Marriott was wonderful...clean, excellent customer support, the bed was absolutely comfortable (feather filled comforters)...close to Union Square and other tourist sights, close to several bus lines if you don't want to drive, in walking distance of several restaurants. I would most definately stay here again. The only down side is that Downtown San Francisco can be a bit seedy at times (especially at night) and the streets smell like a mix of urine & sewer. But the hotel itself is absolutely wonderly!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel

review.title: SF-Marriott
review.reviewText: Good location, comfortable bed, go to The View Lounge!!

review.title: Too expensive
review.reviewText: The Marriott nickels and dimes you. There's no free wireless and parking costs $50/night. You'd think with the prices they charge for the rooms they'd at least offer free wireless in their Atrium, but that costs around $2.50 every 15 minutes. We had to move our car every night to look for cheaper parking lots in the city. And even the cheapest, skankiest motels in San Francisco offer free wireless.

review.title: Definetly will return, a must.
review.reviewText: I did my research before selecting this hotel and the reviews were correct. I think it was an excellent location, close to bart station, cable car and great local restaurants like Mel's drive in. Staff was great, room was clean and I will return. Highly recommended.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is very convenient to dining,shopping and transportation.It is a busy hotel.If you are sensitive to noise,you do not hear the next room but you can hear the walking above you if the people above have heavy feet! But it is not that bad.Overall,a good hotel.

review.title: Absolutely Fabulous!
review.reviewText: We arrived from Canada at 11:00am on a Friday and our room was ready! Check-in was effortless and the clerk was very informative about the local amenities. The beds were like floating on clouds with down pillowtop mattresses and pillows. Very spacious bathroom with loads of towels. The View Lounge on the 39th floor was eclectic with top notch appetizers and vast selection of wines and cocktails while jazz floated thru the sound system...and the view was breathtaking!! The Terrace dining room service was excellent and the food wonderful. We will be back and tell all our friends!!!

review.title: Beautiful place
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel, very nice, clean, great staff, close to everything. We travel with two teenages, and the love the place because the room was large enough, they close the street to go the the Metrodeon center, a few blocks we found a Borders and spend time there, many restaurants around. Its was easy to take the cable car or bus from there. We really enjoyed and dream to go back soon.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful rooms with big comfy beds. All staff were extremely helpful.The view from the 39th floor is spectacular.

review.title: One of our best hotel experiences
review.reviewText: Not a single complaint. Concierge staff was outstanding. Public transportation to anywhere within 2 blocks. Great shopping within the surrounding 5 block area.

review.title: San Fran's Best Hotel In a great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was unbelievably clean and all the employees were very cordial and helpful. This was one of me best stays in any hotel all over the world. I will recommend it to every one. Close to everything and wonderful atmosphere.

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Everything was wonderful- would go again

review.title: Comfortable and very well located
review.reviewText: The Marriott San Francisco has an excellent location on 4th street, which is one block away from Market St. and about 4 blocks from Union Square. The hotel and the rooms are comfortable and kids friendly. The personnel is nice and service oriented. Food at the main restaurant is good and breakfasts are excellent. I recommend it and I'd go back when in San Francisco.

review.title: Good location, modern amenities
review.reviewText: The Hotel is very modern and has all the amenities you could need. The rooms are spacious and come with all the technology you need for internet, HD TV, Gaming and using your MP3 though the TV sound. Rooms were clean and the housekeeping staff were friendly. The heart of the best shopping in SF is all around the hotel. There are pleanty of good restaurants all around the local area within a 10 minute walk.

review.title: Will definitely stay there again!
review.reviewText: Hotel was in a great location. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly, especially in assisting us with directions. I would definitely stay at this hotel on my next visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Excellent quality and service
review.reviewText: The rooms and the service were excellent.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Great location!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Walking distance to Union Square, cable cars, and other public transportation.

review.title: Love the comfortable beds
review.reviewText: Call the valet in advance you could wait more than 15 minutes.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Went for the memorial day weekend. A beautiful, clean and well located hotel. Comfortable pillow-topped beds and a large flat screen plasma TV was great. Concierge was very helpful in planning day walking trips. Overall we would highly suggest to others. Close to local attractions, shopping and dining.

review.title: Loved it
review.reviewText: Great place, great room, me and the wife loved it. Walking distance from Union Square. Only negative was neighorhood at night, I felt safe walking with my wife and infant son but I had to keep an eye on questionable characters.

review.title: Good Value for SF
review.reviewText: this hotel is close to Union Square for shopping and is av ery good value. It is 1000 room hotel but it does not seem like that. Staff is very helpful.

review.title: Great hotel, convenient location
