review.reviewText: The hotel is really nice and close to everything. Public transportation is pretty good, shopping is close by, walk about anywhere downtown in little time--we walked to the wharf in about 30 mins. just to see the city, and took a cable car the other time. The Marriott king beds are fantastic! We had 2 flat panel TV's and a mini fridge in our suite, all for a very reasonable price.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: This was one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in. Room was beautiful and very clean. Really liked the plasma screen TV. Hotel staff and concierge very friendly and helpful. LOVED having Starbucks in the lobby. Excellent location for catching public transportation. Felt very safe walking around Union Square area.I am usually very picky about our hotel accommodations, and can't find anything to complain about with this hotel. Will definitely stay here again on our next trip to San Francisco!

review.title: will stay in same hotel next time.
review.reviewText: I like this hotel and my kid likes it too. We like the location, the view, the indoor swimming pool...

review.title: great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Very pleased. I would stay there again

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Nothing bad to say-great location

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was not only a great hotel, but it was in the perfect location! In walking distance of the Metreon and Union Square, the Mariott was the perfect place to stay for a night in San Francisco. The room was large and clean and the service was amazing. I would strongly recommend this hotel. Make sure you check out the view from the top floor!

review.title: Downtown Mariott SF
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location, close to shopping and other downtown activities, short walk to china town and on to North Beach. Great hotel, nice room with plasma HD tv also!

review.title: Employees were all friendly & helpful.
review.reviewText: We did not feel safe walking late at night in the area.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the middle of Union Square and a walk away from the Cable Cars Main station. The room is much larger than expected (compared to boutique hotels) and the indoor pool is a plus. Must go to the top to see The View Bar/Restaurant. It's also a walk away from the Westfield Mall and all the good restaurants. The staff is very friendly and helpful (front desk, concierge, and parking attendants). We definitely will return to the Marriott San Francisco.

review.title: The concierge level of room was wonderful, especially when traveling with children.
review.reviewText: My only complaint was there was no fan in the bathroom.

review.title: Wonderful!
review.reviewText: The location was perfect, right off of market street so that we could take public transportation (including the cable cars) to all of our destinations. The service at the hotel was superb, everyone was wonderful to us. Rooms were comfortable and spacious. The health club was great, all new equipment, pool was clean and there were steamrooms and sauna'a for only a $5.00 fee. My only complaint was the Internet access. There is no wireless in the room and the ethernet plan is $13.00 per day from 12:00 - 12:00, no flexibility. Thus if you sign on at 11:30, it is only good for 1/2 hour.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a good location. Close to Union Square, the cable cars, the Giants ballpark, and more. We'd stay there again.

review.title: Satisfied stay!
review.reviewText: Only complaint about our stay here was some construction noise which seemed to be coming from the floor above ours one morning. But the staff were exceptionally courteous and quick in helping us, and otherwise in all other areas we were very satisfied. Lots of convention attendees everywhere, the hotel has a brisk "business" feel to it. There's an amazing glass-enclosed cocktail lounge on the 39th floor - it was a little chilly up there (bring a sweater!) but what a beautiful place to watch the sunset or the city lights at night; unforgettable views! Our first stay at a Marriott and it was very pleasant.

review.title: Excellent location in the heart of union square
review.reviewText: Extremely good value, excellent location

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The location was terrific. We easily get anywhere. Staff was extremely helpful. No complaints but I did expect more luxury in the room from a 4 star hotel.

review.title: This was a great experience, Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: This is the 5th time i have stayed at Marriott San Francisco. Excellent front desk and room service staff, very helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel is located close to shopping, clubs, great restaurants. Walking distance to china town, and other great locations. Over all you will be in for a great experience.

review.title: nice place
review.reviewText: we stayed for 3 nights and we loved it, the hotel is very close to all the shopping areas and very good location to bart, troley and etc. This place is across Metreon and there is a big parking garage across the street as well. Bloomingdales is just about five mins walk or less. All in all, I wouldn't mind coming back to this hotel again, nice and clean and people are nice.

review.title: Great Centrally located hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel has a beautiful entrance way and it is centrally located--right off Market Street-making it accessible to shops, and various public transportation.

review.title: Marriott Hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice hotel but the staff is not overly freindly. The work-out area is small and tremendously crowded (even at odd hours). Very busy and very expensive.

review.title: We would go back
review.reviewText: Everything was lovely. Only I wished that I had brought my own pillow. The bed was beautiffuly laid out, however the pillows were too high. So, my husband and I did nit sleep comfortably on the pillows. The view from the Lounge was spectacular. And the hotel's location was perfect for shopping downtown. We would return.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed for four nights in December 2006. We enjoyed this hotel very much. It is in a great location for shopping, dining and the BART (one block) and the cable cars (2 blocks). Taxis are always around if you are looking for one. The food at the hotel is good. No minibar or in room coffee maker but that is ok. The only complaint is the toilet paper was so hard to get off the roll...and if that is all there is to complain about....you MUST go to the View Lounge on the 39th floor...the views are spectacular. We highly recommend and would definately go back.

review.title: Very nice hotel with comfortable beds
review.reviewText: This was a very nice hotel that caters mostly to the business traveler but would be a nice place for couples on vacation. Although the hotel is large, the rooms were very quiet and nice. The beds were very comfortable. I ordered room service for breakfast which was good but expensive.

review.title: cant wait to go back!
review.reviewText: The hotel service was excellent. they were kind and understanding. they helped us with a map of places to do in san fran and where to eat! the room was abit small, but the comfort of the bed and pillows was excellent. the room was very clean, modern, and luxurious too. definitely, i would go back. the location is perfect! it is close to everything! it was nice to return to the hotel after a long day of shopping.

review.title: Shopping Convenience
review.reviewText: I stay at the San Francisco Marriot during our San Francisco weekend shopping trip. Its location is walking-distance from Union Square shopping, yet also very close to freeway access so that we can also shop outside of the city. The only drawback is that the overnight parking is expensive.

review.title: Great Holiday Getaway
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for a little in-town holiday and greatly enjoyed the experience. The room was large, the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. The bathroom was large and the shower had a great stream. The temperature in the room could be easily controlled. Could not hear my neighbors at all. The staff was very friendly, the food was excellent. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Will stay there again, good for the price
review.reviewText: We selected this hotel as part of a Vacation Package looking for overall savings. The Hotel is in a Premium Location. About 2 blocks from the BART, Cable Cars and Bus Stops. Within Walking distance from 2 shopping Malls, and all of the Mayor Department Stores. Very limited parking space on the streets(meter), Parking Lots prices are very high. I recomend using the cable cars and the bus for moving to and from Chinatown, North Beach, Fishersman's Warf and the Embarcadero.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The Marriott is well located near lots of shopping, a cable car station, and plenty of food options. The staff were all very courteous, the room was well appointed and quiet, and the upstairs lounge has a great view of the city.

review.title: A very nice stay
review.reviewText: I travel often for business and this was a great place to stay. The hotel rooms were very clean and a really nice modern style to them. You have to go to the top floor to have a drink in the bar at night. It has awesome views of SF. You are three blocks(walking distance) to some great shopping stores. Also, right by the shopping stores is the cable cars. I took it all the way to the Fisherman's Wharf. Great places to eat and shop. It costs $5 each way on the cable car. The only bad thing to say about this hotel was the parking fee is around $40. That fee is way too high. If you are coming in for business, then take a cab. I will stay at this hotel in the future.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Not too impressed with hotel, but great location. Central to all transportation. Easy to get to from BART. Very close to Cable Car access and F-Line Trolley.

review.title: will definitely go back
review.reviewText: i arrived early and was able to check right in. the room was clean. the bed was super comfortable. the bathroom was beautiful. it was nice and quiet. it's in a great location, next to the new westfield mall center and nordstroms, across from yerba buena gardens, and around the corner for the museum of modern art.

review.title: Loved it! I would stay there again!
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly. The hotel lobby is very nice and well taken care of. The room itself was clean. The bathroom was also very clean and pretty. The location was great. It was walking distance from Union Square and all the stores/shops on Market (ie- Nordstrom and the new Bloomingdales).

review.title: The location was perfect!
review.reviewText: The hotel was a plus right off the bat due to its great location in the heart of downtown. We were able to hop the Bart, the Rail line and grab a quick taxi to anywhere. No complaints except we never received our wake up call.

review.title: Close to shopping
review.reviewText: This hotel is so close to all the shopping. We didn't need our car to get around.

review.title: Well satisfied
review.reviewText: I was at this hotel with 15 relatives and and 5 rooms. Everything met my expectations. The concierge desk was extremely helpful with all of our questions. We did not rent a vehicle - you can get around the city using the transit system. Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: great hotel and location
review.reviewText: Great rooms & awesome beds. Perfect location downtown San Francisco

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: This is another example of a big city Marriott hotel. The grand reception room is inviting, the shopping areas beautifully set, and the rooms spacious and immaculate. The experience enhanced my stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Just as nice as the pictures
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay. Employees were friendly and helpful. After we checked out we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel until late afternoon.

review.title: This is the ideal place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I found the location, service, cleanliness, and the friendliness of the staff just perfect.

review.title: Very comfortable - good service
review.reviewText: We arrived early - around 10am, hoping to be able to leave our bags, but were given access to our room straight away, a big plus. We complained about the cooked food being cold at breakfast - the restaurant manager came and apologised, gave us a discount (we didnt want food replaced, ) abd assured us that all the cooked food was being replaced. Nice room, very handy location. We ate at the most enjoyable Lulus.

review.title: Great Hotel, Bad Parking
review.reviewText: I was completely satisfied with every aspect of the hotel EXCEPT the parking situation. Perhaps I missed it in the details, but I was surprised to find ONLY vallet parking at the Marriott with a stiff per-day fee. My only other choice was to circle the jamp-packed streets of San Francisco and park somewhere else (good luck with that!). Not a huge inconvenience, but it could be an issue for someone on limited funds.

review.title: Absolutely Wonderful!!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great. Fantastic location and friendly and helpful staff. Great pool and fitness center.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful, location was good and rooms were good size as well as clean. Would stay here again if I ever make it back.

review.title: Beautiful downtown hotel
review.reviewText: This is an extremely beautiful hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco. The hotel was gracious enough to allow us to check in early, as we arrived early in the day. Everyone was gracious and very helpful. We would recommend this hotel to everyone!

review.title: Can't wait to return
review.reviewText: The Hotel employees were very pleasant. My husband and I arrived early in the morning and the hotel was very accomodating and allowed us check in early. If you prefer the size of the room over a view, then kick the view and go for more space! The view in The Lounge on the 39th floor is spctacular...especially at night.

review.title: Good location, excellent bed
review.reviewText: The hotel is located right on Market St, easy access to the subway, cable cars and buses. Union Square is the best shopping location, also an easy walk to Chinatown. The hotel has a nice top bar with a beautiful city view. The bed was excellent!!

review.title: Not a bad place to stay.
review.reviewText: Fast service. Friendly personnel. The location is a dream for shoppers.

review.title: Nice stay in San Fran
review.reviewText: The Marriott was a great place to stay, central to Union Square, Chinatown and downtown. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Would recommend the hotel.

review.title: none
review.reviewText: none

review.title: Best bed ever in a hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: It was a very beautiful hotel and was near alot of shopping that made me happy!

review.title: We would stay at this hotel again!
review.reviewText: I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was a great surprise. We usually stay in Union Square but now I will make sure to consider this hotel in the future. The service was very good & the rooms were spacious & clean. The rate was very reasonable for the area. I only had 1 criticism. We went for my Mothers birthday & I had called a week ahead of time to see if they could do anything special & what the cost would be (like flowers in her room when we arrived, or a cake) but they were too expensive for what they offered. Other than that it was wonderful!

review.title: Favorite San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: I love the Marriott San Francisco. It has a great central location with lovely rooms and excellent service.

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: After my family and I checked out of the hotel, we still had the whole day before we had to go to the airport. So we asked if the Merriott can hold our bags for us while we went out to town. Without hesitating they gladly took our bags and assured our bags would be take care of. Great service would recommend to anyone.

review.title: Absolutely impressed!
review.reviewText: I am so impressed with the quality of customer service this hotel offered during our stay, not to mention the hotel's perfect location. Rooms are very clean, bed is comfortable. Highly recommended place to stay in San Francisco. We took a shuttle from the airport, BART station is just a few strides away from the hotel. Absolutely worth it!

review.title: Will stay in this hotel again
review.reviewText: Both my husband and I enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The hotel is close to all public transportation and shopping can be done just by crossing Market. We were worried that our room would be too small given the special rate we got from Expedia. But it was nice and comfortable and the bedding was heavenly. We did not get any city or ocean view from the room, but who cares when you can get that by taking the F streetcar to the Piers? The only complaint we have is the sound proof system in the hotel. You can hear the water pipes running from the bathroom next door whenever someone takes a shower. Room service was good. Breakfast was a little too pricey. There was no Sunday buffet, which was a major disappointment.

review.title: Marriott San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was probably one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The concierge were extremely helpful in finding anything we needed, the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever stayed in and the hotel is beautiful! I would definitely recommend anybody I know to choose this hotel!

review.title: Very nice hotel, especially with the discount
review.reviewText: Our room was extremely comfortable and clean, and hotel staff was very friendly. It was part of a flight+hotel package and also an Expedia special rate, so it was the same price as a lot of the two star hotels. Great experience.

review.title: Friendly Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I are not from SF so we really didn't know our way around the area. Every person that worked for the hotel that we asked for directions or where to eat helped us or found someone who could. We really enjoyed our stay even though we were there for business. Thank you very much for going above and beyond when it came to customer service.

review.title: Mixed experience
review.reviewText: My husband, my two children and I checked in, only to be told that the two-bedroom room we had requested was not available, nor did they have any rollaway beds. We were given instead a room with a king bed and a couch and a voucher for $50 in food in their hotel. Our daughter had to push two lounge chairs together to sleep, and the $50 didn't even cover breakfast in this quite pricey place. They said at check in that extra blankets and pillows would be sent up, but we had to call again and request them. The room was nice, though, as was the hotel.

review.title: loved the sky loung. loved hotel.
review.reviewText: i thought it was really cool that my teenage daughters were able to have a vergin drink with me in the ski loung. rooms were vary comfortable. last the walk to the ball park was vary plesent. go giants!!!!!

review.title: Overpriced for the Service
review.reviewText: When I consider the high cost of staying at this hotel, the overall experience was unacceptable. We had a total of 3 different rooms in 3 nights. While the last 2 nights were fairly comfortable, the first night was a nightmare. We were exhausted and unable to focus well the next day while conducting our business. I would seriously consider other alternatives before spending this much money at this hotel again.

review.title: Impressed!
review.reviewText: Close to Bart. Very clean rooms and comfortable beds. Beautiful lobby.

review.title: Great hotel for shopping
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a good location for shopping but is a short cab ride to pier 39 activities. The staff was not great, just average. The service was more in tune with that of a 2 or 3 star hotel. The beds are very soft and comfortable. The room was clean and large.

review.title: Geat location, beautiful hotel, but...
review.reviewText: While sitting in the hotel bar last Monday night, something caught our eye. It was a mouse, running across the room! When the waitress came over to cash out, we started to say something to her and she finished our sentence about the mouse. Obviously, it's been there for a while and no one is doing anything about it. When she left our table and I took a handful of snackmix and it included the stem of a cherry, that did it! We were out of there, not to return.On a more positive side, our checkin was handled by quite possibly the nicest man in the whole world.

review.title: Nice time
review.reviewText: Very pleasant people at the front office who provided us lot of information on the main things to do and to see. The swimig pool should have a rule of procedure to go to swim as: - No shoes, shower before swim...Could be more clean.

review.title: Just fine
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel, though the lobby is a little noisy. they miss on a few unimportnat items like no automatic door openers, no refrigerator or coffee maker in the room (though they will put them in if you ask.) The exercise facility is nice, but they charge for the steam room (and don't tell you until you are there). they charge for internet, which a 4 star hotel should not do. they should also provide breakfast.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: I would stay there again! The room was very clean and was well supplied with bath towels. The staff was helpful and professional. We were able to pick-up our rental car right on site and return it at the same location with incident. It would have been nice to had a refigerate in our room.

review.title: Consistent Quality
review.reviewText: Downtown hotel close to Cable Car, BART and numerous restaurants and shopping. Staff was extremely helpful and enhanced quality of stay. 39th floor glass enclosed bar was a favorite wind-down every afternoon. Would definitely recommend for business or leisure.

review.title: exellent location, best hotel
review.reviewText: exellent hotel at downtown , best value for the money, very good for families.

review.title: Thanks
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel for our honeymoon trip. Both of us are extremely satisfied with the hotel, staff and our room. Thank you for making this quality hotel an affordable option.

review.title: Really liked it
review.reviewText: This hotel was really nice. The staff was very courteous. It is centrally located. Great for kids because it is across the street from the Metreon which has video games, movies, etc. I would stay there again.

review.title: Just Right
review.reviewText: We visited San Francisco for our anniversary and decided on the Marriott. I was quite impressed with the size of the room and the cleanliness. The beds were wonderful and the comfort level was awesome. The room service food was very tasty but of course too expensive. The maid service was very timely and we enjoyed our stay very much. The only negatives were the gentleman who checked us in had no personality and was not very polite. I hope he was just having a bad day. we really did'nt deal with any of the other staff to rate them. I would go back again and do reccomend staying at the Marriott San Francisco.

review.title: Love San Francisco
review.reviewText: First time to San Francisco. The hotel was well located for what we wanted to do. Room was clean and comfortable. Don't be afraid to get out and walk around. San Fran seems to have a lot of beggars, but they didn't bother anyone.

review.title: Outstanding City Center
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel and their response to our stay. We were celebrating 24 years of military service and retirement from the Air Force. We arrived at 330 in the morning and the desk clerk gave us a great room that made our five day stay worht remembering.

review.title: Consistent Marriot
review.reviewText: As with all Marriots, they've got the formula figured out. The room was great, the service just fine. And the location was terrific. I will happily stay there again.

review.title: Central Location, close to shopping
review.reviewText: Everything you need is within walking distance of the hotel.

review.title: Extremely Pleased
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located a block away from the Powell station so you can take the BART from the airport, which is very economical. The staff were very friendly, the hotel lobby looked amazing, the room was very well kept and the housekeeping staff did a great job, the bed and pillows were very comfortable. I would also recommend a high floor for a better view. I will definitely use the same hotel next time.

review.title: Great location, average hotel
review.reviewText: Great location downtown and very close to the Bart and a ton of great shops. The beds are comfortable and the rooms are quiet, but the hallways smelled almost like chlorine and there are no coffeemakers in the rooms. Also, there is a $5 charge to use the locker room steam room which they don't tell you until you get down there, and the pool was full of kids at 9 pm. I would say the hotel rates about 3.5 stars, not 4.

review.title: Just what you thought you'd get at a Marriott
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, big rooms. Convenient to shopping district in town. I was happy with the accommodations; it's a safe bet for business travelers.

review.title: Great Location to explore San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel is beautiful, excellent facilities at the property and a convenient location to explore San Fran. Extremely close to fabulous shopping at Union Square and a short cab ride or trolly ride to the Wharf. Our room was small, did not have a fridge or safe but was clean and the beds were comfortable; we were only in it to sleep. No view except for another wall of windows in the hotel and an old church at which the bells tolled every hour! Car rental desk at the hotel is very convenient for those day trips up or down the coast.

review.title: San Frans Personal Touch Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband took me to San Francisco as a birthday surprise. We stayed at the Downtown Marriott Hotel, which was convenient to everything...the Wharf, Chinatown, etc. We were treated with the utmost courtesy from the moment that we arrived. Especially by the young lady from Room Service who delivered our lunch. Not only was she efficient and friendly, when she found out that we were there for my birthday, she brought a beautiful dessert plate of cheese cake and fruit with Happy Birthday written in chocolate. This was definitely a personal and thoughtful touch that you just won't find at many hotels and it was very much appreciated. I would certainly like to visit San Fran again in the near future and we already have our hotel picked out.

review.title: Super helpful staff!
review.reviewText: This hotel is remarkably clean and comfortable with all the extras you expect from a fine hotel. The health club and pool were fabulous, and the concierge service was the most helpful we have encountered. We appreciated how quiet it was at night. Location is conducive to shopping, sightseeing and dining.

review.title: Nice Hotel - Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice - the room a little bit small. Service expected of a Marriott. Great location - very convenient to all the shops. Good walking distance to everything downtown.

review.title: Just wonderful!
review.reviewText: Stayed in San Francisco for the Christmas holidays-superb hotel, so genuinely friendly. What a lovely welcome from start to finish by all staff. Very clean! We asked for a high room and got it! What a view.

review.title: Great Hotel, Great Location!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Marriott for 5 days over this past Christmas holiday. The cleanliness of the hotel was superior, the staff were excellent and we enjoyed ourselves thoroughly. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed the stay. Excellent hotel and good location. Beware the parking though: $45 per night, so find your own lot.

review.title: loved it...
review.reviewText: oNly complaint was the size of room, but it was adequate and beds comfy

review.title: Impressive hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location within walking distance of multiple attractions including shopping, restaurants, Union Square and the Convention Center. Everyone at the hotel was there to help you. The hotel itself is very exciting--always something going on--restaurants always available--a great place to stay.

review.title: Great but not Excellent
review.reviewText: This hotel was a comforable walking distance to downtown but when we started venturing out to explore, we noticed other hotels we might want to try next time. You do a lot of walking in San Francisco so after a long day, it would have been more convenient to be in a hotel just off the trolley or just around the corner from the fantastic shops. This hotel is still a pretty close walk to everything but after a long day, saving your feet from walking an extra 4-5 blocks might be worth looking into- at least that is what we will look for the next time we plan a trip to San Francisco. Other than that, we thought the lobby was impressive, the concierge very helpful, and the tour service in the lobby very helpful. And we were very impressed with the 2nd floor restaurant. We thought the food there was excellent. The hotel was pretty clean but I wasn't all that impressed with the bed and I thought the bath towels felt rough and thin, but who knows, maybe I was just used to my own fluffy ones.

review.title: Looks like we found our new SanFran favorite
review.reviewText: Having previously stayed across the street and paid nearly the same price for a room 1/4 the size with 1/10 the services, let me save you some heartache and recommend this hotel. The rooms are huge, clean and all the amenities one needs are readily available. The location is superb; within walking distance to many shops and attractions. The restaurant on the 2nd floor served an excellent lunch and at a reasonable price. The staff was friendly and ready to help whenever we glanced in their direction. Yes... I will be back.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!!
review.reviewText: Fantastic hotel. Excellent location!! Can't wait to go back to SF and will definetly stay at the Marriott again.

review.title: Great Time @ SF Marriott
review.reviewText: My wife & I stayed here on our honeymoon in 1990, right after it opened. We went back for our 15th anniversary and had a great time. It's in a great location, we walked to the theaters, walked through Chinatown, etc.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Great location, clean, good service.

review.title: Long walk to room
review.reviewText: Make sure to get a bellman, we had a very long walk to our room.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Perfect location, excellent service and wonderful beds!!

review.title: will definitely go back
review.reviewText: The hotel location is great. There is so much to do just within walking distance. It was fun taking the cable car to Chinatown and Fishman's wharf. The rooms were clean. The lobby is nice. The coffee cart in the lobby has the best pastries for a simple breakfast on the run.

review.title: Large rooms, good location
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice with great staff and other amenities. If there is a downside, there is no parking other than valet, which was $45.00 per night! Yes, you read it correctly....$45.00 per night. Or....you could park at the garage across the street for a mere $22.00 per night. We opted for this, and it worked out just fine. Biggest problem with staying in downtown San Francisco is the parking. Otherwise, the Marriott was fabulous!

review.title: Convenient and comfortable
review.reviewText: Located in Union Square - walking distance to great shopping, Chinatown and North Beach. Although the hotel is huge, there is never a wait for an elevator. Excellent concierge services and a nice gym with steam, lockers, towels. Rooms are nice size, clean, comfortable beds, high speed internet. We stay there a few times a year.

review.title: Hotel Update
review.reviewText: This is the only Marriott we have stayed in that didn't have in room coffee.  I was told at the front desk that the Union didn't allow it.  Pretty lame excuse.

review.title: Nicely appointed, hard to get in and out of by car, room small
review.reviewText:
First time staying at this Marriott for my wife and I. 
Positives: Room very nicely appointed with good working desk and good mattress.  Shower good.  Very nice view across the Moscone Center toward the Bay Bridge from the 16th floor.  Window opened a short amount to let in fresh air.  Car parking was expensive but the car was promptly retrieved by the valet.  We were picking up and dropping off family from various locations so needed a car.Very convenient to the Moscone Center, Union Square, and  Mus. of Modern Art.
Less Than Positives:  Room was very narrow; there was just enough room for one person to pass between the bed and the desk.  Lobby sucked in cigarette smoke from the smokers congregating outside the entry doors.  Hotel is relatively difficult to get to by car except from the Bay Bridge due to 1-way streets and construction on Mission.  Parking costs are high ($43+/day including taxes).   There is a parking garage across the street with lower rates, but  in downtown SF, parking is costly and street parking nearly impossible to find.  Breakfast was nicely presented but expensive at more than $15 for eggs and toast.
Overall:  For a single business traveler without a car this is a fine place to stay.  The combination room rate, airfare, and car rental through Expedia made this an easy choice for us for this trip.

review.title: An excellent staff with a nice environment
review.reviewText: Your staff was extremely cooperative and helpful and the environment was quite nice.  However, there were two negatives:  no coffee in the rooms and I thought the swimming pool area was a disappointment.

review.title: great location, very comfortable hotel
review.reviewText: the hotel is very centrally located, close to union square and public transportation.  the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the service prompt and courteous.  will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Very good pick in SF
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay in san francisco, also a superb piece of architecture. Good location, high standart concierge service. I highly recommend to take a cocktail at "The view", that s the bar at the top of the hotel...

review.title: I left my heart at Haight and Ashbury
review.reviewText: I hadn't been to San Francisco since my husband and I dated. 25 years later with my 22 year old daughter, we returned...and had a blast!!!  It was the girls trip away.  The hotel location was great.  All the shopping we could do was within walking distance.  We took the bus down to Haight and Ashbury and it only took 15 minutes.  The only negative about the trip was...having to leave.  Can't wait to get back...this time it won't be 25 years.

review.title: Impressive location, In the heart of Downtown San Francisco. I'll go back for sure with my friends.
review.reviewText: Excellent location, service was great!close to all shopping areas.

review.title: very good location in the city
review.reviewText: The hotel in being redecorated, in an old building but very well maintained.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, modern, and located in a great part of San Francisco

review.title: most comfortable bed
review.reviewText:
Great bed ...king size with high thread count sheets!
Mattress was of great quality - perhaps a latex bed?

review.title: Top notch & Great location
review.reviewText: Classy hotel. Had to be the best location in downtown San Francisco. Will stay there next time I visit.

review.title: Best location
review.reviewText:
Sanfrancisco Mariott is the best location for sight seeing.
It is very convinent to go to everywere in and around Sanfrancisco. They also provided good service and beautiful smile. I think it is enough value for 4 star hotel.

review.title: Excellent Hotel!
review.reviewText: First time in San Francisco and we enjoyed our stay at the Marriott tremendously!  Excellent, friendly service.  Outstanding view from the top floor club!

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: It's close to everything, easy to walk around to shop, to eat, and sightseeing.

review.title: Location, lolcation, location, and some more location
review.reviewText: We found the hotel location to be ideal. The BART commute from the SF airport to Powell station (4th street exit) got us to less than a block from the hotel. The hotel is less than 10 minutes walking distance to SFMOMA (San Francisco Musueam of Modern Art), Union Square shopping, the great Apple showroom, Cable Cars, Macy's with the Cheesecake Factory, Metreon group of theatres, IMAX, and arcades, street chess, over 50 restaurants from around the world, and many other local attractions. The concierge service, restaurants at the Marriott, bar on the top floor, and the coffee shop were all great. You can survive San Francisco without a car and all the parking hassles. Within a day we were able to locate all the BART and CALTrain stations, master the schedule, and commute to Oakland, Berkeley, and Palo Alto from the hotel.  In addition to all these benefits, we also got a significant discount from the rack rate through Expedia.  Next time, we plan a trip to San Francisco, Marriott and Expedia will be on the top of our list.

review.title: Excellent stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I could spent excellent nights in Mariott San Francisco. The room was spatious, clean, and especially fitness center was great.

review.title: Always a pleasure
review.reviewText: A beautiful hotel with helpful staff in a great location. No complaints!

review.title: Great Hotel, location perfect.
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for 3 nights over thanksgiving weekend,
the hotel is very centrally located on 4th Street 
at Market so you can catch a tram to Fishermans Wharf
any time of day.  Shops are all around this area.
May see a few homeless people wandering around but its
the city.  Great Hotel to stay in. The staff are very
friendly and helpful.

review.title: Don't bring your car
review.reviewText:
The Marriott San Francisco is an elegant hotel in an excellent location.  Service is superb and rooms bigger and nicer than similar San Francisco hotels.  Be sure to have a cocktail in their rooftop lounge.

My only gripe is the price of parking.  In a big city, you expect to pay to park, but $43 is above and beyond reasonable.  I can't recall any warnings about this charge when I made my room reservation, as it may have affected my chouce of places to stay.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Nice location for shopping, cable car access, and restaurants.

review.title: Hotel: Marriott San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel San Francisco was within walking distance of the Powell Street BART station, cable cars, shopping malls, Union Square, and lots of great restaurants.

review.title: Marriot SF
review.reviewText: Service was great, food was good, elevators fast and meeting rooms very adequate.

review.title: San Francisco business trip
review.reviewText:
Centrally located and convenient to the Moscone Convention Center. Typical large, impersonal hotel operated by a major chain.
Somewhat overpriced on meal service, food was adequate but not enough to generate any rave reviews.

review.title: Marriott San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice - great location with ease of getting to all attractions.  Needs more chairs in rooms - only one and not comfortable...

review.title: The nicest hotel in San Francisco...
review.reviewText:
What a fantastic place to stay.  Over the years I have stayed at the Hilton, Hyatt, Grand Hyatt, Crowne Plaza, Triton and others.  These last two trips I stayed at the Marriott.  By far, the nicest hotel in SFO! All of the staff are very friendly and helpful, and the place is spotless!
I highly recommend the Marriott!!
